story:
I want you to be a part of a dream coming true! Please support reforestation efforts in Madagascar.

I will be travelling to Madagascar with some of the lovely folks over at Eden Reforestation Projects. I began working with Eden through my employer, Magic Flight, and sought an opportunity for our successful business relationship to deepen and go to the next level, forming a strategic partnership.

My workplace will now be embracing the country of Madagascar and adopting one or two specific reforestation sites. We'll be building meaningful relationships with the villagers we will effectively employ who will be planting and tending to this forest. We will take responsibility for meeting the unique needs of the land and the people, and empowering them to build a sustainable life. I am traveling to Madagascar as a Magic Flight community ambassador, the fortunate soul who gets to establish this ongoing personal connection between our community and the villagers in Madagascar raising our new forest. You can read some of Eden's blog posts about the work done so far in Madagascar here:

http://blog.edenprojects.org/category/madagascar

Why I'm asking for your help: 

This campaign is about trees, and it's also about people- people breathing easier. It's about collaborating and pooling our resources to transform a community. I believe it is time to say yes, I love this planet and I want to be a part of improving the quality of life on it!

I am choosing to pursue funding for my travels through community support because I want YOU to be a part of this incredible opportunity to transform lives and lands. From my years in service to community organizing, I know in the depth of my being that the potency of a collective effort is far greater than the sum of its parts. 

My trip takes place June 13 - 29. Here's a breakdown of expected costs of this trip.(Updated 5/28)  

$2800: Flight from Southern California to Madagascar

$275: Flight in Madagascar from Antananarivo to Mahajunga

$250: Helicopter(!) ride from Mahajunga to Mahabana 

$900: Required and recommended vaccines, immunizations, and antimalarial medications for travel to Madagascar

$1000 Estimate of costs for food, lodging, travel insurance, visa, and other travel goods and services. 

All funds leftover from this budget will go to planting trees. 

Any amount raised up to $15000 in excess of the budget will be MATCHED by Magic Flight and put towards planting trees at the selected reforestation site. My true goal is to raise enough funds for 300,000 trees to be planted at the selected reforestation site, to transform the lives of the Malagawy people. 

If you would like your donation to be tax deductible, please contact me directly to make arrangements for that.  

Please learn more about these incredible companies committed to reforestation!

Visit: www.magic-flight.com/company.php  and 

http://www.edenprojects.org/aboutus

Thank you for taking the time to learn about this monumental journey in my life. Your words of enthusiasm, encouragement, and support are much needed! I am entering into some uncharted territory for myself and I am so grateful to be fortified by your love.

If you are so inspired, please use the power of your voice in social media to spread awareness of this campaign. Maybe you don't have a dime to spare, but you might have a few friends, co-workers, family members, or an entire community who do.

 Questions? dp.wiggles@gmail.com

story:
UPDATE 05/22/13:

A couple donations are not reflected in the total, due to donor preferences:

$1030 donation from Jeff Shields to pay for the Permaculture Certificate Course.

$25 anonymous donation by check in the mail (anonymous to you, but not me!)

TOTAL RAISED: $1321

Blessings! Tamara

____________________________________________

FROM FOOD DESERTS to FOOD FORESTS!

FIRST, please watch the video above. It says it all in a nutshell. This campaign provides seed money for (1) implementing two food forests, (2)gaining certification in Geoff’s Lawton’s Permaculture Design, and (3)creating a springboard for making a positive change one edible organic garden at a time.

If you want the quick pitch so you can get back in the garden, here it is.

WHY?

Climate Change. Food Crisis. Crisis in Consciousness. We are living at a time when it is crucial that we take mindful action about creating positive change. This is one area where I can help make a difference. By joining a worldwide movement of permaculture designers and educators, we can reverse climate change, feed everyone nutrient-dense organic food, and experience our interconnectedness. 

WHAT?

This campaign provides seed money for implementing two food forests within next 6-12 months and gaining certification in Geoff’s Lawton’s Permaculture Design. This seed project will then lead to more edible gardens and more people who are educated in these life-changing methods.

WHO?

My name is Tamara Thebert and I practice holistic counseling and ecopsychology at Holos Institute in the San Francisco Bay Area. I am a transplant from Chicago.

WHEN?

NOW. It is urgent. 

HOW?

Take a look at the perks to the right and choose the donation best suited to you.

THANKS!

 

FOR THOSE WHO WANT MORE INFORMATION... 

A graduate of California Institute of Integral Studies Integral Counseling Psychology Master's program, I have been practicing psychospiritual counseling and ecopsychology at Holos Institute for Holistic Counseling and Ecopsychology in the San Francisco Bay Area as part of requirements to become a Marriage and Family Therapist. While most of you know about psychospiritual counseling as a mind, body, spirit approach, many are still learning about ecopsychology. One of the main tenants of ecopsychology is that the well-being of human beings is intricately connected to the well-being of the earth and the whole web of life. It is implied that healthy people maintain a respectful and sustainable relationship to the natural world and the people who inhabit it. You can learn more about my professional work at by clicking on the links at the bottom of the page.

Being mostly Mexican and Irish, I have always felt a deep spiritual connection to our Mother Earth, yet my inspiration to learn more formally came from my beloved guru Amma, Sri Mata Amritanandamayi Devi. With Her encouragement to plant 1000 fruit trees on the land at the M.A. Center in San Ramon, a number of permaculture courses are continuously offered.

My next obvious – and exciting! – step is to plant a food forest using the training provided while earning Geoff Lawton's permaculture design certification.

I am ready to dig deep into the Permaculture Design Course and continue to be of service to the earth and the people that want to reconnect by growing their own food forests... which is why I am already grateful for your donation!

 

CREATING SOLUTIONS

Most of us are aware of the growing food crisis and the companies that are attempting to take over land and seed and the suffering it is causing.  Fighting Monsanto is great, but designing and planting our own food forests right where we live and work is more fun! and much more realistic than waiting around for someone else to decide when we can stop feeding ourselves and our children poison. I want to help at the grassroots level where people are doing our best to eat organic, nutrient-dense foods.

How is this possible? THE RIPPLE EFFECT.

STEP 1: Learn from the experts!

I’ve learned so much in the past 10 years, from my own gardening, and especially from experts like Soil Foodweb scientist Elaine Ingham, but haven’t had the opportunity to take a permaculture design course and apply the principles. I was SO INSPIRED by Geoff Lawton’s methods that I started creating this Indiegogo campaign the night I saw his video on urban permaculture in micro-spaces.

With your donation, you can help me gain cutting-edge knowledge that will empower us to take this food crisis into our own hands... right in our own backyards.

Check out the PERKS on the right. 

STEP 2: Plant a food forest! Document it. Share the knowledge.

I currently have access to two properties in the San Francisco Bay Area with plenty of opportunity to create a food forest. They are conveniently within 30 minutes of each other near the foothills of Mount Diablo.

Your donation will help me learn and apply the knowledge to actual sites as well as gain access to an international community of permaculture designers!

STEP 3: REPEAT

Help as many people as possible create their own, reasonably-priced, low-maintenance, sustainable organic food forest with systems that will secure health and well-being.

Your donation is the first step to a bigger dream of being of service to the people who need food, beauty, and connection to the earth.

We can stop being dependent upon corporations whose agenda it is to take over the food supply by putting toxins on our plates. And this isn’t just about food or the earth. This is about the sacredness of the people, too. Everybody, EVERYBODY - no matter our gender, race, ethnicity, orientation, gender identity, size, ability, class, religion, or age - deserves nurturance and beauty.

 

CHECK OUT THE PERKS

While the benefits of this seed fund go well beyond yourself, see the sidebar to the right for your individual perks when making a donation.

In a nutshell, I will use the $9000 raised to:

  1. Create and help implement the designs for two spaces within the next 6 months-1 year (funds will allow me to continue seeing clients part-time while also affording me the time and resources to get these projects off the ground) 
  2. Take Geoff Lawton’s Permaculture Design Course (FULLY FUNDED! as of May 9, 2013 - upfront donor)
  3. Purchase seeds, little green babies, and other necessary supplies
  4. Pay Indiegogo and PayPal Fees

WOW! If I raise more money than I need, I will use the additional funds to implement more designs and/or take an advanced courses. The more you donate, the more time and resources I have to make an impact in people's lives and transition more fully into my life's work.

YES! If I raise at least $1030, I will take the course and use the remaining funds for as many materials as possible while living modestly and creating two food forests within the next 6 months to a year. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute dollars and cents, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

If you can't donate money:

  • Tell as many people as you can. Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about this campaign!
  • Donate other goodies! (or convince someone else to donate!) Please contact me for detailed list and appropriate zones. Re-used materials in good condition appreciated where appropriate!
  • organic trees, berries, veggies, herbs, flowers
  • garden tools (Pruners, Loppers, Wheelbarrows)
  • trellises, large planting containers like half wine barrels
  • compost, innoculants, micro-organisms for compost tea/extract, brewer bags
  • dehydrator
  • Last but not least, contact me if you would like to donate a property/home in the SF Bay Area appropriate for a food forest project where I can live, work, and coordinate the property makeover. Terms are negotiable. Minimum one year residency needed for each property.

If you are not convinced yet, let Geoff convince you. He says it best. You may be inspired to take the course yourself!

http://www.geofflawton.com/sp/13753-sales-page

Let's Plant the Future - PLEDGE Today and SHARE This INCREDIBLE Project on FaceBook and E-Mail!

story:
Versione italiana a seguire


We are citizens, artists, farmers, architects differently involved in the phenomenon of the land abandonment. We want to consider the countryside beyond the agricultural production.


                   Imballaggio dell'uva da tavola ad Adelfia. Saverio Macchia, 1985


We need your support for the following: 

• Open a stable art platform to re-use the rejected land as a cultural space;

• Realize the Agricultural Film Festival as the first moment of this platform (we need to rent specific materials/appliances for film screenings, workshops, music and art performances);

• Accomodation and fee for the artists, film directors, researchers invited;

• Publish the book which presents the entire process of research we are carrying on from several months now.


     
 Nicola Catella and Anila Shehaj

AGRICULTURE IS NOT A                           METAPHOR OF FAILURE !

__________________________________________________

In Italy, during the 30s and 40s, thousands of   peasants fought against big landowners who ignored suffering people and harsh reality.

The fights for the redistribution of land, as the main economic sustenance for most of families, give life to the so-called grandi occupazioni* in South, but even in Central and North Italy.


                     *Occupazione delle terre incolte di Sicilia. Renato Guttuso, 1949


After World War II, Italy, as well as other European countries, has been experiencing an intense economic development period called boom economico, synonym of the new consumer society and new desires. 

Agriculture is once again being rejected also in terms of perception: the young generations of the 60s and 70s begin to dream of a different life, freed from agriculture. The myth of success, translated in being a lawyer, a doctor, being educated, becomes the new status symbol amongst wealthy farmers. This gets materialized in a physical and cultural migration.  

Today we see the results of these attempts: a lot of abandoned land and the remaining “field survivors” get tagged as “ignorant and useless, unable to be other than farmers”.


1979

2013

We're working to re-create connections between society and agriculture, city and countryside.

The project intentions are to involve the community of farmers, workers, young generations of landowners in a collective dialogue.


"We still cultivate the vineyards but when is time to recollect most of us don't do it anymore."


                                          Adelfia, countryside abandonment

__________________________________________________

The Film Festival is the first moment of our platform. Have a look on this excerpt of the programme: some of the movies, invited artists and groups.

                           FILMS


     

     





MUSIC PERFORMANCE  

   

   


                      PUBLIC TALKS 

         




                       RESEARCH

Trying to have a closer view on the agricultural sector ability to support the consumption (food resources, textile fibers, bio-fuels), we notice that Italy, like other countries of early industrialization, consumes more than its agricultural soil can produce. 

Italy is the 3rd country in the EU for its deficit of agricultural land and the 5th worldwide.The loss of land is caused by 2 main factors: land abandonment and soil sealing. Soil sealing is the covering of land with "waterproof" materials as concrete, metal, glass, asphalt, plastic in such a way as to prevent the ecological functions of soil. It is deeply rooted in the economic sphere: the construction industry is one of the most stable and profitable.

The ICI - a communal toll to be paid for real-estate property (1992) was, until 2008, one of the main entrances of the financial income of Italian municipalities. The trend is not reversed by the IMU - the new toll that replaced ICI. 

The same applies to the urbanization costs that municipalities receive from construction enterprises / individuals (higher rates for new buildings than for renovation). It is not related to demographic trends: the population since 1950 has increased by 28% while construction activity has increased by 166%. 

It is a phenomenon spread over a social and cultural matrix that attributes little value to the environment, agriculture, while enhances the building activity in all its forms. 

Data elaboration - work in progress


_____________________________________________________________________________

We have many funny and serious perks. Be a supporter of our project and have a look at the following rewards:


_____________________________________________________________________________

_____________________________________________________________________________

_____________________________________________________________________________

_____________________________________________________________________________

_____________________________________________________________________________

_____________________________________________________________________________

_____________________________________________________________________________

_____________________________________________________________________________

_____________________________________________________________________________

_____________________________________________________________________________

_____________________________________________________________________________
_____________________________________________________________________________

_____________________________________________________________________________


_____________________________________________________________________________

VERSIONE ITALIANA (breve)


LZSP - PIATTAFORMA TRA ARTE E AGRICOLTURA / Proiezioni di Film, incontri pubblici e arti performative, per riconsiderare la cultura rurale. 

11 - 14 Settembre / Adelfia, Italia.

Siamo un gruppo di cittadini, architetti, artisti agricoltori coinvolti in forme diverse nel fenomeno dell'abbandono. Vogliamo riconsiderare la campagna oltre la produzione agricola.


Con il vostro supporto possiamo:

• Aprire una piattaforma stabile di ricerca e ri-uso della “terra rifiutata” come spazio culturale;

• Realizzare il festival di cinema agricolo come primo momento collettivo della piattaforma (noleggio proiettori, teli di proiezione, diritti SIAE, etc.);

• Accogliere e ospitare gli artisti coinvolti, i registi e i ricercatori;

• Pubblicare la ricerca sull'abbandono che portiamo avanti da Novembre del 2013.


L'AGRICOLTURA NON E' UNA METAFORA DEL FALLIMENTO!

_____________________________________________________________________________

In Italia, durante gli anni '30 e '40, migliaia di contadini lottano contro i latifondisti che ignorano la loro sofferenza di una dura e povera vita di lavoro nei campi.

La lotta per la redistribuzione della terra, come primo e necessario strumento di sussistenza di molte famiglie contadine, da vita alle sommosse popolari note come grandi occupazioni, sia nel Sud che nel Centro e Nord Italia.

Dopo la II Guerra Mondiale, l'Italia, come l'Europa, ha vissuto un'intenso sviluppo chiamato boom economico, sinonimo della società dei consumi e di nuovi desideri. L' Agricoltura viene anch'essa rifiutata, specie in termini di percezione: le giovani generazioni degli anni '60 e '70 iniziano a sognare una vita diversa, lontana dai campi. Il mito del successo, tradotto dalla volontà di essere avvocato, acculturato, medico, diviene il nuovo status symbol che investe anche i vecchi genitori contadini di questi giovani figli del pop. Si materializza, specie a Sud Italia, una migrazione fisica e culturale.

Oggi vediamo i risultati di questi tentativi: ettari di terra in abbandono e i pochi lavoratori ancora impegnati nei campi, definiti come “ignoranti, incapaci a fare altro che non lavorare in agricoltura”. 

Siamo impegnati nel ricreare connessioni tra società e agricoltura, città e campagna; affrontando l'abbandono, comprendendone le ragioni e le criticità; Il progetto intende coinvolgere questi lavoratori in un dialogo collettivo.

Il Festival è il primo momento della piattaforma artistica a cui stiamo lavorando: di seguito alcuni tra i film, musicisti e gruppi di agricoltori invitati.

_____________________________________________________________________________

                              FILM


SENZA TRUCCO LE DONNE DEL VINO AL NATURALE

Regista: Giulia Graglia

2013

durata 65'

Dal riposo vegetativo invernale ai colori della vendemmia, dalla Sicilia al Trentino, quattro ritratti di donne intense e coraggiose, diverse tra loro ma accomunate da una passione senza compromessi. Il filo rosso che le lega è il vino, inteso come frutto della terra e nient’altro: niente concimi chimici né diserbanti, niente interventi in cantina, lieviti selezionati o additivi. Dora, Nicoletta, Elisabetta e Arianna con i loro racconti, la passione per il loro lavoro e la forte presenza fisica, disegnano un universo femminile ben diverso da quello della cronaca e dei palinsesti televisivi. Queste sono donne che - rubiamo la definizione alla scrittrice sarda Michela Murgia – “sanno, sanno fare e fanno”, depositarie di un antico vincolo con la terra e i cicli naturali che non è pura filosofia, ma dedizione costante, scelta di vita e pratica quotidiana.


LEGARE COLLEGARE

Regista: Tonino Casula

Performer: Maria Lai

1981

durata 15'

L'artista Maria Lai legò alla montagna di Ulassai tutti gli abitanti, le porte, le vie e le case con circa 27 km di nastri di stoffa celeste. L'operazione materiale durò tre giorni circa, il primo giorno vennero tagliate le stoffe, il secondo giorno vennero distribuite e il terzo venne unito il paese alla montagna coinvolgendo donne, bambini, pastori, anziani. Furono anche coinvolti degli scalatori.


IDILLIO INFRANTO

Regista: Nello Mauri

1931

durata 50‘

Il regista umbro realizzò ad Acquaviva delle Fonti, tra il 1930 e il 1931, uno degli ultimi ﬁlm muti del cinema italiano.

La protagonista femminile è la diva Ida Mantovani da Milano. Trama: Carlo e Maria sono amanti. Lui è tornato dalla città, da Bari dove si è appena laureato. Lei è la ﬁglia di un fattore legato alla terra, quella di Alberobello, arsa dal sole e difficile da spietrare. Carlo teme che Maria lo tradisca, ignaro che il padre l'abbia venduta in sposa al padrone Silvestro per sanare i suoi debiti. Il film recentemente restaurato dalla Cineteca Nazionale di Roma è musicato magistralmente da Nico Girasole.

_____________________________________________________________________________

               INCONTRI PUBBLICI 


PARCO DEI FRUTTI MINORI

Parco dei frutti minori è un progetto di rigenerazione di terreni pubblici nelle aree rurali di Castiglione d'Otranto, attivato dalla comunità locale in collaborazione con artisti, pensatori e agricoltori radicali, al ﬁne di ridare dignità ad aree pubbliche abbandonate e metà tra discariche di riﬁuti e materiali inerti. ll parco nasce dal desiderio di restituire luoghi alla bellezza. alla memoria e al futuro, di ripensare la tradizione rurale, di creare spazi di sperimentazione e riflessione, con la consapevolezza del valore della terra, del lavoro, del vivere insieme.


CANAPUGLIA

Canapuglia è un progetto che consiste nel promuovere la coltivazione e l'impiego in diversi campi della ‘cannabis sativa’, la canapa utile, che non contiene principi attivi psicotropi ma può fornire materie prime a basso impatto ambientale utilizzabili nel settore alimentare ( semi, olio e farina), tessile, farmaceutico, della cosmesi naturale ( prodotti per la cura del corpo), della bio-edilizia (pannelli termo-acustici, bio-compositi), delle energie rinnovabili (biomassa, bio-combustibili). In termini di cellulosa, un ettaro di canapa produce quanto quattro ettari di bosco in circa 4 mesi. 

_____________________________________________________________________________

            MUSICA / PERFORMANCE


OH PETROLEUM

Oh Petroleum è un cantautore lontano e confidenziale al contempo, sfuggente e sanguigno. Nella sua musica sono i contrasti e i chiaroscuri a tracciare le linee di una drammaturgia musicale personale che lo avvicina ai poeti decadenti e romantici, al cantautorato che sa di terra e polvere lasciata posare sulle cose. Il suo mondo è intrigante, solitario, ogni sua canzone concessa è un regalo. Esce nell'aprile 2014 il suo nuovo album “Memory of Mine Memory to Be”.


EMANUELA ASCARI

Nata a Sassuolo è un'artista italiana. Per l’a.a. 2012-2013 è docente del corso di “Progettazione di interventi urbani e territoriali” presso l’Accademia di Belle Arti di Bologna.

_____________________________________________________________________________
story_txt:
Versione italiana a seguire



We are citizens, artists, farmers, architects differently involved in the phenomenon of the land abandonment. We want to consider the countryside beyond the agricultural production.

                   Imballaggio dell'uva da tavola ad Adelfia. Saverio Macchia, 1985We need your support for the following: • Open a stable art platform to re-use the rejected land as a cultural space;
• Realize the Agricultural Film Festival as the first moment of this platform (we need to rent specific materials/appliances for film screenings, workshops, music and art performances);
• Accomodation and fee for the artists, film directors, researchers invited;
• Publish the book which presents the entire process of research we are carrying on from several months now.

      Nicola Catella and Anila ShehajAGRICULTURE IS NOT A                           METAPHOR OF FAILURE !__________________________________________________In Italy, during the 30s and 40s, thousands of   peasants fought against big landowners who ignored suffering people and harsh reality.The fights for the redistribution of land, as the main economic sustenance for most of families, give life to the so-called grandi occupazioni* in South, but even in Central and North Italy.

                     *Occupazione delle terre incolte di Sicilia. Renato Guttuso, 1949

After World War II, Italy, as well as other European countries, has been experiencing an intense economic development period called boom economico, synonym of the new consumer society and new desires. 
Agriculture is once again being rejected also in terms of perception: the young generations of the 60s and 70s begin to dream of a different life, freed from agriculture. The myth of success, translated in being a lawyer, a doctor, being educated, becomes the new status symbol amongst wealthy farmers. This gets materialized in a physical and cultural migration.  
Today we see the results of these attempts: a lot of abandoned land and the remaining “field survivors” get tagged as “ignorant and useless, unable to be other than farmers”.







1979




2013

We're working to re-create connections between society and agriculture, city and countryside.



The project intentions are to involve the community of farmers, workers, young generations of landowners in a collective dialogue.





"We still cultivate the vineyards but when is time to recollect most of us don't do it anymore."






                                          Adelfia, countryside abandonment
__________________________________________________
The Film Festival is the first moment of our platform. Have a look on this excerpt of the programme: some of the movies, invited artists and groups.








                           FILMS


     



     







MUSIC PERFORMANCE  

   
   

                      PUBLIC TALKS 

          







                       RESEARCH


Trying to have a closer view on the agricultural sector ability to support the consumption (food resources, textile fibers, bio-fuels), we notice that Italy, like other countries of early industrialization, consumes more than its agricultural soil can produce. 
Italy is the 3rd country in the EU for its deficit of agricultural land and the 5th worldwide.The loss of land is caused by 2 main factors: land abandonment and soil sealing. Soil sealing is the covering of land with "waterproof" materials as concrete, metal, glass, asphalt, plastic in such a way as to prevent the ecological functions of soil. It is deeply rooted in the economic sphere: the construction industry is one of the most stable and profitable.
The ICI - a communal toll to be paid for real-estate property (1992) was, until 2008, one of the main entrances of the financial income of Italian municipalities. The trend is not reversed by the IMU - the new toll that replaced ICI. 

The same applies to the urbanization costs that municipalities receive from construction enterprises / individuals (higher rates for new buildings than for renovation). It is not related to demographic trends: the population since 1950 has increased by 28% while construction activity has increased by 166%. 

It is a phenomenon spread over a social and cultural matrix that attributes little value to the environment, agriculture, while enhances the building activity in all its forms. 

Data elaboration - work in progress

VERSIONE ITALIANA (breve)


LZSP - PIATTAFORMA TRA ARTE E AGRICOLTURA / Proiezioni di Film, incontri pubblici e arti performative, per riconsiderare la cultura rurale. 
11 - 14 Settembre / Adelfia, Italia.





Siamo
un gruppo di cittadini, architetti, artisti agricoltori coinvolti in
forme diverse nel fenomeno dell'abbandono.
Vogliamo riconsiderare la campagna oltre la produzione agricola.


Con il vostro supporto possiamo: 

• Aprire
una piattaforma stabile di ricerca e ri-uso
della “terra rifiutata” come spazio culturale;

• Realizzare
il festival di cinema agricolo come
primo momento collettivo della piattaforma (noleggio proiettori, teli di proiezione, diritti SIAE, etc.);

• Accogliere e ospitare gli artisti
coinvolti, i registi e i ricercatori;

• Pubblicare
la ricerca sull'abbandono che
portiamo avanti da Novembre del 2013.


L'AGRICOLTURA NON E' UNA METAFORA DEL FALLIMENTO!
_____________________________________________________________________________

In
Italia, durante gli anni '30 e '40, migliaia di contadini lottano
contro i latifondisti che ignorano la loro sofferenza di una dura e
povera vita di lavoro nei campi. 


La
lotta per la redistribuzione della terra, come primo e necessario
strumento di sussistenza di molte famiglie contadine, da vita alle
sommosse popolari note come grandi
occupazioni,
sia nel Sud che nel Centro e Nord Italia. 


Dopo
la II Guerra Mondiale, l'Italia, come l'Europa, ha vissuto un'intenso sviluppo chiamato boom
economico,
sinonimo della società dei consumi e di nuovi desideri. L'
Agricoltura viene anch'essa rifiutata, specie in termini di
percezione:
le giovani generazioni degli anni '60 e '70 iniziano a sognare una
vita diversa, lontana dai campi. Il mito del successo, tradotto dalla
volontà di essere avvocato, acculturato, medico, diviene il nuovo
status symbol che investe anche i vecchi genitori contadini di questi
giovani figli del pop. Si
materializza, specie a Sud Italia, una migrazione fisica e culturale.



Oggi
vediamo i
risultati di questi tentativi: ettari di terra in abbandono e i pochi
lavoratori ancora impegnati nei campi, definiti come “ignoranti,
incapaci a fare altro che non lavorare in agricoltura”. 
Siamo
impegnati nel ricreare connessioni tra società e agricoltura, città
e campagna; affrontando l'abbandono, comprendendone le ragioni e le
criticità;
Il
progetto intende coinvolgere questi lavoratori in un dialogo
collettivo.

Il
Festival è il primo momento della piattaforma artistica a cui stiamo
lavorando: di seguito alcuni tra i film, musicisti e gruppi di
agricoltori invitati.
_____________________________________________________________________________

                              FILM


SENZA
TRUCCO LE
DONNE DEL VINO AL NATURALE

Regista:
Giulia Graglia
2013

durata
65'


Dal
riposo vegetativo invernale ai colori della vendemmia, dalla Sicilia
al Trentino, quattro ritratti di donne intense e coraggiose, diverse
tra loro ma accomunate da una passione senza compromessi. Il filo
rosso che le lega è il vino, inteso come frutto della terra e
nient’altro: niente concimi chimici né diserbanti, niente
interventi in cantina, lieviti selezionati o additivi. Dora,
Nicoletta, Elisabetta e Arianna con i loro racconti, la passione per
il loro lavoro e la forte presenza fisica, disegnano un universo
femminile ben diverso da quello della cronaca e dei palinsesti
televisivi. Queste sono donne che - rubiamo la definizione alla
scrittrice sarda Michela Murgia – “sanno, sanno fare e fanno”,
depositarie di un antico vincolo con la terra e i cicli naturali che
non è pura filosofia, ma dedizione costante, scelta di vita e
pratica quotidiana.









LEGARE
COLLEGARE

Regista:
 Tonino Casula
Performer: Maria Lai

1981

durata
15'


L'artista
Maria Lai legò alla montagna di Ulassai tutti gli abitanti, le
porte, le vie e le case con circa 27 km di nastri di stoffa celeste.
L'operazione materiale durò tre giorni circa, il primo giorno
vennero tagliate le stoffe, il secondo giorno vennero distribuite e
il terzo venne unito il paese alla montagna coinvolgendo donne,
bambini, pastori, anziani. Furono anche coinvolti degli scalatori.





IDILLIO
INFRANTO

Regista:
Nello Mauri

1931

durata
50‘


Il
regista umbro realizzò ad Acquaviva delle Fonti, tra il 1930 e il
1931, uno degli ultimi ﬁlm muti del cinema italiano.
La
protagonista femminile è la diva Ida Mantovani da Milano. Trama: Carlo e
Maria sono amanti. Lui è tornato dalla città, da Bari dove si è appena laureato. Lei è la ﬁglia di un fattore legato alla terra, quella di Alberobello, arsa dal sole e difficile da spietrare. Carlo
teme che Maria lo tradisca, ignaro che il padre l'abbia venduta in
sposa al padrone Silvestro per sanare i suoi debiti. Il film
recentemente restaurato dalla Cineteca Nazionale di Roma è musicato
magistralmente da Nico Girasole.

story:
Short summary

Hello....my name is Ofe and I am a firm believer that economy and environment go hand in hand and can help each other into making the world a better place. I have worked for environmental NGO's but always felt like a meaningful and constant change should be brought in people's mentality. They should be offered  tools for positive change and not just random events with little impact. So.... from 14th (yes Valentine's Day) February 2013 I started a project for collecting used cooking oil in student dormitories in Cluj-Napoca (the second largest city in Romania). I have bought buckets and containers for each kitchen in each dorm, signed collaboration contracts with all universities in the city, provided informative posters, held meetings and organized transportation. The project works and oil is constantly collected so that it reached 4 tons up till the present. In this way water, soil and pipes were saved. Also this precious resource was used to produce biodiesel an alternative fuel which reduces diesel fuel pollution with up to 70%.    

My dream went further and I have extended to two more cities: Oradea(my home town) and Suceava (my boyfriend's home town). 21 more university cities remain and then the next target is the whole population.

What I need?

Right now I am low on cash regarding transport and accomodation in these 21 cities. In Romania a round trip to any location costs about 24 euros which means 504 euros for 21 trips. Accomodation is around 20 euro (in a hostel) for 2 nights which is enought for me to sign the contract so this means 420 euros.  In total this means aproximately 1000 euros.  

The impact

The impact will not only be on the environmental side it will also be on the social and educational one as these students will form a habbit of collecting and recycling resources. They will grow up as responsible adults who will pass this mentality to future generations. Because of their age their mannerisms are easily changed and modelled and it is important to do it in a positive way. 

I also believe that seeing this project they will have ideas for more and implement other useful initiatives.  

Risks and challenges

Of course collecting used cooking oil is not always easy as it is sticky, smelly, easily inflammable. If only a few students are not careful disasters could strike and the project could become extinct. It can also pollute more if small quantities are collected only, as fuel used for transportation also pollutes the environment.

Many universities are not receptive to the project as they believe that nothing can be done because students are iresponsible and careless and they cannot be educated in a few years if at home they lacked this element. 

All in all, it is worth trying because even if a few will always be conservative and problems will arise  the idea is to find new solutions and the obstacles are actually opportunities which guide us towards improvement. 

Other ways you can help

Everyone can help and this initiative could be done in your own country I am open to ideas and experience sharing just contact me on ofelia.zaha@gmail.com. I can provide posters and study papers about used cooking oil. Also, if you want you can like the facebook page https://www.facebook.com/viridivos and share your own ideas which will always be useful and appreciated.

Thank you and let's do our part and recycle smart!

story:
My Story

My name is Rachel Schneider and I am an 18 year old university student. My first year at university has been a bit of a hard one, and I've found myself struggling with depression these past few months. So I made the decision that I needed to change something in my life to make it better. Through the student volunteer program, ISV, I have been accepted to travel to Thailand this summer to work with abandoned, orphaned and abused elephants. As unbelievably excited as I am, I need as much help as I can get to make it there. Any small donations that you might be able to help me reach my goal would be much appreciated.


The Impact

The Asian elephant is disappearing in Thailand and ISV volunteers have been working with one of Asia's premier conservation parks to help save this amazing animal. Located in the north of Thailand, the park aims to care for elephants that have been rescued from forced labor under terrible conditions, the tourism industry, or as orphans.  The center cares for them, while contributing to the promotion of positive animal-based tourism and conservation. Volunteers help greatly with the operations of the center by feeding, bathing, and cleaning the elephants as well as maintaining and enriching their habitat and building new structures for park visitors.

ISV partners with other rescue centers located in southern Thailand that focus on wild animals such as gibbons and macaques,  that were illegally poached for the pet trade and subsequently mistreated.  An overarching goal is to help prevent, educate and actively campaign against hunting and cruelty to wild animals. A specific aim is to rehabilitate these animals wherever possible and return them to the wild. .  Animals that are too disabled or injured to return to the wild are provided with long-term care to ensure their  survival. Volunteers provide vital assistance to the operation of these sanctuaries. As a volunteer your tasks include involvement with the daily cleaning rounds (cleaning feeding trays, enclosures etc.), educating visitors and general maintenance /light construction tasks around the sanctuary. In addition, animals may become stressed living in captivity: One of the most rewarding aspects is working on the enclosures, as volunteers are important contributors to Cenriching the enclosures with structures, games and other features designed to positively engage the animals to minimize their stress levels.  Volunteers also play an important part in  monitoring released gibbons; trekking through rainforest to record the behaviors of these wild animals is an experience of a lifetime!

One of the key components to maximizing our achievements and creating a lasting impact in Thailand is that on each wildlife conservation project, ISV volunteers do more than just work with animals. Volunteers have also spent time helping to educate tourists and locals along popular tourist beaches, visiting local schools and reaching out to communities. In Hill Tribe villages, volunteers assist with community development projects (building roads, toilet blocks, water tanks, etc.), educating local communities (e.g., teaching English, educating about illegal poaching, conservation and humane animal practices, etc.) and encouraging sustainable development practices. Outreach and development is a big component of all of our volunteer projects and when combined with serious conservation efforts, it creates a lasting impact.

What I Need & What You Get

When it comes down to specific price breakdowns, the trip itself cost 6,412.00 for four weeks traveling and volunteering in Thailand. What ever I can get from friends, family and cooperation will be going directly to fund my trip. Whatever I can't make, I will be spending the money myself. But 5 dollars from a friend or even a stranger will help me make my way.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help me spread the word folks! Tell your friends, family and coworkers and hopefully I can make way there!

story:
The tribal membership is now scattered throughout the United States, without a homeland to go to for festivals, homecomings, pow wows or to live on.  Principal Chief, Billy Little Red Wolf Chance, has led the Tribe for many years, struggling to hold the people together.  Without a homeland, the people,  language, and  customs are quickly fading away.

It is the dream  to once again establish a homeland back where  ancestors lived in Alabama, before being driven out by federal troops.  It is important  to return to the sacred grounds where ancestors are buried.

The dream of land to shepard the wildlife ancestors cherished, and move the herd of buffalo and cattle, now being held in Texas, until a homeland can be reestablished in Alabama.

.

The land we are seeking is now used as a hunting preserve and timber farming.

Your donations will go directly to purchase the land these people are desperate to return to.  You can make possible a homeland to reunite a people before their Tribe and culture is forever lost.
story_txt:
The tribal membership is now scattered throughout the United States, without a homeland to go to for festivals, homecomings, pow wows or to live on.  Principal Chief, Billy Little Red Wolf Chance, has led the Tribe for many years, struggling to hold the people together.  Without a homeland, the people,  language, and  customs are quickly fading away.
It is the dream  to once again establish a homeland back where  ancestors lived in Alabama, before being driven out by federal troops.  It is important  to return to the sacred grounds where ancestors are buried.
The dream of land to shepard the wildlife ancestors cherished, and move the herd of buffalo and cattle, now being held in Texas, until a homeland can be reestablished in Alabama.
.
The land we are seeking is now used as a hunting preserve and timber farming.
Your donations will go directly to purchase the land these people are desperate to return to.  You can make possible a homeland to reunite a people before their Tribe and culture is forever lost.

story:
In the late 1990s, the most important bee that Americans never heard of almost died out.  Last year, we found some in a completely unexpected place.  They may be coming back, and we may be able to help – but we need to move quickly.

Help us find out.

Introduction

Everyone knows that the bees are hurting.  The news is full of colony collapse, empty hives, and the crazy prices that farmers have to pay to pollinate their crops.

Fewer people know that, when it comes to pollination, honeybees are not the only game in town.  In fact, they are an alien species in North America: they arrived with European settlers.  Before that, the Americas and the fruits, berries, and vegetables that grew here – tomatoes, peppers, blueberries, squash – did just fine with the local talent.  Many of them actually do better when they’re visited by native bees.

There are several thousand species of bee in North America.  Some of them are hurting, too.  Some of them are doing fine.  With few exceptions, no one really knows which are which.

In 1990, the Western Bumblebee (Bombus occidentalis) was doing fine.  It was widespread and abundant, and was probably the most important native pollinator west of the Rockies.  There was even a serious effort to domesticate it, to keep colonies alive year-round in greenhouses, to provide fresh heirloom tomatoes in February.

Ten years later, most of them were dead.

My Story

My name is Will Peterman.  I’m a photographer, writer, engineer, and native bee nerd, and when I came to the Pacific Northwest, the biologists I met talked about the Western Bumblebee in tones I had previously heard in conversations about Bigfoot.  Most of them had never seen one.  When a corpse turned up in a suburb near the airport, it was big news.  We found one!

It was just the one, though.  Subsequent searches turned up nothing; additional traps stayed empty.  No one saw one alive – until last year.

I am also the guy who found the first lowland population of Western Bumblebees since the collapse.  I have been studying them ever since, along with researchers from the University of Washington, the US Department of Agriculture, and the Xerces Society for Invertebrate Conservation.  As far as we can tell, they’re doing fine, and that means that something has changed.  These bees are (probably) different, somehow, from the ones that are hanging on in the remote corners of the West, and if we move quickly – if we get cell samples from the new bees and the old ones, before the new population has time to spread, or to die – there’s an excellent chance that we’ll be able to figure out what the difference is.

If we can do that, we may be able to save some bees.

Cell Samples and Endangered Bees

“How can you collect cell samples from an endangered species?  Doesn’t that kill the bee?” – Everybody

I’m glad you asked!  The answer is, no, it doesn’t.  The USDA has developed a cell collection technique that only trims a few milligrams off of one of the middle legs.  Since we’re not collecting the rest of the bee, it’s very important to keep a detailed photographic record of the individuals we catch: that’s where I come in.  It isn’t quite a specimen on a pin, but it works – and it doesn’t hurt the bee.

(Full disclosure: thanks to a genetic quirk that is unique to bees and their relatives, male bumblebees don’t contribute very much to the health or survival of their nests.  We will occasionally collect a few in order to test for certain parasites and diseases.)

What We Need

The first $12,000

The first $12,000 pays for a really long road trip.  In three months, we will collect samples from local populations in California, Oregon, Washington, Idaho, Montana, Wyoming, Colorado, New Mexico, and (time, weather, and customs permitting) British Columbia.  We’ll visit many of them twice.

Here’s the breakdown:

  • Hardware: $1500.  The big ticket items are a 12 volt freezer, a backup battery, and a weather meter.
  • Gas: $2300.
  • Food: $4800 (assuming there are three volunteers.)
  • Maintenance: $900.  Tires, windshield wipers, and whatever else wears out on a 10 year old truck.
  • Specimen handling: $500.  Mostly packaging, dry ice, and overnight shipping.
  • Housing: $1000.  Camping by the truck builds character, but some nights you need to sleep indoors.
  • Surprises: $1000.  I don’t know what else will go wrong during three months on the road, but something probably will.

Buy the road trip, get the genetic analysis free!

One of the many reasons to support this project is that if we can pay for the data collection, the next step is already paid for!  The cell samples will be stored and analyzed under an existing program at the USDA.

Our Team

If we fall short

This is a fixed funding campaign: if we can’t pay for food, gas, and a freezer, we can’t go.  In practical terms, that means that if we reach the end of June and the $12,000 goal is still in serious doubt, we will cancel the campaign, thank our supporters, and find something else to do.

If we get more

$12,000 is the minimum we think we need in order to make the trip.  More will help!

Here are our ambitions, in rough order of importance:

  • Extended trip: $2300.  We’d like to sample some local populations in Alaska, but it will take a lot of gas…
  • Expenses and materials for the Rich Site Team: $1000.  The road team isn’t the only one working this summer.  The Rich Site team is developing the techniques that we’ll use in the field next year.
  • Replacement photo gear: $5000.  We’re currently using my personal camera.  It’s a reasonably durable beast, but six years in the field have taken their toll, and the bee lens isn’t weather sealed.  A second camera and lens would eliminate our biggest point of failure, and improve our documentary images.  As a bonus, for our next project, we wouldn’t be limited to still images on our campaign page!  (Not that she isn’t cute.)
  • Housing: $1000.  More time sleeping indoors…
  • Stipend:  $9000.  You may have noticed that we haven’t said anything about covering our rent!  We may be crazy volunteers (OK, we basically are) but it would be nice to cover some personal expenses.  This would cover $250 per week for each member of the road team.

Beyond that, any additional funds will go to one or more of the following worthy ends (hey, we can dream):

  • Next year’s field work.
  • The University of Washington beekeeping internship program.
  • Field guide-quality photographs of native bees (and, ultimately, a field guide to put them in.)

What You Get

Science!

If we collect the data we mean to collect, we will be able to determine how the different local populations of Western Bumblebees are related to one another.  The odds are good that we will also be able to tell how the recovering populations in the Puget Sound area differ from the others.

In turn, that should tell us something about:

  • Whether we’re looking at bees that are getting stronger, or a disease that’s getting weaker
  • Which disease killed them in the first place
  • How they’re reacting to it
  • Whether the bees we call "Western Bumblebees" are really all a single species, or are actually more than one
  • How accurate our pollinator surveys have been for the past twenty years.

Tomatoes!

Twenty years ago, the original plan to raise Western bumblebees in greenhouses collapsed when all their bees died.  If we are able to identify the disease that killed them, and how they have begun to recover in spite of it, we could start seeing some cheap winter tomatoes after all.

Honey!

The chief suspect in the collapse of the Western Bumblebee is a microsporidian parasite called Nosema bombi.  It is closely related to two others, Nosema apis and Nosema ceranae, that are major killers of commercial honeybees.  If the local bumblebees have begun to adapt to Nosema infection, we may learn how to improve the health of honeybees as well.

Perks!

We’ll be adding more perks over the course of the campaign, but so far, we’re dividing them into two general categories: Things with bees on them and Pollinator art.

Things with bees on them

We have a nice library of original photographs of native bees and other pollinators, and we’ll be offering different ways to share those images with our supporters.

To begin with, we’re creating a set of a dozen high quality postcards, each with a different species of pollinator that is native to the Pacific Northwest.  They are available individually and as a set.  In addition, if you are looking for another way to stay in touch with the road team as the project unfolds, they are available postmarked – from the road!  When we’re planning to pass by a mailbox, we’ll write some notes and drop them in the mail.  If you sign up for the whole set that way, you’ll wind up collecting a road diary!

Pollinator Art

Again, we’ll be adding perks as the project progresses, but we have a few good ones to start with.

Canvas Prints

We are offering gallery-quality fine art prints on stretched canvas.  They are digital prints that are stretched and finished by hand, and they are available in several sizes.  The first few prints are from my last gallery show, but I will make more as needed.  (Note: I probably won’t make any prints between the middle of June and the end of the road trip.  Expect delivery of most canvas prints in September.)

Bee on a Rock

I’m really excited about this one!  Award-winning miniatures painter Marike Reimer has created and donated a special entry in her remarkable series, Bug on a Rock.  This one is a brilliantly rendered Western Bumblebee queen, and I believe that it’s unique in that it is painted from memory: she was with a UW entomology group when we found a live queen in the hills above Wenatchee, WA, and she painted a rock to mark the occasion.

(Seriously, this is pretty cool.  Marike doesn’t take commissions any more, and my snarky tone is a poorly concealed effort to stave off the mini hordes until I can scrounge enough to get it myself.  That’s legal, right?)

Other Ways to Help

Even if you can’t donate, there are a number of ways to help the project, and bumblebees in general.  Here are a few:

  • Spread the word!  If you live west of the Rockies and north of L.A., then the Western Bumblebees used to be your neighbors – and they could be again.  Indiegogo has generously provided a number of “share” links at the bottom of the page.  They help!
  • Keep an eye out for our missing bumblebees!  If you see one, or if you want to know which threatened species might be in your area, check out the resources at Bumblebeewatch.org.  (If you live on the west coast, we have some tips on how to tell a Western Bumblebee apart from the other locals here.)  If you report a Western Bumblebee sighting to Bumblebee Watch, they will let us know, and we will add it to our itinerary if we can!
  • Plant some flowers, and cut back on pesticides.  Even in a city, a good quality garden has been shown to make a difference to the local native bees.
  • Volunteer!  If you’re in the Seattle area, we can always use volunteers for our site monitoring project.  There’s even a spot left for a few weeks on the road team!

story:
ABOUT THIS PROJECT

 

In the Off Grid Project I will show you how to get your household fully off the grid and independent from the power and utility companies. Never pay for electricity, water or sewer again.

With the rising oil prices, many people are looking for alternative forms of energy. Until now, alternate energy has been too expensive for most people. It takes about 20 years for solar to pay for itself. Windmills are very expensive and require professional installers. We are tied to the grid.

Or are we....

Do It Yourselfers can get off the grid for a fraction of the cost of retail systems. I will show you how to become energy independent on a budget. You can have your own solar power, windmill, water supply, sewage, heat, hot water and cooling system - for $5,000.

Or, pick and choose what best suits your needs and budget.

The project will proceed regardless of the amount of funding, so contributors will be guaranteed their rewards.

Energy

I will show you how to make your own solar panels at 1/10th the cost of retail. You will learn how to choose the correct batteries for your personal needs and how to hook them up at home. You will be shown how to choose the right power inverter and solar charge controller. And you will be given common household appliance energy consumption tables that will help you plan your own energy requirements. All of this will be shown in a simple to understand manner.

Some families may need to make a small adjustment to their daily power consumption in order to go off the grid on a budget, but I will cover these points as well. Also, how to set up energy saving devices in your home. And how to best hook up the solar energy for your particular needs.

You will be shown how to make a windmill from common parts that many of us already have in the home. With small changes to a standard AC motor, it can be converted into a windmill. With a little bit of work in the garage, anyone can make a windmill.

Shown above is the prototype of my first homemade box fan windmill, spinning in the wind and charging batteries. One of my homemade windmills is still on a roof and spinning in the wind today after three years.

Water

To be fully off the grid, you will need to have a fresh water supply and waste water disposal. How to set up an independent water supply, using rain water or ground water will be covered in depth. And how to make and use a composting toilet to convert solid waste safely into a useful, rich organic compost.

Heat

How to make a solar oven and a solar water distiller will be explained. These items do not need to be expensive, and the parts to make them yourself can be found easily.

I will show you how to make various types of passive solar heaters to heat your home and water supply for washing and bathing. I will cover the design and construction of a rocket stove to heat your home efficiently with very little wood consumption. You can also cook and heat water with your wood stove.

Cooling

How to use the earth to cool your home will be included as well. I will show you how to set up a geothermal cooling system to replace power hungry air conditioners.

Food

And, of course, an off grid home is not complete without an organic garden. I will take a rough, wild meadow and turn it into a garden that will provide enough food for the whole year. How to preserve your food will be the last phase of the project as the harvest is ready and the summer season comes to a close.

The Project

I have been preparing a 32 foot trailer in the woods for the project. I will be moving into the trailer and living there for the duration of the project. I will start out with only a small, homemade 65 watt solar panel for light and to keep my laptop going.

The project will begin in mid April and continue through the summer season. At the end of summer, early fall, the book and video will be produced.

Now, you might be asking yourself "What makes him think he can pull this off?" The answer is simple. I have been experimenting with electronics and natural living since I was very young. I am the owner of The DIY World (www.thediyworld.com) and have written many articles and books about natural energy and off grid living. And I will be living on the project site the whole time.

At the completion of all of the projects listed above, I will write a DIY book on how to get off the grid for $5,000 showing detailed explanations of every project. And for qualifying bidders, I will produce a documentary video showing every phase of the project. A support forum has already been set up to help you complete your own goal. I will be happy to assist you on the way to energy independence. 

Note: for $5,000 you can go fully off the grid. You may choose to invest a little bit more, or less in some areas based on your own preferences and comfort level. You can also build up slowly, and expand, as time and money permit.

 

I have completed most of these projects in various forms in the past, but I want to lead you, every step of the way, and prove that you can get off the grid on a budget. That's why I am asking for the $5,000 - to prove it can be done, while demonstrating every aspect of it, live. The rest of the money will cover the cost of producing the book and video plus shipping all the rewards.

The project will begin in mid April and continue through the summer season. At the end of summer, early fall, the book and video will be produced.
Now, you might be asking yourself "What makes him think he can pull this off?" The answer is simple. I have been experimenting with electronics and natural living since I was very young. I am the owner of The DIY World (www.thediyworld.com) and have written many articles and books about natural energy and off grid living. And I will be living on the project site the whole time.
At the completion of all of the projects listed above, I will write a DIY book on how to get off the grid for $5,000 showing detailed explanations of every project. And for qualifying bidders, I will produce a documentary video showing every phase of the project. A support forum has already been set up to help you complete your own goal. I will be happy to assist you on the way to energy independence. 
Note: for $5,000 you can go fully off the grid. You may choose to invest a little bit more, or less in some areas based on your own preferences and comfort level. You can also build up slowly, and expand, as time and money permit.
 
I have completed most of these projects in various forms in the past, but I want to lead you, every step of the way, and prove that you can get off the grid on a budget. That's why I am asking for the $5,000 - to prove it can be done, while demonstrating every aspect of it, live. The rest of the money will cover the cost of producing the book and video plus shipping all the rewards.

story:
The Arctic is one of the most beautiful and mysterious areas in the world. Luckily, our ClimateHero Park ( YuKon ) is perfectly located within the Aurora belt;  it is the a central point for further Arctic explorations. 
           

We discovered that if all travelers take flights to the Arctic, it will leave massive carbon footprint behind. Therefore, we created a self-guided road trip with our improved Solar Jeep Wranglers - starting from Vancouver to the Arctic with Four ClimateHero Parks. 

To help make everyone's journey more successful, the ClimateHero Park will provide two Jeep Wranglers in Vancouver. Two Jeeps that we spent time to turn them into environmental friendly vehicles that are capable to reduce carbon footprints along the journey.  The travelers will have peace of mind knowing that while they're making their journey to the Arctic, their carbon footprints will be offset. Thus, our travelers will not contribute nor have the guilt of melting the Arctic along with their trips.


 
 

For all $100 backers, everyone will become a registered co-owner of ClimateHero Park ( YuKon ) with a land title of a tiny property ( freehold ) - and therefore, the Arctic with the innovative shared economy model ! 

Not only that, all travelers will also get free camping – for life - in all Four ClimateHero Parks from Vancouver to the Arctic ANYTIME.

Now we invite you to join A marvelous 360° Arctic Adventure Journey with us from Vancouver to the Arcticon August 8 to 22, 2018.

Adore the northern lights with your own eyes, sleep and play in your ‘own’ park. 

We’ll ensure you will be impressed by the possibilities ClimateHero Park provides.

Our theme is ‘Make Different’ origin from Apple's ‘Think Different’ and Google's ‘Make Good Things Together’！

 

Through this crowdfunding campaign, we have another goal. Which is the recruitment of CEO and COO across the world for our project. we want to turn everyone's dream to reality.

Compensation: Great Salary + Solar Wrangler + 5 Acres Commercial Property (Freehold) in ClimateHero Park (+ Work Permit or Canadian Permanent Resident Card if applicable). 
 
YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES - HERE'S WHAT WE'LL TRUST YOU WITH
Developing the marketing strategy for the company in line with company objectives. Bring new ideas to the table, new techniques.
  • Overseeing the company's marketing budget.
  • Overall responsibility for brand management and corporate identity.
  • Implement technology and techniques to precisely measure the success of marketing efforts and costs.
  • Organize and track data on leads, campaigns, and digital analytics.

APPLY NOW

If you are interested in this exciting career opportunity, please shoot a one-minute short film as your resume outlining how you meet the requirements of this position and submit to us at http://climateheropark.com/contact/

Join us, let us realize our common dream together!

Every featured backer will become a shareowner and receive a property certificate showing ownership of 3'x4' parcel of land on ClimateHero Park (YuKon), Now Enjoy your permanent property, and share in the land appreciation with your co-owners.

$3000  will buy 10 units of Crua Hybrid 4-in-1 tent-hammocks, so that Backers can go camping in the ClimateHero Park and enjoy the polar nature and experience the effects of climate change.

The Crua Hybrid offers the perfect solution and everything you need for a comfortable nights sleep while out on your adventure. The Crua Hybrid has a built in tailored sleeping bag with an insulated air mattress which ensures a restful nights sleep.

The Crua Hybrid was one of  the most successful campaigns run on indiegogo.com.

The greatest perk for anyone who contributes any amount is the honor and value that you will be informing the world about the real challenges that the Arctic is facing. And at the same time, you're contributing to real solutions on how to save the Arctic from global climate change.

Also: Even if you cannot, or you decide not to contribute financially to this project, there is so much more you can do. Sharing this campaign link with others is one. Traveling to the Arctic is another. And just joining the public debate is valuable too.

If you think that "little you" won't be able to make a difference in a big world? Please have a look at  "The Butterfly effect",  to see how a little change can make a big effect. We look forward to hearing from you!

All contributions up to $10, - will be rewarded with a Climate Hero Certificate and your name will be carved on the ClimateHero Wall in ClimateHero Park.  (like the "Wall of Love" in Paris )

$100 - Co-owner, Camping free forever, From Vancouver to the Arctic by Crua Hybrid 4-in-1 tent-hammock in 4 ClimateHero Parks (From the southernmost point to the northernmost point in Canada)

For everyone who travels to the Arctic from Vancouver and stays in the ClimateHero Parks will all get a free experience of sleeping in a cool and warm Crua Hybrid 4-in-1 tent-hammock.

NO need to bring your own tent or pitch it for that matter.

You can sleep under the Stars or Aurora - in nature! Nothing can get better than that.

If we can get more support, we will build 20 modular tiny vertical farm units so it will be able to share with more backers around the world. This will authorize more people to enjoy the magical Aurora. At the same time,  the world's leading vertical planting technology will display in the park. With this technology it will not only benefit to the locals and tourists to eat fresh and nutritious vegetables, it will also bring knowledge to the tourists all across from the world on how vertical planting technology will lead to a new low-carbon lifestyle. 

There is nothing better to get out of the office treadmill than to travel.

Join us, with our solar Jeeps to voyage across Canada to the arctic. Explore, discover and enjoy all the magical scenery along the way- see the northern lights with your own eyes, play a round of snow- or summer golf in your ‘own’ park. 

This is absolutely excellent and different!

At the same time, ClimateHero Parks will also act as an educational tool to illustrate the generations on the use of renewable energy, as well as reduction of the carbon footprint. The ClimateHero Park will raise public awareness on the issues about climate change.

Thank you for helping each ones travel to the Arctic more accessible and affordable.

This is ClimateHero Park's first crowdfunding campaign. We have already own four properties from Metro Vancouver to Yukon, in a total 396 Acres. Among them, the Yukon's golf course has been completed and Vancouver's modular tiny vertical farm has just began.

We've fulfilled our backer's requests with each campaign and will continue to do so. We will dedicate all our strength and passion to meet our objectives. We will continue to work on all our projects with the utmost transparency and will endeavor to deal with all challenges with the most sustainable solutions possible. All our efforts are in keep with our backer's mind.

We’d love for you to come and visit us at our Climate Change Adventure Park up in the Arctic.

story:
What is happening to our sea?

Nowadays, marine ecosystems and resources in the sea along the east coast of Thailand are experiencing drastic degradation. This worrisome situation has been mainly caused by irresponsible commercial fishing practices, global warming, and travelling without conscience which lead to a significant marine population decline. The degrading marine ecosystems do not affect only marine life but also the artisanal fishermen. They barely catch enough fish to feed their families. Some fishermen need to go farther out and to spend longer periods at sea for better catch. Consequently, they have less time to rest and tend to face various health problems.

What artisanal object does PTTGC uses to help our sea? 

PTT Global Chemical Public Company Limited or PTTGC has an idea to support the making of “Sung Cheuk”, the floating marine habitat from the artisanal fishermen’s wisdom, to help restore marine ecosystems and conserve the traditional fishing practice of Thai artisanal fishermen.

"Sung Cheuk is not a type of fishing tackle but acts as seagrasses providing food, shelter, breeding and nursery areas, and habitats for marine life."

PTTGC starts this Sung Cheuk project as we want to help...

  1. Restore coastal marine ecosystems and increase marine population.
  2. Conserve the traditional fishing practice of Thai artisanal fishermen and promote sustainable fisheries.
  3. Raise ocean conservation awareness to both artisanal fishermen and the public and strengthen   fishermen communities.
  4. Prevent commercial fishing vessels from catching fish close to the coastline: the top part of Sung Cheuk (buoys), will be used to demarcate the marine life conservation area.

"We need you to help us make our oceans sustainably healthy again before we it’s too late to save our most important and largest water resource that can take care of us for all future generations."

 

What we need & What you get

We need US$67,500 to make and place 51 sets of Sung Cheuk in total along the coastline of Chanthaburi and Trat provinces from 2017 to 2018. In 2016, PTTGC has successfully collaborated with the Department of Marine and Coastal Resources, the Rayong Provincial Fisheries Office, and artisanal fishermen to start Sung Cheuk project along the coastline of Rayong province.

In return for your contribution, we offer you our unique perks including Limited Edition Sung Cheuk Cloth Bag, Premium Luffala Soap & Hand Cream Gift Set, ECOALF Backpack made from Recycled Plastic Bottles, Exclusive One-Day Scuba Diving Trip in Chanthaburi or Trat Province, and Sponsor Name or Company Logo on Sung Cheuk.

No matter how much we can raise, we guarantee that the funds will be brought to make Sung Cheuk project happen along Chanthaburi and Trat’s coastline.

 

The Impact

 PTTGC started launching our Sung Cheuk project first time along the coastline of Rayong province in 2016. Seventy sets of Sung Cheuk were not placed in nineteen fishing communities by PTTGC alone, but we teamed up with the Department of Marine and Coastal Resources, the Rayong Provincial Fisheries Office, and artisanal fishermen, one of our most important stakeholders, to make it happen.

After Sung Cheuk placement, the fishermen themselves reported that they noticed an increase of marine life. Six months later, the Rayong Provincial Fisheries Office confirmed that the number of Dollfus' octopus and Sillago fish has increased significantly. This report proves that Sung Cheuk can help upgrade the marine ecosystem’s health.

 

About us

PTT Global Chemical Public Company Limited or PTTGC, PTT Group’s chemical flagship, is a leading integrated petrochemical and refining company in Thailand and the Asia-Pacific region. We are committed be “A LEADING CHEMICAL COMPANY FOR BETTER LIVING” through innovation and have operated our business responsibly to address social and environmental issues.

story:
Summary

Thank you for your interest in furthering the sustainable travel movement! I’m Marilyn, an environmental engineer turned social entrepreneur.

And I’m a Sustainable Traveler. That means I try to:

·  Use low-carbon transportation by walking, riding a bicycle, taking public transportation, and car-sharing in electric vehicles

·  Eat as local, seasonal, organic, and vegetarian as possible

·  Find accommodation in the collaborative economy and hotels that implement eco-friendly and socially responsible practices

·  Participate in activities that support the social, environmental, and future generational well-being of the society that I am visiting

·  Shop responsibly, supporting locally-made and fair trade souvenirs and goods

Now I want to help visitors worldwide do the same through the SustainableVisit online platform, where users can enjoy and suggest new sustainable tourism and lifestyle entries, review existing suggestions based on their sustainability attributes, and read and comment on our sustainable travel blog. Furthermore, I would like to enact concrete on-the-ground awareness and support for sustainable business through sustainability-themed walking tours.

If we can support more eco-conscious and social-conscious ventures, we can push all business to improve their social and environmental performance, causing systemic change.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are asking for a total of 10,000 USD to help us improve SustainableVisit and to show investors that there is demand for more socially and environmentally responsible travel and lifestyle options.
  • As a small token of our appreciation, the team at SustainableVisit is offering personalized “SustyVisit” tours of the world’s most popular travel destination—Paris.
  • Your donations will help us reach more people in the world by paying for translation services (SustainableVisit is only currently available in English), improving the website and associated mobile application, and helping spread awareness about the platform and on-the-ground walking tours.

The Impact

Tourism contributes to a whole host of environmental and social issues:

·  Carbon emissions (5% of global emissions; 17 kg of carbon emitted per room day for hotel stays)

·  Wildlife destruction (80% decrease in free-roaming African lions over a decade; at least 1,000 rhinos killed by poachers annually)

·  Increased waste (3.5 kg of waste generated daily per cruise ship passenger compared to 0.8 kg normally)

·  Water overuse (tourists consume double the amount of water when on vacation)

·  Social disruption (child sex tourism; loss of culture and heritage)

The $6 trillion travel industry grows 3-7% annually. SustainableVisit wants to change how it grows.

Will you help us?

Other Ways You Can Help

Join the sustainable travel and lifestyle movement today by registering on SustainableVisit, Signing up for our monthly Newsletter, and most of all, spreading the word about our Indiegogo crowdfunding Campaign!


By supporting SustainableVisit, you will help to create a worldwide community of people who seek to save the planet, one trip at a time.

story:
Il Progetto 

Molti sono ancora, soprattutto in Italia, gli scettici e i negazionisti riguardo i grandi problemi ambientali che affliggono il pianeta Terra.

Antropocentrismo sfrenato. Desertificazione. Riscaldamento Globale. Crisi alimentare. Perdita inarrestabile della Biodiversita'. Sovrappopolamento. Scarsita' di risorse. Inquinamento. Acidificazione dei mari e molto, troppo, altro ancora.

Nel coro di lamenti e allarmi, leciti quanto inefficaci vogliamo andare alla ricerca delle voci che possano suggerire una soluzione. Dar loro eco fino a che risuonino come una sola. 

Le Spese

Desideriamo coinvolgere intellettuali ed esperti in tutta Italia. Noi possiamo dedicare tutto il nostro tempo e le nostre energie alla realizzazione artistica e tecnica ma dobbiamo affrontare le spese di logistica e spostamento.

Maggiori saranno le risorse che riusciremo a raccogliere maggiori saranno le voci coinvolte... maggiori i risultati per il pianeta.

Se dovessero avanzare fondi saranno interamente spesi per la diffusione del documentario.

Perche' farlo?

Non c'e' piu' tempo. Dobbiamo al piu' presto prendere consapevolezza dei problemi che affliggono la terra e trovare attraverso l'unione di esperienze, sensibilita' e conoscenze diverse una soluzione. La soluzione. Per l'uomo e il pianeta in cui vive.

Nessuno puo' lamentarsi del buio senza far nulla. Dobbiamo accendere una candela. Dalla prima molte altre possono essere fatte risplendere. 

Ogni singolo gesto puo' fare la differenza.

Il tuo gesto.

Altri modi per contribuire

Realizzeremo in ogni caso il documentario con i fondi che avremo raccolto integrando con le nostre risorse. Una volta che sara' completato il nostro scopo sara' diffonderlo il piu' possibile. Condividere sui social network o mostrarlo a parenti e amici sara' un aiuto inestimabile.
