Se dovessero avanzare fondi saranno interamente spesi per la diffusione del documentario.
    Perche' farlo? Non c'e' piu' tempo. Dobbiamo al piu' presto prendere consapevolezza dei problemi che affliggono la terra e trovare attraverso l'unione di esperienze, sensibilita' e conoscenze diverse una soluzione. La soluzione. Per l'uomo e il pianeta in cui vive.
Nessuno puo' lamentarsi del buio senza far nulla. Dobbiamo accendere una candela. Dalla prima molte altre possono essere fatte risplendere. 
Ogni singolo gesto puo' fare la differenza.
Il tuo gesto.

    Altri modi per contribuire Realizzeremo in ogni caso il documentario con i fondi che avremo raccolto integrando con le nostre risorse. Una volta che sara' completato il nostro scopo sara' diffonderlo il piu' possibile. Condividere sui social network o mostrarlo a parenti e amici sara' un aiuto inestimabile.

story:
Greetings, and thank you for viewing this campaign!

I'm Dory Kurowski.  My project, My Conscience, My Choice, connects mindful consumers who aspire to lead conscience-driven lifestyles with pioneering brands and products on a weekly basis via the website www.myconsciencemychoice.com. It is the first-of-its-kind resource for finding the best eco-friendly, cruelty-free and all-natural product alternatives to commonly purchased products. These alternatives are independently chosen based on research, trusted sources and real world testing - and not based on compensation.  

Now, the most powerful way to utilize these recommendations will be in the "Choice" mobile app. 

Without readily available, concise, trusted information, we default to making less conscience-driven choices and more convenience-driven ones. The app fills the gap between wanting to purchase sustainable products and having a quick means of reference to do so (one that cuts through "green washing", false claims and poor product performance) nearly always at our fingertips. Having a resource like this should interest the person who wants to be part of a larger movement: a move to change based on taking ownership of your own choices to arrest the damage that’s being done since we’ve outpaced ourselves as a society in the areas of science and manufacturing. 

The funding from this campaign will go towards making the app, currently in prototype stage, live and ready for download:  this includes making the app fully populated with alternatives already held in a proprietary database, associating all product images with bar code information via a third party referral service, incorporating a "Companies with a Conscience" and "Affiliates" section for referencing the best sustainable brands and service or retail providers, and finalizing any additional design, coding and programming so the app is ready for download by iOS mobile devices. Funding will also assist with legal and refinement costs following beta testing.

  • A First-Of-Its-Kind, Simple Tool for Making Better Product Purchasing Choices:  The "Choice" app provides a tool for making better product choices, after simply scanning a product 's bar code.  Scan an item and the best sustainable alternative to purchase is fed back to you immediately, along with a quick, bulleted list of reasons the product is better for you, animals and/or the planet. 

  • How the App Helps to Promote Local Commerce: Tap a button, labeled, "How to Get It", and the app provides information to purchase suggested alternative products in the local New York/New Jersey and greater Tri-State areas as well as from nationwide and online retailers. An auxiliary benefit that will hopefully result if visitors switch to the suggested product alternatives will be an increased patronization of local area grocers who supply alternative products and an increased demand for products from local suppliers.  And, if there is a more meaningful reliance on online merchants as the default provider of highly specific cruelty-free or eco-friendly products, hopefully local merchants will also take note to become niche suppliers of these types of products to fill the local retailer void. This would be a winning scenario for everyone in the local community.

  • Social Sharing of Product Experiences Provides Ongoing Intelligence: Registered users of the app can provide feedback via a comments section for fellow visitors about the recommended alternatives or suggest a different alternative. These comments can also be posted via Facebook. This user feedback is critical to help validate recommendations and also provide new information to the community of app users.  

  • In addition, any manufacturer of a commonly purchased product that is not good for you, the animals or the planet, should want to know intelligence about why their consumers want to switch - or how many potential buyers actually have switched - from their product to another product. The hope would be to provide meaningful feedback to these companies to create better, conscience-driven products.

  • Connecting Pioneering Brands with a Targeted Community of those Ready for Change: The app will draw information from the My Conscience, My Choice website including personalities and “back stories” behind the companies pioneering eco-friendly, natural or cruelty-free product alternatives. The goal is for the app to bring like-minded people together. So, it makes sense to introduce these companies along with their missions and popular products to those of you who are curious and ready to make more conscience-driven choices. The goal of this app is to help the average person ultimately lead a more conscience-driven lifestyle! 

The “My Conscience, My Choice” website and app are based on the idea that if given a choice the average consumer wants to make purchases with a good conscience. It is also based on the idea that the average consumer likes their purchasing experience to be quick and easy. Frustrated with the many alternatives available that were not being widely used, and on a quest to revamp my own lifestyle, I became a resource to friends and family for specific product alternatives. Now, I share my knowledge about these products to make it easy for others to lead a conscience-driven lifestyle.

With each recommended alternative, you’ll find that the legwork has been done to suggest suitable eco-friendly, natural, and cruelty-free product alternatives to commonly purchased personal health and beauty, food, and household products. Think of this app as a part of a tool kit for an overhaul of your own lifestyle…

After reading this introduction and watching the associated video, I hope that you now understand that the "Choice" app has the power to be an incredibly useful resource.  More importantly, if you help fund this app and become a user you will gain satisfaction knowing that with every eco-friendly, natural or cruelty-free product alternative you choose to purchase by using it, you will have contributed to beginning a conscience-driven, sustainable world. 

Remember: many small life changes can equate to big world changes.

If you cannot contribute, please help to spread the word by sharing the campaign link at igg.me/at/TheChoiceApp and by old-fashioned word of mouth.


Very Sincerely, 

Dory A. Kurowski

Founder, My Conscience, My Choice LLC


IMPORTANT:  If donating by credit card, please read! 

Thank you for choosing to donate!  If you decide to pay by credit card, you will receive a transaction ID after entering your information.  However, this does not complete the donation; you must  complete an additional step to check out as a “guest of PayPal” (it's a yellow button on the right side of the page) .  Once this button is pressed you will get an email confirmation of your donation.  If you do not receive an email confirmation, your donation has NOT been processed. Make sure to chose "check out as a guest" and then you will see a green check mark after your donation is accepted.  Thank you! 


Disclaimer:  

Please also note the following: The target funding amount of $20,000 is all encompassing for project completion, it is the minimum amount as advised by the project's app developer for the steps to be completed, as listed above. Additional funds above this amount are to cover the automatic fees charged by Indiegogo and PayPal for use of its respective platforms. I have chosen the flexible funding option and realize it is possible that I may not reach my end goal.  If funds raised exceed a threshold amount for the initial phase of final development, I will continue to develop the app.  If funds raised are lower than this amount, either I will elect to hybrid finance the remainder of the project or abandon the project.  If the latter, all donations will be refunded on March 15th.  If donations are reimbursed, the refunds will be at my expense since I will still have to pay the non-refundable fees on each donation to Indiegogo and the costs of all pre-ordered perks and shipping, since perks will be fulfilled, regardless.

story:
Mission

The purpose of the art2water organization is to fund projects that provide clean water and sanitation capabilities to people in need around the world. 

Nearly 800 million people in the world today lack access to adequate water and 2.5 billion people lack access to improved sanitation. We are dedicated to overcoming this major problem. 

The idea is to give those whose lives have been privileged an opportunity to fight for those who can't fight for themselves.


Background

art2water is a dream that we want to make a reality starting in 2014. The concept was originally to use proceeds from the sale of artistic paintings, mostly custom reproductions of masterpieces, to fund qualified clean water projects around the world. 

art2water held its first fundraiser with friends in Texas to see if it was an idea to which people would respond. 

The first fundraiser was a demonstrated success. We raised $3,000 through the sale of just 10 paintings. That initial success proved the concept and gave us the confidence that art2water can make a significant impact.

The goal is to raise the awareness of the water crisis. The plan is to provide clean water and sanitation capabilities in perilous places such as Sudan, Cambodia, Uganda and Rwanda. 


The Plan

The plan is to provide quality, but affordable, art to people who understand and appreciate art and have a desire to help those less fortunate then themselves. By purchasing art from art2water, proceeds will be donated to qualified organizations that provide clean water and sanitation capabilities.  

art2water has established relationships with a number of excellent reproduction artists worlwide. These artists have the skills and ability to create high quality artistic reproductions of you choosing, including:

  • Classic and Modern Masterpieces
  • Travel Photography
  • Portraits
  • Landmarks
  • and much more

By purchasing though art2water, not only are you helping those who desperately need clean water, you are also helping artists in the art2water network, most of whom are from emerging countries.

art2water has assembled an initial team and this initial funding will be for a dedicated website, to establish a social media presence and to structure a plan to establish art2water as a self-sustaining organization. 


Funding Requirements

In order to launch art2water, $5,000 is needed. The goal is to raise the necessary funds by January 31, 2014. 

Use of Proceeds

  • Develop and maintain the art2water website and storefront.
  • Create a social media presence. 
  • Purchase initial inventory of fine art reproductions.
  • Set-up infrastructure to ensure art2water becomes a self-sustaining organization. 


What You Get

  • For every donation of $250 or more, art2water will send you the book, Abstract Art  from the Taschen Basic Genre Series.

  • For every donation of $1000 or more, art2water will send you the book, Abstract Art, from the Taschen Basic Genre Series. 

    Further     art2water will provide a 50% discount on one unframed 18"x24" reproduction painting of your choice.


YOUR Impact

  • By getting involved in this project, YOU make a difference and become part of this focused effort dedicated to providing clean water and sanitation capabilities in extreme areas. 
  • With YOUR initial donation you will directly reduce major diseases resulting from poisoned and infected water, and poor sanitization in extreme places around the world.
  • Profits derived from the sales of art reproductions will be converted in clean water. YOU will help save thousands of lives - most of them children. 


Other ways you can help

We understand that not everyone can contribute at this time. However, you can still support the art2water mission. Please tell your friends, families and colleagues about art2water and ask if they can contribute. 



Thank you

Thank you for your help. Your contribution and support will directly help children around the world live a better, more healthful life. In many cases, you will be saving the lives of those who cannot help themselves.

story:
Qui suis-je?

Après avoir vécu 20 ans à Grenoble, dans les Alpes, je suis parti à Montréal faire mes études supérieures en ingénierie. J'ai ensuite travaillé 2 ans dans l'industrie et ai décidé de réaliser mon rêve de faire un tour du monde pendant plus d'un an. 

Ma sensibilité écologique et sociale m'a ouvert les yeux sur beaucoup de sujets et notamment celui de notre système alimentaire "moderne". J'ai donc décidé de conduire ce projet afin de sensibiliser et faire découvrir l'agroécologie qui, pour moi, s’inscrit dans la vision de la permaculture. Elle se présente comme une alternative viable et durable face aux nombreux défis que le monde fait et va faire face dans les prochaines décennies au niveau alimentaire. 


Sommaire de la Campagne

Face à un modèle agronomique qui ne répond plus aux attentes écologiques, alimentaires, sociales et sanitaires, le monde a besoin d'alternatives. Nous sommes de plus en plus nombreux à réaliser que le système de l’industrie agro-alimentaire n’est pas viable et durable sur le long terme.

L'agroécologie en tant que mouvement social, politique et alimentaire a fait ses apparitions dans les années 80 en Amérique du Sud avec Miguel Altieri et en France avec Pierre Rabhi pour ne citer que les plus connus. Ce courant en plein essor fait autant appel à des techniques ancestrales qu'aux découvertes écologiques modernes et réinvente notre façon de vivre.

Les mouvements, systèmes et pratiques de ce domaine sont en constante évolution et innovation selon les climats, communautés, lois régionales et nationales, et les ressources disponibles. Il y a donc autant de façons d’appliquer l’agroécologie que de pays, climats et communautés différentes. Un voyage autour du monde permettra justement de découvrir comment chacun vit et utilise cette science.

Les enjeux de l'agroécologie sont aussi larges que les disciplines qu’elle touche :

  • Soutenir une production suffisante pour l'ensemble de l'humanité,
  • Se détacher de l'usage des engrais et produits chimiques,
  • Offrir des alternatives viables aux petits comme aux grands producteurs,
  • Établir de liens étroits entre politiques-producteurs-distributeurs-consommateurs,
  • Replacer la Nature et l'Humain au centre des priorités... 


Les défis sont de tailles!


Je vous emmène dans un voyage autour du monde à la rencontre et découverte de ces différents acteurs, intervenants, utilisateurs et créateurs dont le but sera de documenter les différents aspects de l'agroécologie dans une époque en recherche d'alternatives.

Au programme : visites de fermes traditionnelles, modernes, collectivités de producteurs, marchés agro-écologiques locaux, interviews de consommateurs responsables, producteurs mais aussi politiques. 


Pourquoi une Campagne de Financement?

Votre financement me permettra de :

  • Partager des connaissances sur cette science en évolution
  • Réaliser un film documentant les différentes visites et rencontres.
  • Couvrir une certaine partie des dépenses dans l’équipement photo et vidéo.
  • Prolonger des séjours dans les pays industrialisés où le coût de la vie ne me permet pas de rester très longtemps en plus de couvrir les frais de transports.

Que vous soyez vraiment intéressés par le sujet de l'agroécologie, que vous voulez avoir un goût authentique d'une autre culture ou que vous souhaitez simplement participer à un projet aventurier autour du monde, votre contribution est grandement appréciée et sera très utile pour la réalisation de ce projet.


Et vous dans tout ça ?

En contribuant à cette campagne, vous pouvez obtenir les rétributions suivantes :

  • Un GROS merci !
  • Une carte postale de la destination de votre choix.
  • Une photo de votre choix avec un mot personnalisé.
  • Un souvenir artisanal, local et équitable.
  • Une copie du documentaire et un accès privé pour l'avant-première de la diffusion.

En contribuant à cette campagne, vous participez à la diffusion de cette "nouvelle" pratique, vous permettez à des agriculteurs, activistes ou simples consommateurs d'avoir un goût de la réalité de leurs semblables de l'autre côté du globe dans une page de l'Histoire en recherche de transformation.


Chaque contributeur aura son nom affiché dans le générique du documentaire.


Site du portfolio : www.levoyageurvert.com


Liste des pays :

Afrique du Sud

Allemagne

Argentine

Australie

Belgique

Bosnie

Brésil

Cambodge

Chili

Colombie

Croatie

Rep. Tchèque

Egypte

Equateur

France

Grece

Hongrie

Inde

Indonesie

Malaisie

Nepal

Nouvelle Zelande

Pays-Bas

Perou

Philipinnes

Royaume-Uni

Senegal

Singapour

Slovaquie

Thailande

Turquie

USA

Vietnam
Note: cette liste peut évoluer au fil du voyage.

à un projet aventurier autour du monde, votre contribution est grandement
appréciée et sera très utile pour la réalisation de ce projet.
Et vous dans tout ça ?
En
contribuant à cette campagne, vous pouvez obtenir les rétributions suivantes :


Un GROS
merci !


Une carte
postale de la destination de votre choix.


Une photo
de votre choix avec un mot personnalisé.


Un
souvenir artisanal, local et équitable.


Une copie
du documentaire et un accès privé pour l'avant-première de la diffusion.


En
contribuant à cette campagne, vous participez à la diffusion de cette
"nouvelle" pratique, vous permettez à des agriculteurs, activistes ou
simples consommateurs d'avoir un goût de la réalité de leurs semblables de
l'autre côté du globe dans une page de l'Histoire en recherche de
transformation.
Chaque contributeur aura son nom affiché dans le
générique du documentaire.Site du portfolio : www.levoyageurvert.com
Liste des
pays :

  du Sud

story:
Team   *  Zeitplan  *  Grundstück   *  Gästehäuser  *  Permakultur  *  Freizeitspaß  *  Tiere  *  Jobs *  Umwelt  *  FAQs
 The campaign for our English-speaking friends can be found here.

Unser Planet geht vor die Hunde. Nachweislich. Schneller als berechnet. Wir sind überzeugt: Wenn jeder Einzelne (s)einen Teil an Verantwortung und echten Taten übernimmt, wird selbst Unmögliches möglich. Dies Projekt ist unser Beitrag dazu.

_____________________________________________________________________________

WAS WIR ANSTREBEN:
Möglichst vielen Menschen erlebbar zu machen, dass aktiver Umweltschutz kein Verlust  sondern sogar ein genussvoller Gewinn  ist. CO2 versenken statt zu produzieren, Aufzuforsten statt Abzuholzen, Böden beleben statt zu vergiften, Jobs zu schaffen statt zu zerstören. Und, um Ihnen natürlich ein paar hübsche, biologisch abbaubare und unwiderstehliche(!) PERKS zugänglich zu machen. ;-)

SCHLÜSSELELEMENTE:
Nachhaltige Bambusplantage | biologischer Permakultur Anbau |  Wasserretentions Landschaft |  Waldgarten | biologischer Gemüsegarten | Vielfalt: alte Sorten, alte Arten | Mischfruchtanbau statt Monokultur | Natur-Ferienhäuser | ökologische Baumethoden: Lehmbau, Strohballenbau, Gründächer | per Lehmofen beheizt mit Bambus | netzunabhängig dank Wind- und Solarenergie | Abwassermanagement per biologischer Pflanzenkläranlage | Bio-Pools | Do-It-Yourself-Kurse: Shampoo, Waschmittel, Käse, Bogenbau, Lehmbau, Lehmöfen (uvm.) selbst gemacht | Fun Factor: Fotosafaris, Ausflüge zu Pferde, Fahrad, Quad, Wale, Delphine und Wildtiere beobachten, Schwimmen, Angeln, Bogenschießen und viel, viel viel mehr! :-)



Wie die Anzahl der Kampagnen, ist auch jeder Projektschritt skalierbar und kann an die Unterstützung angepasst werden. Die Fertigstellung ist für Ende 2017 geplant.

Projektschritte im Überblick:
Schritt 1: Grundstück
Schritt 2: Hauptgebäude
Schritt 3: Arbeitsplätze
Schritt 4: Gartenanlage & Gerätschaften
Schritt 5: Stallungen & Tiere
Schritt 6: Gästehäuser & Ausstattung
Schritt 7: Freizeit & Fun

Auf dem Markt am Ostkap Südafrikas finden sich derzeit passende Grundstücke ab 5 ha (=50.000 qm). Zur Veranschaulichung der Proportionen ein kleiner Vergleich:
 
- Baugrund 45km außerhalb Hamburgs, ländl. Lage, 1.996 qm: 259.000 EUR
- Eigentumswohnung in Hamburg, 3 Zi., Wohnfläche 68,18 qm: 262.493 EUR

Unser aktueller Eastern Cape-Lieblings"flecken":  124 Hektar für 80.000 EUR
Mehr muss man dazu nicht sagen, oder? ;-)

 © Rodger Bosch, MediaClubSouthAfrica.com


PROJEKTZIEL: Umdenken statt Resignation, Taten statt Endlosdiskussionen
Es hilft nun nix: Unsere liebgewonnen Gewohnheiten hinsichtlich Hausbau, Anbau und Raubbau schädigen Klima, Umwelt und Gesundheit. Damit auch uns, unsere Gene, Beziehungen... und damit unsere Kinder. Das lässt sich ändern. Nur tun hilft.

Hier haben Sie die Chance etwas für's Klima zu tun. Auch für das in Ihrer eigenen Beziehung. Genießen Sie absolute Ruhe, inspirierende Freizeitaktivitäten und ein  Paar-Coaching auf einem Ökohof. Ein Urlaub, der für Sie maßgeschneidert wird.

Sie reisen gern? Dann ist es Zeit für einen Besuch in der Khangela! Eco Lodge. :-)

South Africa Garden Route ©Alexander Fiebrandt


INNERE ÖKOLOGIE: Eigene Lebensfreude und Selbstwirksamkeit steigern
Im Urlaub fällt vieles leichter. Was wäre es Ihnen wert, wenn Sie einen Weg fänden...
 
...mehr Verständnis, Harmonie und Nähe in Ihre Beziehung zurück zu holen? 
...die Kommunikation mit Ihren Lieblingsmenschen konfliktfreier zu gestalten? 
...gangbare Lösungen für Stress verursachende Lebenssituationen zu entwickeln? 
...sich in Ihrem Alltag mehr Selbstwirksamkeit und Lebensfreude zu verschaffen?

Coaching inspiriert und bewegt. Selbst scheinbar Festgefahrenes. Lesen Sie selbst.
 

© Rodger Bosch, MediaClubSouthAfrica.com


Grundbedingung, für ein gelingendes Menschenleben ist auch die...

ÄUSSERE ÖKOLOGIE: Bauen mit gesundheitsfördernden Naturmaterialien
Mit Lehmbautechniken lassen sich so märchenhafte wie moderne  Gebäude errichten, die selbst deutschen Bau-, Brandschutz- und Dämmungsvorschriften genügen, sie sogar übererfüllen. Dank Solar- und Windkraft, Pflanzenkläranlage, Regenwasserretention sogar un-abhängig von öffentlichen Versorgungsnetzen.

©Anke Enders-Ngono, Bio-Pool und Gästehäuser, CAD-Darstellung "Khangela! Eco Lodge"


Warum möglichst betonfrei?
Beton ist ein Klimakiller. Er wird mit Hilfe von Industrieabfällen hergestellt und besteht zu großen Teilen aus immer knapper werdendem Sand. Er verursacht jährlich weltweit über 2 Mrd. Tonnen CO2 Ausstoß. Längst ist ein Krieg um Sand entbrannt. Viele Strände, Inseln, Ökosysteme verschwinden einfach. Jeden Tag.


©Anke Enders-Ngono, CAD-Darstellung Wohnküche Gästehaus "Khangela! Eco Lodge"


Ein Einzelner ist machtlos. Gemeinsam jedoch versetzen wir (CO2) Berge! ;-)
Bereits 1 ha Speckbaumdickicht filtert jährlich ca. 4 Tonnen CO2 aus der Luft. So viel wie 1 ha  Regenwald. Im Vergleich zur Pinie speichert der Speckbaum sogar das Hundertfache. Er ist zudem feuerresistent, und übersteht Dürren bestens. Er ist sogar essbar. In Kombination mit extrem schnell wachsendem Riesenbambus in Plantagenwirtschaft, kann man in kürzester Zeit viele Tonnen an CO2 versenken.
Und einige Hekar an neuer grüner Lunge für unseren Planeten erschaffen.


Speckbaum ©Derek Ramsey. Location credit to the Chanticleer Garden


Wissen ist Macht. Und Sie beteiligen sich dabei, es zu verbreiten.
Kunstdünger? Überflüssig. Insektizide? Ebenfalls. Dauerbewässerung? Verzichtbar.  Permakultur nutzt wissenschaftlich  -Ökosystems und Wasserretentionslandschaften. Die Zusammenarbeit mit WWOOF International hilft bei der Verbreitung.

Sie schaffen Arbeitsplätze, Bildung und schenken Zukunft.
Alle Khangela-Angestelleten erhalten ökologisches Fachwissen - und damit Zukunftsperspektiven. Ihr Wissen tragen sie weiter in ihre Ursprungsgemeinden. Samt vieler Speckbaumableger. Was an jedem Ende der Welt zum Durchatmen verhilft. Unsere Atmosphäre ist schließlich nicht lokal begrenzt.


©Anke Enders-Ngono, CAD-Darstellung Gästehaus "Khangela! Eco Lodge"


Ihre Perks im Überblick:



Besonderer Dank gilt unseren freundlichen und engagierten Sponsoren:
                                 

                                 

Wir selbst unterstützen:
                        



Sie haben Fragen? Auf die meisten dürften Sie bei unseren Häufig gestellten Fragen & Antworten (FAQs) bereits eine Antwort finden. Hier nur eine kleine Auswahl:

An wen geht die Unterstützungssumme?
Wann und wie erfahre ich, wie es mit dem Projekt weiter geht?
Ist es nicht unökologisch zu Flugreisen zu animieren?

Wann bekomme ich meinen persönlichen Perk?
Was bedeutet für mich, dass die Damenshirts 'etwas klein ausfallen'?
Wann können wir unseren Urlaub in der Khangela! Eco Lodge antreten?
Sind Coaching, Quadfahren, Reiten und Angeln im Urlaubsperk inbegriffen?
Welche Baumaterialien werden beim Hausbau verwendet?

Selbst recht spezielle  Fragen :-) sind bereits beantwortet, wie z.B.:
Braucht man ein Visum um in Südafrika einzureisen?
Muss ich mich für die Einreise nach Südafrika impfen lassen?
Bietet die Khangela Eco Lodge auch Transferservice vom und zum Flughafen an?
Kann man auch einfach so mal dort vorbei schauen?

Sie würden uns sehr gern unterstützen, können das aber zur Zeit nicht?
Wir verstehen das absolut, und kennen harte Zeiten nicht nur vom Hörensagen. Vielleicht möchten Sie uns ja auf andere Weise helfend unter die Arme greifen?


Weitere Arten aktiv zum Gedeihen dieses Projektes beizutragen
...Nutzen Sie die "Teilen" Tools um die Reichweite des Projektes zu erhöhen.
...Ermutigen Sie Ihr persönliches Netzwerk aktiv mitzuwirken und zu unterstützen.  ...Erzählen Sie an Umweltschutz interessierten Leuten davon. Anderen ebenfalls. ;-)
...Machen Sie junge Menschen aufmerksam, die Zeit im Ausland verleben möchten.
...Besuchen Sie uns nach Baubeginn (mit Voranmeldung!) um mit Hand anzulegen. 


Was Sie sonst noch für unseren Planeten tun können?
Vor allem: Sich über Umweltbedrohungen informieren. Viral verbreiten was Sie finden. Und den Vertretern Ihres Wahlbezirkes maximal auf die Nerven gehen. ;-)
Hier auch ein paar Vorschläge für den Umweltschutz im eigenen Alltag.

Fragen zu Kampagne oder Perks? Riskieren Sie zuerst einen Blick auf unsere FAQs.
Für alle dort unbeantworteten Fragen gilt: Willkommen! :-)

www.khangela.vision  /  welcome(at)khangela.vision    ↑

story:
Namaste! Short summary...

My name is Olivia Brett. I volunteered with ICS (International Citizen Service) February - April 2014 in India with Raleigh International.

ICS (International Citizen Service) is an overseas volunteering programme especially for 18-25 year olds. You don’t have to pay as it’s funded by the government, and you get to work closely with local agencies and volunteers from the country you’re placed in.

I would like to fundraise for the tribal village I worked in called Soolebavi to install an open well pulley system which would mean they will be able to collect water more easily especially in the dry season (it would also mean less water is wasted!)

What We Need & What You Get

Aiming to fundraise at least £200 - need your support to do this!

I am doing this by hosting a photography exhibition of images I took whilst living in the community - all the profits will go to installing this pulley system.

https://www.facebook.com/events/292278467644112/?fref=ts 

YOU can help by donating or you can buy a unique framed image for £15 (at the preview) £20 after this! Unframed images are also available...

The Impact

This system will make a huge difference to the community and make their lives easier. The women especially in the community collect around 10-15 vessels everyday from the well so that they can drink and cook with it.
This is really hard work (as experienced on my placement) and it really made me appreciate how lucky we are to have a basic human right such as water flowing from our taps everyday. 

    Risks & Challenges

    It is difficult coordinating this while I am in the UK - but I have great contacts in the area that I volunteered in who are willing to help make this happen!

      Other Ways You Can Help

      I know not everyone has the means to donate but you can spread the word about the exhibition which will run until Christmas!

      Kindly share the link to my campaign and let's do this together for Soolebavi!

story:
Check out the story of Butte County's grassroots campaign in this amazing video above! And see our Frack-Free California Design below, which is featured in many of our perks, including our sticker! (Scroll down to see our other stickers choices below.)


Our Fight for a Frack-Free Future

California Governor Jerry Brown recently signed legislation that would open our state to a massive expansion of fracking—a dangerous oil and gas drilling technique that involves injecting huge amounts of water and toxic chemicals into the ground. But California communities are fighting back, and here in Butte County—a rural area in the foothills of the Sierra Nevadas—we’re trying to become the first county to ban fracking altogether. If we win, we’ll send a powerful message to state policymakers and provide a model that other communities can follow!

Our first step is to get an ordinance to ban fracking on the November ballot, which means that we have to collect 15,000 signatures by June 6. After June 6, we’ll shift to educating Butte County Citizens about the issue and making sure that our community turns out to vote YES for a ban on fracking on November 4. This is a true story of David and Goliath. Big Oil can spend millions on advertising and political contributions—but with your help, we can build a people-powered campaign strong enough to defeat them.

Why We Need Your Donation

Five months ago, an amazing group of volunteers came together to launch the Frack Free Butte County campaign. We’ve already had a big impact—even getting the County Board of Supervisors to vote in support of a ban. But if we’re going to defeat Big Oil, we urgently need a full-time organizer to take our campaign to the next level. That’s where you come in. With your donation, we can hire a full-time, seasoned organizer who can help us do everything we need to win, including:

  • Organizing and expanding our existing pool of passionate volunteers

  • Training volunteers to run large door-to-door canvasses and phone banks to encourage thousands to turn out on Election Day

  • Creating eye-catching signs and advertisements to spread our message

  • Hosting events in our community to educate voters about the dangers of fracking and outline the steps they can take to fight back

  • Developing engaging advertisements that break through the expensive media strategy of the oil and gas industry

  • Engaging expert help to battle the legal attacks sure to be mounted by Big Oil and Gas before and after Election Day

  • Running a creative and sophisticated campaign to educate voters that Big Oil is threatening our air, water and way of life

Why This Fight Matters

We’re fighting to ban fracking in Butte County because we don’t want to see our pristine water and rural way of life destroyed by a dangerous and toxic form of oil drilling. But this fight is much bigger than just our Sierra Nevada community and the consequences of fracking in our county go beyond our borders. If Butte County is fracked, our entire food supply—which feeds people across the nation—will be put in jeopardy. Furthermore, the Oroville Dam—which sits on a known fault—will be put at risk due to potential earthquakes that can be caused by fracking activities. This dam supplies water to 22-23 million people in California, so the risk of it breaking would be dire.

If we win this fight, Butte County will be the first county in California to ban fracking, which will serve as a model for other counties and send a powerful message to state policymakers that local communities are not going to let California get fracked. We know local bans can have a huge impact on state policy because they played a crucial role in stopping fracking in New York. And California is arguably the most important battleground right now in the fight against fracking nationwide. So whether or not you live in Butte County, or even in California, please click one of the donation levels on the right and become a partner in our campaign!  

The Back Story

Respectful Revolution has featured Frack-Free Butte County activist and spokesperson, Dave Garcia, in this video where he explains our cause and his involvement. 

It all started when retired Park Ranger, and active Sierra Club advocate, Dave Garcia, spoke up to his community about the hazards of fracking. He and Robyn DiFalco of the Butte Environmental Council brought Doug Shields, a city councilman from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, to present on the dangers and risks of the new techniques used by oil and gas companies. The discussion ignited alarm and a group of attendees decided to act. They were concerned about what might happen if fracking came to Butte County and how it would endanger their water, air, agriculture, and way of life.

From that group, Butte County Citizens Action Network was formed and fighting fracking and other extreme energy techniques became its most urgent goal. So far, the all-volunteer team of the Frack-Free Butte County Campaign has collected over 2,000 signatures using both a preliminary petition addressed to the County Supervisors as well as an online petition on CREDO’s website. We have drafted a proposed ordinance with the help of Chico attorney Marty Dunlap and many others, and the petition is now circulating throughout our County.

We are a grassroots coalition of activists and advocates, concerned parents and grandparents, professionals, farmers, artists, professors, and students who have mobilized under one goal: to protect our air, water, and land for generations. Please help us win by making a donation now!  


Get one of these "I SUPPORT A FRACK-FREE BUTTE COUNTY STICKERS" below (or the "I SUPPORT A FRACk-FREE CALIFORNIA" STICKER at the top of the page) when you give $25 to our campaign! You will receive an email at the end of our campaign to choose your favorite. 

    Get a "I SUPPORT A FRACK FREE CALIFORNIA T-SHIRT" when you give                                                          $100 to our campaign!           

          

Please note: your name and information will be recorded as a donor to our Frack-Free Butte County committee. Since we are not a certified 501(c)3 nonprofit organization, your donation is not tax deductible, but it is just as important! In order for us to accept your donation, we will need your name, address, and employer information to report to the state of California. Stay posted for updates from us to collect this information. 

Other Ways to Help

The most important thing for our campaign right now is raising funds for a full time organizer. But there’s also plenty of other ways to help, whether you live in Butte County or not. Follow this link to sign up as a volunteer!

Local Supporters

We are proud to stand alongside our allies in our fight to protect our water, air, and land for future generations! We have the support of Food & Water Watch, The Local Yahi Group of the Sierra Club, Butte Environmental Council, the Label GMO Campaign, Citizen’s Water Watch, and Californians Against Fracking. Thank you!

We also want to give a shout out of thanks to our advisors! Thank you Marty Dunlap, Robyn DiFalco, Pamm Larry, and Doug Fogel.

Fracking FAQs in Butte County and Beyond

1.) What is fracking? And what are the other extreme unconventional extraction techniques that are used by oil and gas companies?

Fracking—short for high-volume hydraulic fracturing—is the unconventional extraction technique of forcing a mixture of chemicals, sand, and vast quantities of water at extremely high pressure into a bedrock formation to fracture rocks and release the oil and gas trapped within them. To learn more about the process, visit this interactive website.

While fracking has received a majority of the media attention in California and throughout the nation when it comes to oil and gas drilling, companies are experimenting with many newer unconventional techniques to release reserves from California’s Monterey Shale. These techniques include matrix acidization, acid fracking, steam and cyclic injection, carbon dioxide flooding, dry fracking, and offshore fracking, and each vary in how they access the contents of the shale.

For example, matrix acidization uses high volumes of hydrofluoric acid and many other corrosive chemicals to break down rocks underground, whereas steam and cyclic injection inject steam and chemical additives into a well and left to soak to release the heavy crude.

2.) Why are these well-stimulation techniques risky?

Fracking, along with wastewater injection wells and other forms of unconventional well stimulation, can pollute the air and water, increase the risk of earthquakes, and lead to severe health problems such as cancer, birth defects, infertility and severe organ damage. It’s not a matter of if our life will be impacted, but when.

The process of fracking is tremendously water intensive and can have negative affects on our water supply, especially in light of California’s drought. The amount of water used varies, with estimates ranging between hundreds of thousands of gallons to nine million gallons per well, and the water is contaminated with a host of dangerous chemicals, oil and grease, high concentrations of salt, and in some cases small concentrations of radioactive material. Since most of this contaminated water cannot be recycled, it is removed from the water supply completely.

This wastewater is either disposed of in evaporation ponds, which can release contaminates into the soil, water or air, or in injection wells, which can cause earthquakes and contaminate local surface and groundwater supplies. For more information, watch this NY Times video or visitOn Shaky Ground.

Furthermore, increased truck traffic associated with fracking contributes to elevated ozone and particulate matter in the air. In 2012, California oil wells required 12.2 million truckloads to transport2.7 billion barrels of water to waste injection wells throughout the state. The combination of increased truck emissions as well as the refining of additional crude oil can adversely affect air quality—particularly in already stressed places in California such as Kern County and the Los Angeles basin.

Much of the oil in California is extremely carbon intensive and will drastically increase California’s carbon emissions. According to the EPA, one barrel of oil releases 0.43 metric tons of CO2. If the estimated 13.7 to 15.4 billion barrels of oil in the Monterey Shale is extracted, about 5.89 billion metric tons of CO2 would be released into the atmosphere. This would greatly contribute to global climate change and would derail California’s AB 32 regulations—the ambitious climate goal of reducing greenhouse gas emissions by 25 percent by 2020.

Air and water contamination are damaging not only to our environment, but to our bodies. Fracking uses hundreds of chemicals, including endocrine disruptors, highly corrosive acids, and carcinogens, which are known to cause serious medical problems such as infertility, birth defects, severe organ damage, and cancer. These health impacts are even more acute the closer fracking is to urban populations. In Los Angeles, well-stimulation activity is located in low-income communities with high minority populations, already subject to other environmental health stressors.

The substances required by these techniques’ operations—silica sand, corrosive acid, and highly explosive crude oil—pose risks to oil workers in addition to nearby residents. Silica sand can become airborne and cause lung cancer, tuberculosis, and silicosis. Hydrofluoric acid is one of the most dangerous chemicals in commercial use and exposure to the substance can cause severe burns, organ damage, and death.  

Employers working on fracking and well-stimulation sites have a job fatality rate seven times higher than the average worker. In addition, the number of rail shipments carrying oil to California refineries has skyrocketed as has the number of proposed oil terminals and rail-to-pipeline facilities in Richmond and Bakersfield, raising concerns among state regulators of future oil spills and explosions.

All of these techniques present many potential threats to our environment, economy, and public health and safety. When you add all of these together, fracking and other well-stimulation methods have the potential to impose more harm than good. The human price of oil has become too high to risk the livelihoods of millions of people throughout the state.

3.) Why is Butte County under threat? What is happening now in Butte and in surrounding counties?

Butte County sits above a tight sandstone formation, which is different from the shale formations where most of California’s oil can be found, but which holds pockets of dry gas. Even though there is gas instead of oil underneath the county, companies can use the same well-stimulation techniques to access it. Currently, Occidental Petroleum has purchased a majority of the 26 active wells in Butte and there is the possibility they could reactivate the other approximately 260 wells throughout the county—of which 90 percent are inactive. Since oil and gas companies were not required to report the location and number of fracked wells prior to January 2014, we do not know if any of these wells have already been fracked. To see a map of the active gas wells in Butte County, click here.

Four out of six counties surrounding Butte County have already experienced fracking and other well-stimulation activities. These four counties, in order of the magnitude of such activity, include Colusa, Sutter, Glenn, and Tehama, and all are located along the Sacramento River Valley.

4.) Why is it hard to find out if they have already fracked in Butte County or what other techniques they are using?

Because information on fracking and other well-stimulation techniques has been submitted voluntarily, no one knows for sure if there is fracking in Butte County. On January 1, 2014, emergency regulations under SB4 were put in place requiring oil and gas companies to report the chemicals used for a frack job and the location of the fracked well. While this is a good step forward, it still leaves room for secrecy. Oil and gas companies are still not required to report the quantity of fracking fluid or the ratio of dilution of any of the substances in the fluid. They also do not have to report the use of well-stimulation techniques other than fracking, such as acidizing or steam injection.

5.) What does Butte County stand to lose if no action is taken against fracking?

Butte County is located in the Sacramento Valley and rests against the foothills of the Sierra Nevada mountains. Agriculture is the largest economic sector, and Butte County is home to many farms that grow rice, vegetables, fruits and nuts. The county is also home to Sierra Nevada Brewing Co. and several smaller breweries and wineries. The Tuscan aquifer provides water for these farms, businesses, and residents and is at risk of being polluted by fracking and other well-stimulation techniques. Once the water is polluted, there is no way to clean it up.

Fracking within Butte County could also affect those outside of it. The city of Oroville sits right below Oroville Dam, which supplies water to 22 to 23 million people in California. It also sits on a known fault. Since wastewater injection increases the risk of earthquakes, there is a possibility the dam could break, endangering millions of residents downstream.  

7.) Is California being fracked now?

Yes, we know that fracking and other unconventional well-stimulation techniques are being used in California, and most of this activity is happening close to prime farmland in Kern County and in dense urban areas in Los Angeles. However, since no regulations required oil companies to report where they were fracking prior to January 1, 2014 (when some emergency regulations were put in place), all of the information we have was voluntarily supplied, so we don’t know how many wells are being fracked. 

The majority of unconventional oil and gas reserves in California are locked within the Monterey Shale formation, which stretches 2,520 square miles across Central and Southern California and rests below the homes of 10 million Californians. According to estimates by the U.S. Energy Information Association, 13.7 to 15.4 billion barrels of oil may lie underneath this shale, and 27,584 wells would be required to access all of these reserves. Right now, oil companies are purchasing large tracts of mineral and surface rights in anticipation of an oil and gas operations boom.

8.) What is the history of fracking in California?

Fracking has been used for several decades by the oil industry in California, but recent developments in drilling technologies have increased the risks of the process. Traditionally, fracking wells were drilled vertically, instead of horizontally, and did not require large amounts of frack fluid or high pressure to extract oil and gas. Only in the last decade have oil companies developed new extreme techniques, such as horizontal drilling, acidizing, and steam injection in order to explore previously unrecoverable oil reserves. But these oil reserves are much more difficult to extract—especially in California, where the oil is thick and viscous—and they require larger amounts of water and chemicals injected under high pressure. Whereas a traditional fracked well might use about 750 gallons of fluid, a modern high-volume hydraulically fracked well can use up to 8 million gallons of fluid. 

9.) Is fracking in California regulated?

Fracking is mostly regulated by the Department of Oil, Gas and Geothermal Resources, also known as DOGGR, but many people are concerned about the agency’s close relationship to the oil and gas industry and the department’s ability to accurately conduct thorough well inspections. On January 1, 2014, SB4 was passed to regulate fracking in California, and it requires DOGGR to track where and when fracking is happening, what chemicals are being used, how much water is being used, and where that water is coming from. SB4 also requires oil companies to test the groundwater before and after operations and to notify surrounding residents before well stimulation takes place. DOGGR has until January 1, 2015, to put together more detailed regulations and finalize an independent scientific study of well stimulation and its associated risks.

But SB4 doesn’t prevent fracking from happening and doesn’t regulate acidizing and new, unconventional oil extraction techniques that are currently in use in California. Another bill, SB1132, has been proposed this year by Senators Holly Mitchell and Mark Leno to achieve a state-wide moratorium on fracking and other well-stimulation techniques.

10.) What are oil and gas companies doing now? What are we up against?

The main oil and gas companies currently operating in California include: Occidental Petroleum, Venoco, Aera Energy, Freeport MacMoRan Oil & Gas, Chevron, and Santa Maria Energy. These companies have been aggressively acquiring mineral and surface rights and/or leases throughout the state, particularly the property above the Monterey Shale, and they have a vested interest in continuing their production without the setback of public health safeguards, stricter regulations, or higher taxes. Over the past five years, the oil and gas industry, including the Western States Petroleum Association, Chevron, BP, and other companies, spent a combined total of $56.63 million lobbying the California State Capital. This is enough money to buy every single Californian household a $4 gallon of gas.

Check out the story of Butte County's grassroots campaign in this amazing video above! And see our Frack-Free California Design below, which is featured in many of our perks, including our sticker! (Scroll down to see our other stickers choices below.)Our Fight for a Frack-Free FutureCalifornia Governor Jerry Brown recently signed legislation that would open our state to a massive expansion of fracking—a dangerous oil and gas drilling technique that involves injecting huge amounts of water and toxic chemicals into the ground. But California communities are fighting back, and here in Butte County—a rural area in the foothills of the Sierra Nevadas—we’re trying to become the first county to ban fracking altogether. If we win, we’ll send a powerful message to state policymakers and provide a model that other communities can follow!Our first step is to get an ordinance to ban fracking on the November ballot, which means that we have to collect 15,000 signatures by June 6. After June 6, we’ll shift to educating Butte County Citizens about the issue and making sure that our community turns out to vote YES for a ban on fracking on November 4. This is a true story of David and Goliath. Big Oil can spend millions on advertising and political contributions—but with your help, we can build a people-powered campaign strong enough to defeat them.Why We Need Your Donation Five months ago, an amazing group of volunteers came together to launch the Frack Free Butte County campaign. We’ve already had a big impact—even getting the County Board of Supervisors to vote in support of a ban. Fracking within Butte County could also
affect those outside of it. The city of Oroville sits right below Oroville Dam,
which supplies water to 22 to 23 million people in California. It also sits on
a known fault. Since wastewater injection increases the risk of earthquakes,
there is a possibility the dam could break, endangering millions of residents
downstream.  
7.) Is California being fracked now?
Yes, we know that fracking and other
unconventional well-stimulation techniques are being used in California, and
most of this activity is happening close to prime farmland in Kern County and
in dense urban areas in Los Angeles. However, since no regulations required oil
companies to report where they were fracking prior to January 1, 2014 (when
some emergency regulations were put in place), all of the information we have
was voluntarily supplied, so we don’t know how many wells are being
fracked. 
The majority of unconventional oil and gas
reserves in California are locked within the Monterey Shale formation, which
stretches 2,520 square miles across Central and Southern California and rests
below the homes of 10 million Californians. According to estimates by the U.S.
Energy Information Association, 13.7 to 15.4 billion barrels of oil may lie underneath
this shale, and 27,584 wells
would be required to access all of
these reserves. Right now, oil companies are purchasing large tracts of mineral
and surface rights in anticipation of an oil and gas operations boom.
8.) What is the history of fracking in
California?
Fracking has been used for several decades
by the oil industry in California, but recent developments in drilling
technologies have increased the risks of the process. Traditionally, fracking
wells were drilled vertically, instead of horizontally, and did not require
large amounts of frack fluid or high pressure to extract oil and gas. Only in
the last decade have oil companies developed new extreme techniques, such as
horizontal drilling, acidizing, and steam injection in order to explore
previously unrecoverable oil reserves. But these oil reserves are much more
difficult to extract—especially in California, where the oil is thick and
viscous—and they require larger amounts of water and chemicals injected under
high pressure. Whereas a traditional fracked well might use about 750 gallons
of fluid, a modern high-volume hydraulically fracked well can use up to 8 million
gallons of fluid. 
9.) Is fracking in California regulated?
Fracking is mostly regulated by the
Department of Oil, Gas and Geothermal Resources, also known as DOGGR, but many
people are concerned about the agency’s close relationship to the oil and gas
industry and the department’s ability to accurately conduct thorough well
inspections. On January 1, 2014, SB4 was passed to regulate fracking in
California, and it requires DOGGR to track where and when fracking is
happening, what chemicals are being used, how much water is being used, and
where that water is coming from. SB4 also requires oil companies to test the
groundwater before and after operations and to notify surrounding residents
before well stimulation takes place. DOGGR has until January 1, 2015, to put
together more detailed regulations and finalize an independent scientific study
of well stimulation and its associated risks.
But SB4 doesn’t prevent fracking from
happening and doesn’t regulate acidizing and new, unconventional oil extraction
techniques that are currently in use in California. Another bill, SB1132, has
been proposed this year by Senators Holly Mitchell and Mark Leno to achieve a
state-wide moratorium on fracking and other well-stimulation techniques.
10.) What are oil and gas companies doing
now? What are we up against?
The main oil and gas companies currently
operating in California include: Occidental Petroleum, Venoco, Aera Energy,
Freeport MacMoRan Oil & Gas, Chevron, and Santa Maria Energy. These
companies have been aggressively acquiring mineral and surface rights and/or
leases throughout the state, particularly the property above the Monterey
Shale, and they have a vested interest in continuing their production without
the setback of public health safeguards, stricter regulations, or higher taxes.
Over the past five years, the oil and gas industry, including the Western
States Petroleum Association, Chevron, BP, and other companies, spent a
combined total of $56.63 million
lobbying the California State Capital. This is enough money to buy every single
Californian household a $4 gallon of gas.

story:
Hello all! I hope those of you reading this are in good spirits and health. 

My name is Ryland Bates. Even though I grew up in northern Westchester County about an hour north of New York City, my childhood's been quite unique. I was raised in Ward Pound Ridge Reservation, known for being the county’s largest park at 4,315 acres of beautiful woodland habitat with over 40 miles of trails running throughout. I'm currently 18 years old, with the majority of my life so far spent in the outdoors, loving every minute. As graduation and college neared, I was given the chance to take a gap year. A plan which I was very set on from the start. A year to really experience what life has to offer.

From late February through August (6 months!) I will be hiking the Appalachian trail. All 2,180 miles from Springer Mountain in Georgia to Mt. Katahdin, Maine

Every dollar that goes into this fundraiser will be used to aid my ambitious six month journey, a once in a lifetime experience...(unless I hike it again haha). Your donation will go towards all gear, travel expenses, food, and anything I need along the way to finish the trek. A little bit can go a long way, literally!

Thank You!

-Ryland

story:
The Octopus Garden is a community garden located in Pittsburgh's Friendship neighborhood. It is a place where neighbors can grow plants, harvest foods, share recipes, and gather to enjoy the outdoors.

One of the most charming features of the garden is Octavia, a mosaic octopus sculpture in the center of the garden that welcomes its neighbors as they pass by. She was donated by local artists Lauren Jean McLaughlin and Bob Ziller. Once Octavia arrived the garden and surrounding area was magically transformed. A simple act like gardening is truly a rich activity, but when combined with art suddenly new possibilities emerge and take shape.

These artistic acts have inspired the purpose behind our funding request. Working in collaboration with the Friendship/Garfield community and artists Laura Jean McLaughlin and Bob Ziller, we aim to build a new art piece in the garden. We imagine the new art to take on the form of a sea creature of sorts, powered by the wind, sun and other forms of positive energy! Some of the interactive elements include a colorful wind-powered whirligig or a weather vane and oversized, kid-made and kid-powered kaleidoscopes! The head of the sea creature will capture rain, tunneling it of the mouth to a small flower garden (rain garden), nostrils will capture the wind and reverberate its sounds and the eyes will light up at night after soaking in the energy from the sun. 

We hope to begin the project in late April 2013 and have asked a local foundation to help fund part of our endeavor. We are reaching out to the Indiegogo community for the following support:

1. Supplies and building cost for new garden beds. Due to old bricks the garden and fruit tree beds are rapidly deteriorating. We would like to rebuild and create new beds with proper wood frames.

2. Two additional rain barrels and funds to hire a local contractor to hook them up.

Please help spread the word!

story:
The Need

Life for Tizade (this campaign is still active)

You can still donate and claim perks.. we are doing ongoing work.  Although this particular dam is almost complete and inaurguration will happen on April 14th.   We will post more pics then of the dam and our ongoing projects.

Suicide is a part of village life in Tizade, Maharastra India.

In the past five years 35 farmers, young and old have swallowed the pesticide designed for their fields - a devastating loss for this small village of only 317 dwellings.

Life in rural India can be incredibly hard. In rainy season it pours, floods come - roofs leak, all turns to mud and the water rushes away carrying precious topsoil with it.  

In only a few short months the heat returns and rapidly dries the land to dust.

  • The women toil often for hours carrying heavy 'dabbas' (water containers) on their heads. 
  • Kitchen gardens shrivel, well levels drop an streams cease to flow. 
  • The village cattle give little milk as they have to walk far for water.
  • The meagre 1 - 2 acre farms only produce one crop a year and the only continual growth is the debt at the banks and money lenders.  Desperation sets in and alcohol provides a temporary escape. Death is more permanent!
  • The other issues which arising from the hardship are:
  • With no money for labour children are needed to help on the farms and education falls by the wayside. 
  • Water borne diseases increase as the levels of water in the wells drop
  • Families disintegrate as people leave for work in the cities and these migrants take their place with countless homeless on the streets, their children forced to beg for food.
  • Mothers will not allow their daughters to marry the young men of Tizade because the risk of widowhood is too great.
  • Alcoholism increases with the pain of no hope of a better life.


Where in all this darkness is the Solution?

We have the potential to make a difference to these issues.

The difference lies in the simple ability to access water throughout the year.

This will bring life and more importantly, joy, back to Tizade.

For those of you who see the potential for change as a result of bringing reliable water supply to the people please support us here - choose your reward and click the link. 

With your help we are building small check dams, traditional methods that in the rush of modern life and the over population of the area - have been left by the wayside.

Check dams encourage the fast monsoonal flow of the streams to slow and dam so that the water has time to soak into the storage below - recharging the aquifers - creating an underground storage of the water supply - the perfect place for this precious nectar of life.

Wells for up to 2 kms from the check dam are seen to maintain a water supply all year round when previously they would dry up. Very often the springs will regenerate and the streams become perennial.

With village and farmer collaboration this work succeeds.

It is clear that with an abundance of water the whole face of the village life changes.

Will you help us?

Do you believe that everyone deserves something as simple and crucial for life as clean, safe water? We most certainly do.  Will you help us give people this basic human right?

We know it works and here is just one story of many that with your help we will recreate:

In a village near Tizade, where a water harvesting program has been in place for some years, we met the head man.

       His story was both painful and inspiring. 

Some years ago he borrowed 70,000 rupiah. (approx USD1,200) from a money lender.  

For this meagre amount his only recourse for repayment were to place his three children between the ages of 10 and 13 with that lender for a period of 7 years. 

 They were no more than slaves. 

Since water harvesting began in his village his family is now reunited - he is out of debt, has become the head man of the village council and is living a relatively prosperous lifestyle.

We will replicate this work.

Our friends at The Dilasa Foundation have done some 600 water harvesting structures and through that work have helped more than 60,000 households.   They are ready and willing to advise us in our work.   Mentors who have done the work before us that we are able to model are of great value.

We know it works.

A better future is available for poor farmers - in just one year.

It only took one good rain to fill this dam below.

Meet Chanda Mukind Moon

Hers is one of the many faces of the village.  Together we will help to bring joy back into the hearts and minds of those who live here.

Chanda and her family are excited for the renewed possibilities that water will bring.

She knows that clean abundant water will change absolutely everything. 

Kitchen gardens flourish, the farmers can irrigate and grow more than one crop a year. With abundant underground water the effects of a time of drought are not so great.

Bank loans can be repaid - communities built - wives can be found and the exodus from the village brought to a halt.

What do we need and how can you help?

We need funding.  You can help with a little or a lot!!

See our list of rewards that we have that will help us to bring Life to Tizade.

You can even join us in the village for a journey experience like no other.  

And please - share - share - share - our campaign as widely as possible with all your connections. 

At the village level together we can make change.

Our job:

Along with fund raising, is the organisation, planning, purchase of the cement and other supplies, as well as creating a celebration for the villagers while the dam building is happening.

The villagers job:

Will help build it. Bring the stone and other materials so they have a strong sense of ownership. They will create also a maintenance fund so the dam can have a long life and bring water for years.

Your job:

Help us with the funding. Whatever you can give will be of great help to us. 

Together we can bring life and community back into the village. When we do that at the personal level, it will filter and percolate up to the higher levels - and ultimately bring harmony to all.

Think Global and act Local .. that's what we are doing. 

Will you help us?

story:
What We Need to Protect the Green River

Clean Water Enforcement Project is working with Quad Cities Riverkeeper to raise $5000 for a matching $5000 grant from McKnight Foundation to support the legal efforts to protect the Green River.  A donation of any amount from $1 to $5000 will help us to provide the legal assistance for the project.

Pollution  and DUMPING on the Green River

Concrete slabs, parts of a rusty combine and other machinery lay partially buried in the sloping banks of the Green River as it snakes through rural Henry County, Ill.

What was a junkyard for old farm parts a half-century ago has become a dumping ground for leftover concrete and asphalt.

The controversy might soon end up in court, as Quad-Cities Waterkeeper, a local environmental watchdog group, filed a complaint with the Illinois Environmental Protection Agency against Ballegeer Trucking of Geneseo and its owner, Dave Ballegeer.

“This shouldn’t be anybody’s private dumping ground,” Quad-Cities Waterkeeper president Art Norris of Barstow said. “It’s our water. If everyone thought this way, think of how our rivers would look.”

Norris has taken his boat up the Green River several times in the past few weeks, taking photos and videos of what’s in the river. He also has taken aerial photographs from a single-engine plane.

The Quad-City Times accompanied Norris on one of his boat trips as well as on the plane trip to see firsthand what’s being claimed.

Besides huge chunks of concrete, Norris said he has found rebar, tires, parts of an abandoned tractor and other machinery and other debris.

The Green River flows about 89 miles from Lee County, Ill., southwest through Whiteside, Bureau and Henry counties before ending at the Rock River in Colona.

Link to Article about the Green River in the Quad City Times:

http://qctimes.com/news/local/article_d85ccb00-...

story:
Water, our greatest commodity

Water is a growing commodity on a world scale, and investors are starting to line up with large global projects. But rapid industrialization, increasing agricultural use, and climate change have contributed to worldwide water shortages. From a WHO report in 2015, 1 in 10 people lack access to safe water. We want to be part of the solution by supplying water-from-air machines for households and small businesses, directly from the sun, with no water supply or power supply.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

(photo by Leo Rivas-Micoud)

The Story of the Agua Machine

I was flying back on a long business trip from Asia to the US and I began to think about an innovative product: water from the air like a dehumidifier but clean to drink, able to function off-grid so solar powered is required, and lastly, an IOT device to be able to monitor and control all functions.

As I started looking into the product, I saw that there was already an industry that makes Atmospheric Water Generators, but I was surprised to see that all products are AC powered, hence not practical for solar use. Also an AC powered compressor (the main power hog in this system) is inefficient compared to DC power, and all the efficiency is needed when solar powered.

 

The Agua Machine was born, and the design of the prototype unit had begun. Below are the main features of the Agua Machine:

  • Direct Solar Powered
  • 40L of water per day (with 70ºF and 60% humidity)
  • Innovative high efficiency design
  • All systems designed for uniqueness of solar power
  • Extensive filtering to remove microbes and viruses
  • All main parameters connected, IOT over the cell network.

3D drawing of the Agua Machine prototype

 

But can we do it?

This type of product requires specialist electrical engineering technology (power switching and software), and specialist mechanical engineering technology (innovative dehumidifier design). I (Keith) am a professional electrical engineer with many years experience working with the type of motors and electronics needed for the Agua Machine. But when I started, I was definitely lacking in the knowledge of the dehumidifier and filter design. Luckily I was able to connect with Roland Wahlgren of Atmoswater Research, an expert in atmospheric water generators. Also an on board microncontroller controls all the power switching function, all the sensors, as well as the IOT function. This will only work with the expertise of our software engineer, Robert Meade. And lastly, our storyteller, the man behind the video is My Friend Dan, Dan Freund. Together we have come up an innovative design pushing the limits of water-from-air technology and solar generated DC power, all connected.

 

 

In a nutshell, water is contained in the air in its gaseous form (there is more water in warm humid air). The Agua Machine cools the air to just below the air's dew point, the water condensers in the evaporator and is then collected and filtered to remove any microbials to produce clean drinking water, water from air.

 

Who would use the Agua Machine?

As an atmospheric water generator, the optimal condition is a warm and humid climate; with these conditions, the most water will be produced. As the projected capacity of the Agua Machine is 40 liters per day, then the Agua Machine can be used most in off grid areas with unreliable water supplies; families in developing countries that rely on bottled water, or small businesses that cannot rely on the local water supply. With the Agua machine, it is a reliable, self sufficient source of clean water.

 

 

Why we need the campaign?

The design of the Agua Machine prototype is complete; the electrical PCB (which is the controller for the whole unit) has been made and the parts have been added.

But the cost of the full prototype of the Agua Machine with everything fully functioning, is about $3000. And that is not including the solar panels. Hence to even build a few prototypes to optimize the design, and fully test the product at location before moving to production becomes quite costly.

So please help us raise funds to build at least three prototypes. These prototypes will be sent to people around the world, in need of self sufficient clean water. They will be able to enjoy clean water for free, and with the IOT, we will be able to assess how the Agua Machine works in the real location.

 

What are the Perks?


Obviously it is not possible to expect friends and supporters to put out $3000+ for a full Agua Machine (but it will be great if somebody does!), so we gave you some fun options to give you the opportunity to help us with this project:

 

Agua Machine donation #1,
$5
Give a little towards the Agua Machine prototype; each few dollars helps us continue our product development. If funded, the prototypes will be sent to families around the world in need to clean water.

Tapped, the movie
$10
Rent this award winning movie.

Tapped explores the dark side of the bottled water industry; including perhaps worst of all is America's catastrophic overall failure to recycle plastic water bottles, resulting in an avalanche of non-biodegradable waste being pitched into landfills, or even straight into the ocean.

With this perk, we will send you an Amazon E Card for $5 for you to purchase your rental.

Alchemy Sun and Water T shirt
$19
100% cotton soft material T shirt with the Alchemy Sun and Water logo discretely on the front. You know you want one, all the cool kids are wearing one...

 

Agua Machine donation #2,
$25

Give a little more to the Agua Machine prototype; everything helps us continue our product development. If funded, the prototypes will be sent to families around the world in need to clean water.

Water-from-Air, a Quick Guide
$36

Want to know more about water-from-air technology? Learn from our expert, Roland Wahlgren.

This book provides technical and scientific aspects of water-from-air machine (atmospheric water generator) operation; the technology is introduced and explained for prospective buyers, owners, and users of this equipment. The knowledge in this guide is valuable for making cost-effective decisions about using the freshwater resource that exists in Earth’s atmosphere.

 

Agua Machine prototype,
$3000
Give for a full prototype, wow. Now that would be great. With this perk, you would receive a fully functioning Agua Machine yourself, wherever you live; shipped to you, turn it on, and self sufficient clean water right there for you. Or maybe better, donate a full prototype to a family that needs clean water. Be aware, this price does not include the solar panels (but the Agua Machine prototype will also be equipped for AC power).

 

Agua Machine prototype, with the solar panels,
$4500
Give for a full prototype and solar panels for the full off grid experience. With this perk, you would receive a fully functioning Agua Machine yourself with the solar panels, wherever you live, shipped to you; turn it on, and receive self sufficient clean water right there for you. Or maybe better, donate a full prototype with the panels to a family that needs clean water.

Thank you very much for your time, and I hope you can support us on this important project!
