(photo by Leo Rivas-Micoud)
The Story of the Agua Machine
I was flying back on a long business trip from Asia to the US and I began to think about an innovative product: water from the air like a dehumidifier but clean to drink, able to function off-grid so solar powered is required, and lastly, an IOT device to be able to monitor and control all functions.
As I started looking into the product, I saw that there was already an industry that makes Atmospheric Water Generators, but I was surprised to see that all products are AC powered, hence not practical for solar use. Also an AC powered compressor (the main power hog in this system) is inefficient compared to DC power, and all the efficiency is needed when solar powered.

 
The Agua Machine was born, and the design of the prototype unit had begun. Below are the main features of the Agua Machine:

Direct Solar Powered
40L of water per day (with 70ºF and 60% humidity)
Innovative high efficiency design
All systems designed for uniqueness of solar power
Extensive filtering to remove microbes and viruses
All main parameters connected, IOT over the cell network.


3D drawing of the Agua Machine prototype
 
But can we do it?
This type of product requires specialist electrical engineering technology (power switching and software), and specialist mechanical engineering technology (innovative dehumidifier design). I (Keith) am a professional electrical engineer with many years experience working with the type of motors and electronics needed for the Agua Machine. But when I started, I was definitely lacking in the knowledge of the dehumidifier and filter design. Luckily I was able to connect with Roland Wahlgren of Atmoswater Research, an expert in atmospheric water generators. Also an on board microncontroller controls all the power switching function, all the sensors, as well as the IOT function. This will only work with the expertise of our software engineer, Robert Meade. And lastly, our storyteller, the man behind the video is My Friend Dan, Dan Freund. Together we have come up an innovative design pushing the limits of water-from-air technology and solar generated DC power, all connected.
 

 
In a nutshell, water is contained in the air in its gaseous form (there is more water in warm humid air). The Agua Machine cools the air to just below the air's dew point, the water condensers in the evaporator and is then collected and filtered to remove any microbials to produce clean drinking water, water from air.
 
Who would use the Agua Machine?
As an atmospheric water generator, the optimal condition is a warm and humid climate; with these conditions, the most water will be produced. As the projected capacity of the Agua Machine is 40 liters per day, then the Agua Machine can be used most in off grid areas with unreliable water supplies; families in developing countries that rely on bottled water, or small businesses that cannot rely on the local water supply. With the Agua machine, it is a reliable, self sufficient source of clean water.
 

 
Why we need the campaign?
The design of the Agua Machine prototype is complete; the electrical PCB (which is the controller for the whole unit) has been made and the parts have been added.
But the cost of the full prototype of the Agua Machine with everything fully functioning, is about $3000. And that is not including the solar panels. Hence to even build a few prototypes to optimize the design, and fully test the product at location before moving to production becomes quite costly.
So please help us raise funds to build at least three prototypes. These prototypes will be sent to people around the world, in need of self sufficient clean water. They will be able to enjoy clean water for free, and with the IOT, we will be able to assess how the Agua Machine works in the real location.
 
What are the Perks?
Obviously it is not possible to expect friends and supporters to put out $3000+ for a full Agua Machine (but it will be great if somebody does!), so we gave you some fun options to give you the opportunity to help us with this project: Agua Machine donation #1,$5Give a little towards the Agua Machine prototype; each few dollars helps us continue our product development. If funded, the prototypes will be sent to families around the world in need to clean water.
Tapped, the movie$10Rent this award winning movie.

Tapped explores the dark side of the bottled water industry; including perhaps worst of all is America's catastrophic overall failure to recycle plastic water bottles, resulting in an avalanche of non-biodegradable waste being pitched into landfills, or even straight into the ocean.
With this perk, we will send you an Amazon E Card for $5 for you to purchase your rental.
Alchemy Sun and Water T shirt$19100% cotton soft material T shirt with the Alchemy Sun and Water logo discretely on the front. You know you want one, all the cool kids are wearing one...
 
Agua Machine donation #2,$25
Give a little more to the Agua Machine prototype; everything helps us continue our product development. If funded, the prototypes will be sent to families around the world in need to clean water.
Water-from-Air, a Quick Guide$36
Want to know more about water-from-air technology? Learn from our expert, Roland Wahlgren.
This book provides technical and scientific aspects of water-from-air machine (atmospheric water generator) operation; the technology is introduced and explained for prospective buyers, owners, and users of this equipment. The knowledge in this guide is valuable for making cost-effective decisions about using the freshwater resource that exists in Earth’s atmosphere.
 
Agua Machine prototype,$3000Give for a full prototype, wow. Now that would be great. With this perk, you would receive a fully functioning Agua Machine yourself, wherever you live; shipped to you, turn it on, and self sufficient clean water right there for you. Or maybe better, donate a full prototype to a family that needs clean water. Be aware, this price does not include the solar panels (but the Agua Machine prototype will also be equipped for AC power).
 
Agua Machine prototype, with the solar panels,$4500Give for a full prototype and solar panels for the full off grid experience. With this perk, you would receive a fully functioning Agua Machine yourself with the solar panels, wherever you live, shipped to you; turn it on, and receive self sufficient clean water right there for you. Or maybe better, donate a full prototype with the panels to a family that needs clean water.
Thank you very much for your time, and I hope you can support us on this important project!

story:
For every £100 you invest into our project, we will give you an extra £15 interest before paying you back in full by 31st March 2018.  Put £1000 in and you will walk away with £1150, put £10000 in and you will walk away with £11500.  Amazing interest rates on your investment with ThermoProtect, guaranteeing to return you all of your money plus 15% within 2 years.  Better than an ISA!  Help ThermoProtect grow today.  

Short Summary

We are a renewable energy company based in the South West of England, covering the whole of the UK.  Unlike many other renewable energy companies, we strong believe in the process of educating the UK consumer on the benefits of the renewable technologies that we promote, these being:

  • Lapolla Spray Foam Insulation - reducing energy costs by up to 45%
  • Tesla Energy PowerWall Storage Batteries
  • Lailey & Coates Air Source Heat Pumps

We are a company that is passionate on making our mark in the Renewable Industry Sector and we have taken huge strides in our relatively short existence, developing our product range and preparing for our nationwide launch at the Ideal Home Show in March 2016 where we are the main sponsor of the Eco Home section.  The show will see 300,000 people attend of which we will have 160,000 people pass through the Eco Pod Building that we are sponsoring.

Our company consists of a dynamic team of directors with some fantastically versatile sales, admin and finance staff.

 About Us

ThermoProtect is a UK company that specialises in the advice and installation of leading sources of renewable energy at the forefront of the ever evolving renewable energy market. We ensure that your home or business will benefit from the significant savings attached to renewable technologies whilst helping you to support the global responsibilties towards the environment, helping you to live green every day.

Our company offers three main products that can help the UK home to achieve substantially less reliance on fossil fuels and these exciting products generate and conserve the energy that a property creates. All of our products are considered to be the best in their field and we are proud to bring you a selection of renewable technologies that have extensive guarantees whilst being the most efficient of their kind.

Neil Rousseau – Managing Director

Neil has years of experience in various management roles across a range of globally recognized companies and industries. Neil is a founder member of ThermoProtect and thrives with the challenges of business development, and is a keen follower of industry trends, and has the ability to identify the most effective and relevant products available to the UK consumer. Responsible for the day to day running of ThermoProtect, Neil specializes in the overall structure of the company and in the management of our admin, telesales, field sales and installation teams to achieve the best possible results.

Outside of running ThermoProtect, Neil has a young family and a keen sportsman, from rugby to golf and a regular visitor to the gym.

Richard Yeo – Executive Director

Richard is a multi business owner with a specific background in finance and business development. Richard is a fellow founder of ThermoProtect and like Neil, is an expert in identifying future trends and business opportunities. Richard oversees the financial, legal and administrative duties within the ThermoProtect family.

Outside of work, Richard is a keen participant in a variety of competitive sports and has a young family to keep him busy at the weekends! An avid bird watcher Richard also enjoys long woodland walks with the family.

Jason Keyter – New Business Development Director

ThermoProtect is delighted to welcome our New Business Development Director, Jason Keyter. Jason was born in Port Elizabeth, South Africa, but now lives in Wadebridge Cornwall.

Jason has extensive experience in business development, management and property sales. An accomplished sports person, Jason represented both England and the United States in rugby Union. More recently running a multi million pound five star resort in Cornwall, and his own holiday home sales company. Fantastically connected Jason brings drive and enthusiasm to the team.

Samanatha Yeo – Business Development & Marketing Manager

Sam joined the company following maternity leave in May 2015. She worked for 7 years prior as Office Manager for a leading Public Relations company in the South West. Sam completed a degree in Interior Textiles and Surface Design in May 2008 at Somerset College of Art and Design before moving back to Cornwall to be near her family. From this she began working for the local PR Firm where she helped assist in design tasks alongside becoming Office Manager for the company.

Sam has a busy home life with 2 children under the age of 4 who keep her busy in her spare time, but she also enjoy socialising with friends and spending time with her family outside of work and of course looking after Richard!

Tiffany Rousseau – Business Development & Customer Care Manager

With over eleven year of experience in the hospitality trade Tiffany brings a wealth of customer care skills to the company, dealing with all our customers throughout their experience with Thermoprotect. Aftercare and communication is one of our strongest assets, ensuring our customers have the highest level of service we pride ourselves on.

Outside of work tiffany has her second full time job, two young boys as well as looking after Neil! Tiffany also enjoys the gym and running.


Get in touch

Thermo Protect

First Floor Offices,

Unit 18 Callywith Gate,

Launceston Road,

Bodmin, Cornwall

PL31 2RQ

Contact

01208 78027

info@thermoprotect.co.uk

What We Need & What You Get

ThermoProtect is a rapidly growing company.  We have ten sales agents backed up by a strong call centre, core directors and finance & administration team.  To date, the directors have self financed the launch of ThermoProtect in the period since launch and that has seen a £75000 sponsorship to be the main sponsor at the Ideal Home Show.  Following the Ideal Home Show and the exposure that we anticipate we will receive as a result of our 18 days attendance as the main sponsor, it is our intention to create “Renewable Energy Education Popups” across major towns and cities throughout the UK.  We feel that the UK consumer needs the ability to be able to discuss their questions with specialist advisors prior to committing to a capital purchase investment of a product designed to save money whilst reducing their carbon footprint and we feel that popup education centres will be a fantastic way to promote ThermoProtect whilst helping the UK consumer to better understand why switching to a Renewable Energy product is a wise move.

In order for our company to grow and maximise its exposure at the Ideal Home Show and thereafter, we want to fund to purchase of miniature eco style homes that can be transported to locations to hold residencies in high traffic areas where potential customers can pop in for a coffee and find out more about ThermoProtect and how it aims to be the UK’s number one drop in centre for Renewable Energy.  In summary:

  • We are looking for £50000 which will purchase 3 miniature eco style homes and pay for the fitting of our product displays.  The cost of the eco homes are £10000 per unit and we believe that another £20000 headroom with give us the ability to completely finance the set up of our pop up show rooms including licences and transportation.  The business on a day to day basis currently generates a small profit within its first 3 months of trading and with a high overhead base, this is a phenomenal achievement.

  • We anticipate that out of 160,000 people who pass through our eco-home at the Ideal Home Show, we will collect a minimum of 10% data which totals 16,000 leads.  Out of those leads, we anticipate arranging home sit appointments for 10% of those leads totalling 1,600 people at a close rate of 1 in 3.  This will generate ThermoProtect in excess of £650,000 profit and will create a huge launch pad from which our business will continue to thrive.  We are at the very start of a journey that will see our products become necessities over the next 5 years, particularly as building regulations continue to change to favour renewable energy as well as the commericial market seeing huge changes in legislation for energy in 2018.

We are offering our Crowdfunding investors with hige savings if they chose to have a home installation of Lapolla Spray Insulation, Lailey & Coates Air Source Heat Pumps or Tesla PowerWall Battery Storage Solutions!

  • If we do not reach our funding goal, we shall continue to use any invested funds to purchase at least one eco show unit from which we can proceed with our plan to create educational pop up show rooms.  Taunton Town Council have stated that they want to focus on becoming a major Eco-Town within the UK and we feel that such bold statements provide us with huge traction to build a significant share of the market for the generation and harvesting of renewable energy.  Any raised funds will primarily purchase eco units at a cost price which hold a greater retail value, therefore, we are creating an asset base rather than a cash burn scenario.

The Impact

For those who invest in our project, you will be helping with the growth and expansion of a company who actually care about the Carbon Footprint of the world and have built a product base that put profits as a secondary benefit to achieving real carbon reducing results for the home owner.  Our products save people money, add value to properties and genuinely have a significant benefit to the lifestyle of those who purchase from us.  Selling our products is important, however, we feel that the promotion of renewable technologies to a wide audience in an educational style where we can spend the time helping the consumer to make informed decisions.  We are a company with ethics who have established an Ethical Trading Point where our sales margin is not to the detriment of mass market affordability of our products.  We do not wish for our products to be available to those with excess funds, we want everyday working class people to be able to afford to purchase our products and reap the reward of improved energy efficiency at significantly reduced costs whilst doing their bit to reduce the global carbon footprint.

We have a variety of case studies from our existing installations where our customers are seeing increased comfort within their properties, solutions to damp issues, reduction in energy costs and general strengthening of their property.  We are proud to have built a range of products that wholly compliment each other and work efficiently together and we are riding the crest of a wave in a market that is yet to build momentum in the UK.

ThermoProtect is all about trust.  We have a 14 day cooling off period for customers, we do not believe in pressure selling to close a deal on the day, instead, we focus on making our products as easy to understand as possible so that our customers can spend the time making some informed decisions before parting with their money.  We feel that this method of sales creates a longevity for our business and builds an inherent value whereby ThermoProtect will become the “go to” company for Renewable Energy Products.  There has been a huge amount of negative press within the renewable sector where government incentives such as Feed In and Renewable Heat Incentive have been used as a bargaining tool to inflate product prices with passing on the real saving incentive to the consumer.  This is where we differ, we believe that if Feed In and RHI are available, the customer should benefit in addition to the fantastic value of our products and the cost savings they can generate.  Fundamentally, we steer clear of greed whilst building a reputation that creates value, trust and satisfaction.

Risks & Challenges

Our business was built by people who are passionate about reducing the carbon footprint of the UK consumer – we genuinely care.  The renewable sector is a busy market place which sees companies come and go due to rapid growth and decline that follow the trends of the level of government incentive behind the product.  Our products require an investment from the consumer, they aren’t free and on the whole, do not come with grants or incentives other than the fact they do exactly what they say on the tin.  We believe that our market place and competitor profile is reasonably buoyant and despite the fact we have other people doing what we do, the feedback from our existing customer base is exemplary.  Our company is attractive to work for, it pays its employees fairly, it gains trust and respect from those employees who enjoy managing our customer expectations in a brutally upfront and honest way.  There are many companies who take the approach of “sell at all costs” or “buy low and sell high”, we take the approach to buy low, sell fairly and sell to those who want our products and will benefit from having our products.  It is this approach that sets us apart from our competitors and as our company profile proliferates with word of mouth to become the “trusted” renewable energy brand, we feel that our business will grow exponentially.

Since our launch, we have had to make some tough decisions.  We have had sales agents who didn’t fit in with our ethics, we have had to build serious relationships of trust and honour with our suppliers whose brands we represent and most importantly, we have had to learn how to build a rapport with our customers so that we are at the forefront of their thoughts as and when the venture into the renewable energy marketplace.  The rapid decrease in price of oil and gas hasn’t helped the renewable energy market to grow as quickly as perhaps it should have done and this is a challenge we face, particularly because cost is not everything whereas doing our bit to safeguard the global environment for our children, grand children and many more generations to come, remains our challenge and the legacy from which we will be known.

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be interested to invest in our company at this present stage of time, however, if you believe in what we do, we welcome word of mouth recommendations.  If you choose not to invest but you have an interest in our company and our products, please feel free to contact us to discuss your requirements. 

If you choose to invest in us, you will be helping us to build a national brand over the next 5 years of which we can all be proud of.  Our core values and ethics are important to us and we believe in a better future for energy consumers where homes and properties can become self sustainable, using off-grid technology at a fraction of the cost.

story:
YOU ARE CORDIALLY INVITED TO INVENT THE FUTURE. 

In this world that seems to have gone crazy, we find ourselves in an electrifying time of action and collaboration. Our highest callings are rising up at this very moment, and now is the time for us to ground our ::magic:: and create the alternative we've always dreamed: One that is rooted in joy, sanity, self-expression, love, and connection with each other, and the Earth. 

We have ourselves here a very unique situation, and we created this campaign to explain things as simply as possible, and have a MASSIVE reach, because this truly will only work if it involves a FORCE of us change-makers. Are you ready? ARE YOU READY??? 

Imagine an edible enchanted forest, permaculture and synth-building workshops, farming dance parties, custom-made tree houses, hundred-person jam sessions, midnight meditations, sweat lodge saunas, Tibetan yoga classes, a self-education center, sound baths, Massage Mondays.

Imagine a library stocked with mystical texts, an incubator for the newest green technologies, cooking marathons, youth empowerment, wellness services for veterans, community resources for families, Earth ritual, moon circles, bonfires, birthdays, office field trips, weddings, divorces, inventing the future of everything! What do you desire? LET'S BUILD IT.

Do you want to come hiking and see the leaves blooming? Do you want to plan a shamanic theater piece in the woods? Do you want to learn how to fly? What do you want to see happen at the other end of the trainbow here in the New Fertile Crescent? 

To activate the full splendor of the mountain and facilities, we are calling in Burning Man camps and city-based communities: Do you want to have a sustainably permanent gathering, retreat and set-building space in nature? {‌{ YOUR CAMP HERE -- let's build that perma-playa we all want! }‌}

HERE'S WHAT WE’VE GOT 

188 ACRES OF LAND RIGHT OFF THE TRAINBOW FROM NYC in WASSAIC.... 

THE TURTLE SANCTUARY - 30 Acres - This is the "moat"...  when you get off the train from Grand Central, you walk the pathway, about 13 minutes, and we'll see you on the other side. 

 

BARNS, FARMLAND AND FIELDS - 6 Acres

Grow food, herbs and possibility with us! And... Enter: the Unlearning Center. A library, workspace, gathering area, relaxation room, downstairs kitchen, Transformation Station, a recording studio/jam space in the making... what more shall we build?

We've got several barns, sheds and spaces are ready for evolution, new utility and artistic beauty abounding. As more creative spirits enter the mix and find ways to plug in, our community grows! 

8 BEDROOM HOUSE 

With two kitchens, several chill spaces, and 7 bedrooms ready to be repainted by artists and named with love. Calling country-dreamin homemakers who want to be part of this project! Here, in the Green Temple:

MOUNTAIN FOREST - 152 Acres

Become a tree-keeper or camp site! Communities, create a camp for year-round refuge and art-building in a Tiny Homes village of our wooded wonderland. 

We are reaching out to our beloved community, extended family and future best friends - anyone whose heart is booming for truth and enchantment. To everyone that is ready to build. Right here, right now, rooted in a unique legacy, poised to truly up the game worldwide, starting here on our 188 acre playground of possibility.

Arc 38  in Wassaic, New York, is 188 acres of mountains and marshland and ::magic::. It’s been home to hundreds of revolutionaries and travelers over the past five years — a wellspring of festivals, retreats, workshops, rituals, and dabblings in experimental living. 

WE NEED YOUR INVOLVEMENT NOW --- AND WE HONESTLY DON'T WANT TO DO IT WITHOUT YOU. 

This is a chunk of our core team right now. We are activists, artists, architects, entrepreneurs, entertainers, systems engineers, farmers, burners, musicians, dreamers, doers--and we are all expanding in ways we never knew possible in order to step up to make this collective dream happen. We can't wait for you to join our selfie! 

FULFILLMENT OF THE LEGACY OF BILL HENRY

The reason we're here at all with this opportunity is because about a decade ago, a man named Bill Henry --- known as the WHALE RIDER for standing up on nuclear submarines in the sixties saying "don't shoot! --- found this land right off the train, and thought, what a perfect place for New Yorkers to come get away in nature. He bought the land and secured it as best he could “For The Movement.”

EMPOWER PEOPLE

In the wake of Occupy Wall Street, Mr. Henry entrusted a young ancient mystic, Eco Lake, with a mission: bring together excellent people to create an off-grid wonder-world that reinvents the script, makes a positive imprint on the planet, and brings joy to the people involved. What did Bill want to call this place at first? "Empower People." 

And unicorns. Bill Henry has specifically asked to have unicorns.

AN INCUBATOR SPACE FOR GREEN TECHNOLOGY 

​A little earlier in time on the seemingly "distant" land of Prince Edward Island, gathered two budding pioneers and inventors dedicated to ecological design and engineering. John Todd and Richard Nelson were committed to the notion of planetary healing and eco-tech innovation and converged to form a group of “New Alchemists" and to test and reveal the "Eco-Machine" at a site called the ARC.... now evolved into: 

We are a place of science, here to serve as a land-based laboratory for the emerging technologies of a better future.  We are excited to work with companies like Solaroof, a new innovative system of vertical farming  that provides a clean break from fossil fuels in agriculture and allows for flexible residential space. You could have an artist residency inside an Agripod growing affordable food for the world with ZERO CARBON IMPACT. There is the potential to scale the project to encompass a network of land centers across North America.  We are steering the ship of the green economy! 

AgriPOD has hydroponic and aquaponic growing systems, and an anaerobic digester to convert organic waste to fertilizer and electricity. It allows communities to go COMPLETELY off-grid. 

It is built from recyclable aluminum and uses both vertical and horizontal space to maximize food production.  It features multiple floors, and overhangs, aqua-ecology tanks, insulated walls and precision control systems.  

The AgriPOD can house organically-raised fish (aquaculture), provide roots and tubers (aeroponics), leafy greens and fruit-bearing plants (organic farming), and even edible mushrooms (mycology), all under one roof.   

THE AgriPOD and technologies like it make possible a world of abundance. There is no reason is it has to be divided into haves or haves nots. Setting the seeds for a new economic system is an important thing we are doing here.

WE ARE A GRID OF ARCS! THIS IS THE FIRST NODE OF THE WEB.

We are connected to a large network of farm and communal properties that are yearning for development, green technologies, and stewardship--such as our neighboring High Valley, and Rickey Farm in Vernon NJ. for which Arc 38 is a model and incubator.

38 38 38: THE STORY

 It doesn't get better than this: at an auction for our very own house on January 10th, 2017 we managed to put down 10% of the bid to keep the house, and set in motion a new wave of inspired action.

As the legend goes…. at exactly 2:38pm, for $238,100, Arc 38 went back 2 Arc 38!

The bid we put down was of 10% of the total. $23,810.

We had exactly a month to raise the rest of it, but long story short thanks to snow and other such miracles…. We got an extension.

In these past few weeks and months, miracles have happened. A powerhouse team has emerged and merged with guts and grace that has positively delighted us all.  

And with it, this campaign. This team has come together, as a labor of love on Valentine’s Day and beyond, to ensure this vision will be come a reality.... and this vision can only be achieved collectively.... that means ALL OF US. That means YOU.

WHAT ARE WE FUNDING? 

— Payoff the loans for 152 acres of land so that it remains forever in the name of the non-profit  ($407,000) 

— Refurbish the 8 bedroom farmhouse ($40,000) 

— Put in new water wells ($24,000) 

— Insulate and upgrade barn facilities ($6,000) 

— Recording Studio + Jam Space buildout ($10,000) 

— Seasonal Operations + event staff starter funding ($10,000)

— New Farm Equipment ($3000) 

— Our infinite imaginations unfolding! Zip lines, jacuzzi, sauna, community programming, lunar technology, research and development, special guests, eradication of money itself to become fully self-sustainable!! Ohm. ($$$$$$)

~ THE 38 PRINCIPLES OF ARC 38 ~

These principles have manifested based on the core values of our participants. We commit to practicing them here, in order to take them out into the world at large. 

1. WE ARE MOTHER EARTH

When we stopped hearing the beating of our Mother's heart, we forgot who we were. Here, we remember. 

This is the abiding principle that grounds our every action and guides our decisions. The WAME covenant is a Bill of Rights of human occupancy of wildlands. It’s an agreement to honor the rights of the Earth by cherishing her creatures, plants, animals, minerals, waters, soil.

We salute our systematic counterparts, the Sun, the Moon, Planets and the Stars.

We Are Mother Earth is a cooperative of organizations uniting people around establishing Earth Rights and weaving futurist eco-villages into conservancy.

Arc 38 is to be a model in the We Are Mother Earth web of preserving the ancient future… keeping this and all land vibrant for all the generations to come.

2. THIS IS A CULTURE OF GRATITUDE

We live in abundance. We are making scarcity is a thing of the past. There is more than enough, and we are each so very lucky to be alive at this moment in time. We practice gratitude daily. We have everything we need. We give each other gratitude for dessert, and then we have dessert. 

3. AUTONOMY

You and only you are responsible for your next move! You are in charge of yourself, and within the structure of set guidelines, you are free to make your own choices. There is never the need to follow a pack. 

4. RESILIENCE

Be persistent!  Bounce back. Stuff goes wrong all the time. Here, we operate with hope and belief embedded in everything, so "failure" is always transient. 

5. ARTIVISM

We use our creative gifts to inspire the evolution of consciousness. We are all activists and we are all artists.

..... ( stay tuned as we roll out and evolve the full list together forever! ) .... 

38. PERMANENT::magical::CULTURE

Endless art, zip lines, flowers, strawberry fields and friends forever. By joining our community, you are joining a movement to create ::magic:: everywhere. In our new grid of Arcs under the We Are Mother Earth covenant, we exemplify and practice our sacred commitment to Gaia. We are also committed to being ambassadors of joy in the world! We take these practices  and implement them in sacred spaces and public places. From urban streets to suburban parks, with our Street Team model, we empower participants to take over towns with a three ring circus of enlightenment. Let's paint the streets with the color that never existed before. 

THANK YOU for reading this whole thing, or at least scrolling down to the bottom --- you rock and we want you IN THIS! There is much more information available online -- videos, pics, community testimonies and more, as well as financial information - please contact us for anything at all. And we've got a whole slew of more content ready to go. Stay tuned, get involved pre-season if you are down to help build and farm and get things rolling. RSVP to our Earth Day kickoff event on Facebook (fund us an you're coming -- either in real life or virtual!) and let's build this future thing.

story:
THE JIMMY OCEAN PROJECT - OCEAN POLLUTION-THE FUNKY SOLUTION

 

Hi, I'm David Raine, My connections with the sea run deep, I’ve owned ocean-going square riggers, sailed dhows, Viking longboats and even dugout canoes,I’ve stroked a sperm whale, talked to dolphins and hugged a shark, made films in the East Greenland ice, the Indian Ocean, the Mediterranean and the Norwegian Artic.

And now I have a new challenge. NO PLASTIC FISH ON MY GRAND DAUGHTERS DINNER PLATE.

IF WE ARE ABLE TO INSPIRE JUST ONE YOUNG PERSON TO DISCOVER THE COMPLETE SOLUTION TO THE PROBLEM OF PLASTIC OCEAN POLLUTION - POSSIBLY THROUGH A SCIENTIFIC BREAK-THROUGH OF A NEW RANGE OF PLASTICS THAT BIO-DEGRADE INTO FISH FOOD, THEN WHAT A SUCCESS THIS PROJECT WOULD HAVE BEEN.  YOU CAN MAKE THAT DREAM A REALITY.

IT TAKES ONLY A SMALL AMOUNT OF MONEY FROM MANY PEOPLE. BE ONE OF THOSE.

During my lifetime the oceans have become increasingly polluted with discarded plastic and I want to do something about that. I need your help to do it.

Together with my expert team, are running a campaign to raise awareness of plastic pollution in our oceans. The campaign is called The Jimmy Ocean Project and it involves making lamps from rubbish bits of plastic collected on the beach. We want children worldwide to think about how plastic is used and discarded in the future – microscopic plastic is being found by scientists in fish; that is just appalling. Schools will be our focus and our hope when it comes to clearing up the mess that is developing in the seas and on the beaches all over the planet. You can help by making a contribution – 5 dollars buys 10 school info packs. That could be the difference that you make! We also need comments on the campaign site, so please leave a message. The link to the site is - http://www.indiegogo.com/jimmyoceanproject  This really does matter so much. I live in Cornwall, walk the dogs on the beach most mornings and see first hand the mess washed up with each tide. Thanks again. Let’s do this together. David Raine. www.coastlamps.co

NO PLASTIC FISH ON MY GRAND DAUGHTERS DINNER PLATE.

The aim of the Jimmy/Bibi Ocean Project is to raise awareness of the rapidly increasing plastic pollution in our oceans and to do it in a funky innovative way that gets attention.

The solar powered lamps will be made from collected beach plastic, either collected by you or by us. If you collect plastic beach polluting bits, mail them to us, then that Jimmy or Bibi lamp will uniquely yours.

The lamps are intended to remind everyone that our oceans are precious and that they should not be polluted with discarded plastic.

Plastic does not biodegrade it photo degrades into smaller and smaller pieces that last forever.

 

Initially we will make two solar powered lamp models - Jimmy Ocean and Bibi Ocean, 35cm high – price including delivery worldwide will be $90. As we grow our beach plastic lamp range will increase, also there will be special editions.

It’s a question of getting the message out.

WE NEED TO MAKE THIS PROJECT HUGE – GLOBALLY HUGE - TO MATCH THE PROBLEM.

The more money that we get then the quicker we can spread the word that our fish are eating plastic – just think about that…..that’s horrible!

Please contribute a min. of $5 - five dollars is 10 school info packs.

(Scientific details further on – keep reading.) 

We’ll be a non-profit making organization dedicated to cleaning the oceans and income will be shared between three organizations that are already doing significant work in the field of ocean pollution clean-up www.oceanplastic.net,  www.sas.org.uk   and www.5gyres.org

 

YOU MIGHT NOT WANT A JIMMY LAMP SO HERE'S AN EXTRA OFFER ON TOP OF THE INDIEGOGO PERKS -

THE COAST LAMPS FREE OFFER: Contribute $150.00 or more to the campaign and Coast Lamps will send you one Pool lamp for free. If you contribute $250.00 or more and you will receive a Rock Pool lamp for FREE. Sorry but we do have to charge for shipping which we will do at cost, ( UK, for example £7.90, Europe, £18.00, elsewhere please us the ‘contact’ via Coast Lamps website for a shipping price – www.coastlamps.co. These lamps sell for on my website for £125.00, Pool ($200.00)  and £150, Rock Pool ($230.00) so this really is an extraordinary offer but I believe that  it helps to illustrate my commitment to The Jimmy Ocean Project. On top of receiving the FREE Pool or Rock Pool lamp, which will be shipped to you within 30 days, you will get the perks, Limited Edition Bibi or Jimmy lamp, as listed on Indiegogo, so you get two lamps plus the other things and and we will have money to raise ocean pollution awareness - a real win,win situation. WE JUST WANT THIS TO WORK! A RECENT STUDY CARRIED OUT BY PLYMOUTH UNIVERSITY, UK, AS REPORTED IN THE GUARDIAN NEWSPAPER, Feb. 24th 2013 - ONE THIRD OF FISH IN THE ENGLISH CHANNEL HAVE PLASTIC IN THEM. [ To read article please visit - www.facebook.com/jimmyoceanproject]

One-third of fish caught in Channel have plastic contamination, study shows

Fish were found to contain small pieces of plastic known as 'microbeads', in a study of 10 species

  • Rebecca Smithers, consumer affairs correspondent
  • guardian.co.uk, Thursday 24 January 2013 16.39 GMT

 

THE SERIOUS STUFF!  The core of the problem.

Our oceans are becoming seriously polluted with discarded plastic, billions of pieces that last forever photo-degrading into microscopic pieces that are entering the marine food chain.

In the North Pacific Ocean a floating island of plastic has formed by the gyration of ocean currents which is twice the size of Texas. Floating plastic islands are forming the same way in all oceans.

Granulated plastic is forming beaches on Pacific islands.

Discarded plastic is even reaching the Arctic and the Antarctic – areas that previously were synonymous the idea of pristine nature.

When I collected driftwood as a boy plastic pollution barely existed and now it is the scourge of our beaches and of our seas.

It’s intended that the Jimmy and Bibi lamps will be our ambassadors for behavioural change, but also, and very importantly, a beautiful functioning lamp for your home.

THE SCIENCE:

From the -  5 Gyres Foundation - ‘One of the most serious threats to our oceans is plastics pollution. Plastic constitutes approximately 90% of all trash floating on the ocean’s surface, with 46,000 pieces of plastic per square mile. Why is there so much plastic in the ocean? Unlike other types of trash, plastic does not biodegrade; instead, it photo-degrades with sunlight, breaking down into smaller and smaller pieces, but they never really disappear. These plastic pieces are eaten by marine life, wash up on beaches, or break down into microscopic plastic dust, attracting more debris.

 

Plastic is also swept away by ocean currents, landing in swirling vortexes called ocean gyres. The North Pacific Gyre off the coast of California is home to the Great Pacific Garbage Patch, the largest ocean garbage site in the world. The floating mass of plastic is twice the size of Texas, with plastic pieces outnumbering sea life by a measure of 6 to 1. These floating garbage sites are impossible to fully clean up.

Plastic poses a significant threat to the health of sea creatures, both big and small. Over 100,000 marine mammals and one million seabirds die each year from ingesting or becoming entangled in plastic.

Plastic is also unusually toxic once it enters the ocean environment. Plastic particles are magnets for different types of pollutants, such as DDT (dichlorodiphenyltrichloroethane) and POPs (Persistent Organic Pollutants), and expel harmful chemicals such as BPA (Bisphenol A). Organisms at the bottom of the food chain, such as plankton and krill, ingest the chemicals along with the microscopic plastic particles. As larger fish consume the smaller ones, the chemicals work their way up the food chain. Ultimately, people consume the largest fish, having a devastating effect on human health.

It takes 500-1000 years for plastic to degrade. Even if we stopped using plastics today, they will remain with us for many generations, threatening both human and ocean health. Despite these alarming facts, there are ac

ABOUT THE LAMPS: Initially we plan to have two solar powered LED lamps, a mini and a maxi Jimmy and a Bibi lamp. Both lamps will have head, hands and feet made from sea washed plastic collected from beaches, the arms, legs and neck will be flexible, stay-put tubing so that the lamps can be bent to take on different characteristics – they can be a happy or sad as you want them to be. The feet will be partly cast stone and plastic to give the lamps weight at the feet and thus stability.

The cast body of the lamp will contain the battery and solar charging unit; the solar panel will be at the back of the body so that they can be charged up standing in the window during the day. At the moment the light lasts for four hours per charge but with the new solar units we hope to extend that to six or beyond. Designing a special unit particular to our needs is one of the important reasons that we are seeking funding.

We will also make mains electricity versions of both the Jimmy and Bibi lamps using a low energy LED bulb. These lamps will initially only be available in the UK and Europe – or as special orders. They will be the same cost as the solar lamps in the standard mini and maxi versions. Special lamp orders will cost more and will be priced on an individual basis.  

tions we can take to address the problem of plastics.’

ABOUT ME:  I make sculptural lamps and have a lamp making business supplying twenty or more shops and galleries in Cornwall, England -  www.coastlamps.co   Please take a moment and check it out the lamps have a coastal theme but are very different to the Jimmy/Bibi lamps.

In my youth I collected driftwood and made things and I still do. I’ve lived on or close to the sea most of my life – so the Jimmy Ocean Project is as close to my heart as anything could be.

At one time in my life I was a partner in a company owning five square- rigged sailing ships which we used for film work worldwide – film credits include, Revolution, Columbus, Eric the Viking, Last Place on Earth, Crusoe,  amongst dozens of others. The company was, still is but without me - WWW.SQUARE-SAIL.COM

 

I’ve lain in bowsprit netting, mid ocean and talked to dolphins jumping the bow wave within touching distance; and I’ve seen a sperm whale asleep on the surface in the mauve dawn light on the edge of the Greenland pack ice.

That is not a world where plastic garbage should be.

 

OUR BRILLIANT TEAM - There are five of us, six with me.

Ivo Belohoubek – award winning filmmaker – www.DoGoodFilms.org  and  www.ivolutionproductions.com

Rebecca Harvey – Internationally acclaimed ceramicist, marathon runner and dog walker/plastic collector. www.rebeccaharvey.com

Richard Tennant – Creative director of the design company, Nimble Jack, London – www.nimblejack.co.uk

Amber Raine – My beautiful daughter, an international marketing specialist – speaking fluent French and Spanish. 

Tom Tennant  - works for Disney Animation and who will be making animated promo videos for YouTube of Jimmy and Bibi dancing out of the sea.

 

THE CRUX OF THE MATTER! …..WHY WE NEED FUNDING:

Ocean pollution is an urgent problem worsening exponentially daily so we need to act quickly. We need Jimmy and Bibi to become internationally known eco-warriors that kids in classrooms, on seaside holidays, in the street or in their homes can relate to, and to say, when plastic is thoughtlessly used or carelessly tossed away: ‘Bibi and Jimmy are switched on and watching.’   

  1. $50,000 dollars will enable us to have 5000 specially designed solar lamp units manufactured.
  2. It will enable us to make a series of animated Bibi/Jimmy videos to run on YouTube for the all important marketing and brand establishment.
  3. We will be able to construct a Jimmy Ocean Project website where we can keep everyone updated.
  4. We will be able to gear up merchandising production and employ two people for full time social media networking, pushing the Jimmy Ocean message out. – $50,000 will enable us to get this amazing project started.

 INFO PACKS FOR SCHOOLS -   

Your money will provide thousands of information packs for schools. These packs will contain ocean pollution information, games etc, presented in a quirky but informative way, a pre-paid return packet for sending collected plastic to us for lamp making and other fun things like Jimmy/Bibi badges and stickers.

It’s all about getting a viral buzz going in all forms of media, and down every street, every backwater, into every home, into Africa, Asia and to every Pacific island.

Global! Global! Global!

Your contribution can change everything.

Your money can start to clean our polluted oceans.

It’s that simple, it’s that simple - it really is that simple. 

 

 

 

REWARDS/TREATS/INVESTMENT – What is in it for you?

 

The Jimmy Ocean Project will only work if millions of people get involved. Those of us enmeshed in the modern consumer society are the villains; to make a real difference to the level of plastic used and discarded would, in a perfect world, need us all to act differently than we do at present.

In essence The Jimmy Ocean Project will belong to everyone.

I’m reminded of an edict from Chairman Mao Zedong when China had a plague of flies – he ordered the entire billion plus Chinese population to kill one hundred flies per day.

In a year that’s a mountain of flies!

Apply the same rule to plastic globally – problem solved!

And we can apply the rule but in a smaller way – social media is the key.

 

In this way for instance: Collect/recycle 100 pieces of plastic, send us an image and your email address and we will reward you with a Jimmy/Bibi Ocean ‘I collected 100 Pieces of plastic’ certificate which you can print out.

500 pieces and you will be rewarded with stickers.

1000 pieces and you will be awarded a Jimmy or a beautiful Bibi Ocean badge.

(For the last two categories we’ll need your full postal address.)

And please don't forget to just spread the word, even if you're unable to contribute finanacially then just tell others about The Jimmy Ocean Project because that's what it really all about - SPREADING THE WORD. THANKS.

 

By using the rapidly expanding modern communication technology we have the potential to reach billions of people and that is what makes The Jimmy Ocean Project so exciting – it would have excited Chairman Mao…..… just imagine how many flies he could have ordered to be killed globally via text.

Certificates, stickers and badges are the starter level and this level will always be free but higher levels will be rewarded with T shirts and mini and maxi Jimmy and Bibi Ocean lamps for which we will need to charge. These can be pre-ordered now with a 10% discount or later bought online from The Jimmy Ocean Project website.

 

We will be also running a scheme via The Jimmy Ocean Project website where by collecting plastic is rewarded with points which will go towards getting lamps and other merchandising at discount prices– verifying images needed. Details of this scheme will be on the website.

 

Contributors we want by the millions but partners we would like just two. Invest $100,000 get 1% per annum of Jimmy Ocean Project net profit not to mention tons of extraordinary eco kudos because you could choose to have your profile on our The Jimmy Ocean Project website. The right partners would also have the opportunity to be part of our merchandising.

 

 

 


 


 


. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

rt Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.
story_txt:
THE JIMMY OCEAN PROJECT - OCEAN POLLUTION-THE FUNKY SOLUTION
 
Hi, I'm David Raine, My connections with the sea run deep, I’ve owned ocean-going square riggers, sailed dhows, Viking longboats and even dugout canoes,I’ve stroked a sperm whale, talked to dolphins and hugged a shark, made films in the East Greenland ice, the Indian Ocean, the Mediterranean and the Norwegian Artic.
And now I have a new challenge. NO PLASTIC FISH ON MY GRAND DAUGHTERS DINNER PLATE. 
IF WE ARE ABLE TO INSPIRE JUST ONE YOUNG PERSON TO DISCOVER THE COMPLETE SOLUTION TO THE PROBLEM OF PLASTIC OCEAN POLLUTION - POSSIBLY THROUGH A SCIENTIFIC BREAK-THROUGH OF A NEW RANGE OF PLASTICS THAT BIO-DEGRADE INTO FISH FOOD, THEN WHAT A SUCCESS THIS PROJECT WOULD HAVE BEEN.  YOU CAN MAKE THAT DREAM A REALITY. 
IT TAKES ONLY A SMALL AMOUNT OF MONEY FROM MANY PEOPLE. BE ONE OF THOSE.
During my lifetime the oceans have become increasingly polluted with discarded plastic and I want to do something about that. I need your help to do it.
Together with my expert team, are running a campaign to raise awareness of plastic pollution in our oceans. The campaign is called The Jimmy Ocean Project and it involves making lamps from rubbish bits of plastic collected on the beach. We want children worldwide to think about how plastic is used and discarded in the future – microscopic plastic is being found by scientists in fish; that is just appalling. Schools will be our focus and our hope when it comes to clearing up the mess that is developing in the seas and on the beaches all over the planet. You can help by making a contribution – 5 dollars buys 10 school info packs. That could be the difference that you make! We also need comments on the campaign site, so please leave a message. The link to the site is - http://www.indiegogo.com/jimmyoceanproject  This really does matter so much. I live in Cornwall, walk the dogs on the beach most mornings and see first hand the mess washed up with each tide. Thanks again. Let’s do this together. David Raine. www.coastlamps.co
NO PLASTIC FISH ON MY GRAND DAUGHTERS DINNER PLATE.
The aim of the Jimmy/Bibi Ocean Project is to raise awareness of the rapidly increasing plastic pollution in our oceans and to do it in a funky innovative way that gets attention.
The solar powered lamps will be made from collected beach plastic, either collected by you or by us. If you collect plastic beach polluting bits, mail them to us, then that Jimmy or Bibi lamp will uniquely yours.
The lamps are intended to remind everyone that our oceans are precious and that they should not be polluted with discarded plastic.
Plastic does not biodegrade it photo degrades into smaller and smaller pieces that last forever.
 
Initially we will make two solar powered lamp models - Jimmy Ocean and Bibi Ocean, 35cm high – price including delivery worldwide will be $90. As we grow our beach plastic lamp range will increase, also there will be special editions.
It’s a question of getting the message out.
WE NEED TO MAKE THIS PROJECT HUGE – GLOBALLY HUGE - TO MATCH THE PROBLEM.
The more money that we get then the quicker we can spread the word that our fish are eating plastic – just think about that…..that’s horrible! 
Please contribute a min. of $5 - five dollars is 10 school info packs.
(Scientific details further on – keep reading.)  
We’ll be a non-profit making organization dedicated to cleaning the oceans and income will be shared between three organizations that are already doing significant work in the field of ocean pollution clean-up www.oceanplastic.net,  www.sas.org.uk   and www.5gyres.org
 

YOU MIGHT NOT WANT A JIMMY LAMP SO HERE'S AN EXTRA OFFER ON TOP OF THE INDIEGOGO PERKS -
THE COAST LAMPS FREE OFFER: Contribute $150.00 or more to the campaign and Coast Lamps will send you one Pool lamp for free. If you contribute $250.00 or more and you will receive a Rock Pool lamp for FREE. Sorry but we do have to charge for shipping which we will do at cost, ( UK, for example £7.90, Europe, £18.00, elsewhere please us the ‘contact’ via Coast Lamps website for a shipping price – www.coastlamps.co. These lamps sell for on my website for £125.00, Pool ($200.00)  and £150, Rock Pool ($230.00) so this really is an extraordinary offer but I believe that  it helps to illustrate my commitment to The Jimmy Ocean Project. On top of receiving the FREE Pool or Rock Pool lamp, which will be shipped to you within 30 days, you will get the perks, Limited Edition Bibi or Jimmy lamp, as listed on Indiegogo, so you get two lamps plus the other things and and we will have money to raise ocean pollution awareness - a real win,win situation. WE JUST WANT THIS TO WORK! A RECENT STUDY CARRIED OUT BY PLYMOUTH UNIVERSITY, UK, AS REPORTED IN THE GUARDIAN NEWSPAPER, Feb. 24th 2013 - ONE THIRD OF FISH IN THE ENGLISH CHANNEL HAVE PLASTIC IN THEM. [ To read article please visit - www.facebook.com/jimmyoceanproject]


One-third of fish caught in Channel have plastic contamination, study shows
Fish were found to contain small pieces of plastic known as 'microbeads', in a study of 10 species





Rebecca Smithers, consumer affairs correspondent


guardian.co.uk, Thursday 24 January 2013 16.39 GMT

 
THE SERIOUS STUFF!  The core of the problem.
Our oceans are becoming seriously polluted with discarded plastic, billions of pieces that last forever photo-degrading into microscopic pieces that are entering the marine food chain.
In the North Pacific Ocean a floating island of plastic has formed by the gyration of ocean currents which is twice the size of Texas. Floating plastic islands are forming the same way in all oceans.
Granulated plastic is forming beaches on Pacific islands.
Discarded plastic is even reaching the Arctic and the Antarctic – areas that previously were synonymous the idea of pristine nature.
When I collected driftwood as a boy plastic pollution barely existed and now it is the scourge of our beaches and of our seas.
It’s intended that the Jimmy and Bibi lamps will be our ambassadors for behavioural change, but also, and very importantly, a beautiful functioning lamp for your home.
THE SCIENCE: 
From the -  5 Gyres Foundation - ‘One of the most serious threats to our oceans is plastics pollution. Plastic constitutes approximately 90% of all trash floating on the ocean’s surface, with 46,000 pieces of plastic per square mile. Why is there so much plastic in the ocean? Unlike other types of trash, plastic does not biodegrade; instead, it photo-degrades with sunlight, breaking down into smaller and smaller pieces, but they never really disappear. These plastic pieces are eaten by marine life, wash up on beaches, or break down into microscopic plastic dust, attracting more debris.
 
Plastic is also swept away by ocean currents, landing in swirling vortexes called ocean gyres. The North Pacific Gyre off the coast of California is home to the Great Pacific Garbage Patch, the largest ocean garbage site in the world. The floating mass of plastic is twice the size of Texas, with plastic pieces outnumbering sea life by a measure of 6 to 1. These floating garbage sites are impossible to fully clean up.
Plastic poses a significant threat to the health of sea creatures, both big and small. Over 100,000 marine mammals and one million seabirds die each year from ingesting or becoming entangled in plastic.
Plastic is also unusually toxic once it enters the ocean environment. Plastic particles are magnets for different types of pollutants, such as DDT (dichlorodiphenyltrichloroethane) and POPs (Persistent Organic Pollutants), and expel harmful chemicals such as BPA (Bisphenol A). Organisms at the bottom of the food chain, such as plankton and krill, ingest the chemicals along with the microscopic plastic particles. As larger fish consume the smaller ones, the chemicals work their way up the food chain. Ultimately, people consume the largest fish, having a devastating effect on human health.
It takes 500-1000 years for plastic to degrade. Even if we stopped using plastics today, they will remain with us for many generations, threatening both human and ocean health. Despite these alarming facts, there are ac

They will be the same cost as the solar lamps in the standard mini and maxi versions. Special lamp orders will cost more and will be priced on an individual basis.  
tions we can take to address the problem of plastics.’

story:
About the Trip (And Me!)

For the past two years I taught high school English in Washington, D.C.  Among other roles, I advocated for my students to become environmental stewards and leaders of their communities. Last month I decided to take a break from the classroom to venture into the greater national community for myself.   

My name is Sarah Schaefer and I am going on a grand adventure.  But I need your help. 

In the fall of 2013, I, along with eight other people, will embark on and film a three month long canoe journey down the Mississippi River from the headwaters in Lake Itasca, Minnesota, to New Orleans. As we paddle, we will engage communities in an ongoing dialogue about their relationships to and interactions with this watertrail to give voice to the Mississippi River, its inhabitants, and the many perspectives we encounter along the way. Upon completion of the trip, we will produce a documentary of this journey so that these vital conversations can continue with others beyond the flow of the river.

Why Paddle the Mississippi? 

This is a great question.  As the climate debate comes to a head in the United States, it’s easy to get caught up in abstract political jargon and lose sight of the everyday people whose lives revolve around the health of a natural resource.  Like, say, something as reliably unpredictable as the Mississippi River. 

Those who know me probably know that I love creating strong relationships and I’m also a sucker for romance.  Communication is the key to any healthy relationship, so help me create conversations that inspire others to rekindle or reaffirm their love for our country and its beautiful and essential natural resources. 

What I Need:

So the breakdown is pretty simple.  First and foremost, I need to eat.  I’m asking $720 for all of my food expenses.

Food for one day:

$9

Food for one week:

$63

Food for one month:

$279

Food for the whole trip:

$720

While it would be nice if there were no other expenses, there are.  Both myself and my canoe need to come back to Minneapolis in one piece.  The breakdown is as such:

Ship a canoe to Minneapolis

$130

Pay for one person to travel back to the Twin Cities

$150

                                                                         Total Trip Cost:         $1,000

 

What Do You Get If You Help Fund My Campaign?

$25 – a really, REALLY, really big hug, and lots of karma points!

$50 – A personalized postcard from a town along the way, plus hugs and karma points! 

$100 – Your name featured in the credits of our documentary, a postcard, a hug, and karma points!

$200 – A shout-out to you or your organization on our twitter and facebook with a picture of me featuring your name or company, your name featured in the credits of our documentary, a postcard, hug, and karma points!

$500 – A Paddle For Change T-Shirt, photo shout-out, your name in the credits, a hug, untold amounts of karma points, and my eternal gratitude. 

 The Impact

Without your support, this trip is not possible.  Not only will I personally grow from this challenging and unique experience, but I will connect with new people to develop a constructive dialogue about our lives in the United States and the world.

Upon returning, we will have the incredible opportunity to construct a national dialogue about the Mississippi by creating a documentary of our experiences.  This documentary will spark conversations about our national resources, water usage, the meaning of community, and the very nature (pun!) of what it means to be "in nature."  We believe strongly that these are dialogues that our nation must be having more often with one another, and I would be proud to be a part of this legacy.  Besides, everyone likes a good documentary, amiright?

Other Ways You Can Help

You might not be able to contribute, but that doesn’t mean I can’t use your help.  Please spread the word about our campaign by sharing this page on facebook, twitter, or any other social platform you prefer. 

Send me a message if you think you have connections or information that may be helpful for us.  Though our group has varying degrees of paddling experience we can always use community support.  We welcome your insights. 

 

https://www.facebook.com/paddleforward

http://paddle4ward.com/

https://www.facebook.com/WildRiverAcademy

 

Thank You!

 

 *All extra funds raised over the $1,000 mark will go directly to a general fund for other members of Paddle For Change.*
story_txt:
About the Trip (And Me!)

For the past two years I taught high school English in Washington, D.C.  Among other roles, I advocated for my students to become environmental stewards and leaders of their communities. Last month I decided to take a break from the classroom to venture into the greater national community for myself.   
My name is Sarah Schaefer and I am going on a grand adventure.  But I need your help. 
In the fall of 2013, I, along with eight other people, will embark on and film a three month long canoe journey down the Mississippi River from the headwaters in Lake Itasca, Minnesota, to New Orleans. As we paddle, we will engage communities in an ongoing dialogue about their relationships to and interactions with this watertrail to give voice to the Mississippi River, its inhabitants, and the many perspectives we encounter along the way. Upon completion of the trip, we will produce a documentary of this journey so that these vital conversations can continue with others beyond the flow of the river.

Why Paddle the Mississippi? 
This is a great question.  As the climate debate comes to a head in the United States, it’s easy to get caught up in abstract political jargon and lose sight of the everyday people whose lives revolve around the health of a natural resource.  Like, say, something as reliably unpredictable as the Mississippi River. 
Those who know me probably know that I love creating strong relationships and I’m also a sucker for romance.  Communication is the key to any healthy relationship, so help me create conversations that inspire others to rekindle or reaffirm their love for our country and its beautiful and essential natural resources. 
What I Need:
So the breakdown is pretty simple.  First and foremost, I need to eat.  I’m asking $720 for all of my food expenses.



Food for one day:


$9




Food for one week:


$63




Food for one month:


$279




Food for the whole trip:


$720



While it would be nice if there were no other expenses, there are.  Both myself and my canoe need to come back to Minneapolis in one piece.  The breakdown is as such:



Ship a canoe to Minneapolis


$130




Pay for one person to travel back to the Twin Cities


$150



                                                                         Total Trip Cost:         $1,000
 
What Do You Get If You Help Fund My Campaign?
$25 – a really, REALLY, really big hug, and lots of karma points!
$50 – A personalized postcard from a town along the way, plus hugs and karma points! 
$100 – Your name featured in the credits of our documentary, a postcard, a hug, and karma points!
$200 – A shout-out to you or your organization on our twitter and facebook with a picture of me featuring your name or company, your name featured in the credits of our documentary, a postcard, hug, and karma points!
$500 – A Paddle For Change T-Shirt, photo shout-out, your name in the credits, a hug, untold amounts of karma points, and my eternal gratitude. 

 The Impact

Without your support, this trip is not possible.  Not only will I personally grow from this challenging and unique experience, but I will connect with new people to develop a constructive dialogue about our lives in the United States and the world.
Upon returning, we will have the incredible opportunity to construct a national dialogue about the Mississippi by creating a documentary of our experiences.  This documentary will spark conversations about our national resources, water usage, the meaning of community, and the very nature (pun!) of what it means to be "in nature."  We believe strongly that these are dialogues that our nation must be having more often with one another, and I would be proud to be a part of this legacy.  Besides, everyone likes a good documentary, amiright?
Other Ways You Can Help
You might not be able to contribute, but that doesn’t mean I can’t use your help.  Please spread the word about our campaign by sharing this page on facebook, twitter, or any other social platform you prefer. 
Send me a message if you think you have connections or information that may be helpful for us.  Though our group has varying degrees of paddling experience we can always use community support.  We welcome your insights. 
 
https://www.facebook.com/paddleforward
http://paddle4ward.com/
https://www.facebook.com/WildRiverAcademy
 
Thank You!
 
 *All extra funds raised over the $1,000 mark will go directly to a general fund for other members of Paddle For Change.*

story:
Our Story

Ever since I was a young boy I was obsessed with the natural world and wanted to better understand it. I went to college and university for forest conservation. After a few years in the industry I realized this was not the place for someone who actually cares about the environment and healthy approaches to living. After this realization I decided to look into the basic structure of our lives, mainly food and shelter. With many years of research now, it is clear we are not headed in the right direction with either of them.


Modern Development Issues

We are stuck in the same housing designs we created after world war two when energy costs were low. It is now essentially impossible from a legal stand point, to create a house that will provide the basic functions without governmental inputs and a complete reliance on working to acquire money. After addressing code enforcers on permits for the unorthodox house I wanted to build I decided to build in an unorganized township, meaning no building permits are needed. With this approach I hope to complete the house and then be able to show the public and government, and ensure to them, that it is a safe and viable way to build a home. This will ultimately create a precedent for unconventional, environmentally friendly architecture.


Food

As for our food system, the additives, the packaging, the reliance on the gas industry etc. I dont really know where to start. As Canadians we have become sitting ducks, we have no back up plan as to where we will get our food from when the oil runs out. We have given up on foresight and forethought it seems. 

My girlfriend and I have created six south facing terrace gardens where we grow as much food as we can. We also grow food in our home made greenhouses. We have planted lots of fruit bearing trees and shrubs as well. All of this is to supplement our food that we have to purchase. Slowly we are weaning ourselves off the monetary system and proving ourselves and others with healthy organic natural foods. We have started seed saving and are in the process of creating natural breeds of our own hardy seeds for our northern climate.

Although I have already inspired many individuals who come by to see my life in the woods I will be creating a building school at my property one day and offer a similar program though our local college. 


Housing

Three years ago I purchased 23.5 acres of mature forest 40 minutes southwest of Thunder Bay Ontario Canada. I have built and are currently developing many buildings. To date I have two greenhouses, a small solar powered cabin with a loft and sauna, a root cellar, a smoke house for smoking meat, a tool shed, a wood shed, a compost unit, a workshop, a teepee, an outhouse and an earthship home. That's where you come in. The earthship is a very big project and progress is slow due to lack of funds. It is also the most integral part of our project. An earthship is a sustainable building made of mostly recycles materials. Green construction and sustainable architecture. It's affordable housing for the world. Each of these buildings serve their own purpose and practical function.  



The Impact

This project is an ongoing affair, a life's goal and purpose. I will not be giving up on it whether I get support for it or not but if there was ever a place to put your money I would say self sustainable housing projects would be one of the best places. You will be investing in affordable sustainable living, a lifestyle that is environmentally friendly and viable future for people of my northern climate.


What We Need 

Any money that you give to my cause will go directly to the creation of this home that I am building. The house is called an earthship. It is constructed with auto mobile tires that are rammed full with earth. It is a passive solar earth bermed house that will be completely self sustainable.

I work at a ski hill all winter and every dollar I earn goes toward this project. The tire walls are almost completed on the house. This year I am going to do timber framed posts and beams and the rafters and planking for the roof. All these things cost money. The goal is to get the house closed in this year. If this does not happen the winter will probably do a great deal of damage. We need your help to ensure that we can achieve this essential stage of development.


Other Ways You Can Help

Learn how to build your own house and build it. Grow your own food. Become free of debt. Create a life that is off the grid, sustainable and free of this monetary bureaucracy. Enrich the environment instead of destroying it.

story:
Our goal is to attend the 2012 Peoples Summit for Social and Environmental Justice in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil to engage with other activists, document our experience, and bring the momentum back to Philadelphia.  

This summer, the Rio+20 Peoples Summit is taking place alongside the official United Nations Conference on Environment and Sustainable Development, also known as the Earth Summit. The main purpose of the Peoples Summit is action; convening organizers and activists from across the globe to address the serious problems humanity is facing and to demonstrate the political power of organized people.

We wish to further the efforts of the 2012 Peoples Summit back home. Our plan is to form a delegation with national experts, activists, and lawyers to cover the entirety of both the Earth and Peoples Summit.  

We will:

(1) Document the Peoples Summit with video, pictures, and interviews.

(2) Deliver a live presentation with video of our experience upon return. 

(3) Collaborate on a report with the delegation. 

(4) Most importantly, our goal is to recreate key strategies from the Peoples Summit and help form a coalition for environmental and social action in our local communities.

The mounting frustration with official talks is what fueled the need for people to organize their own conference alongside the Earth Summit. There is an overwhelming sense of distrust since the '92 Summit due to the lack of governmental action and post-summit withdrawal. In the spirit of the Arab Spring and the Occupy Movement, a sea of change must take place to begin to restore the planet.  

We share these frustrations and wish to join the Peoples Summit in an expression of solidarity with those who take a proactive stance in lieu of the feeble efforts of state representatives. We feel this rare opportunity to join together with activists from all over the world is extremely important. By attending this conference we ourselves represent the Philadelphia community and the U.S. as we join a small delegation of attendees at both summits. Bringing REAL action back means an honest effort to make our communities sustainable. We hope to help put in motion a stronger environmental and social movement that will make a better future for all.

story:
Short Summary

Hi all, Stephanie here.  I was 1 of 13 people arrested on September 16th, protesting the building of the northern extension of the Keystone XL Pipeline, a pipeline that will carry tar sands from Alberta, Canada to Steele City, Nebraska, where it will continue on until it reaches refineries in Houston and Port Arthur, Texas.  

Over 60 protesters joined us in our demonstration on Monday to send a message that the American people do not want tar sands.  We don't want them because: 

  • The extraction of tar sands from the ground is energy intensive and degrades the environment.
  • Potential spills are really risky in areas that are dependent on agriculture: access to clean soil and clean water is a must!
  • Refining the tar sands will bring even more toxic air to lower income communities in Texas that already suffer significantly high rates of cancer.
  • Tar sand oil does not mean energy independence -- most of it will be shipped overseas to China and will likely raise gas prices here in the US.
  • The production and combustion of the tar sand oil will increase atmospheric CO2, which we know is a contributing factor to climate change.

The 13 of us feel so passionately about this that we risked arrest and told President Obama and the folks at the TransCanada office in Downtown Houston that we don't want the tar sands: we want our leaders to make better choices for our people and for our planet.  

What We Need & What You Get

Getting arrested is a huge financial burden.  We were charged with criminal trespassing, which is up to a $1000 fine -- per person.  Because there were 13 of us, that equals $13,000.  We have good lawyers on the case, but we still anticipate some hefty fines and court costs.  Here's the deal:

  • We are asking for $2000 to help get us started.
  • But wait, if we reach our goal, no need to stop.  $2000 is nowhere near the potential maximum cost of fines.  So thus, the more help, the better.
  • Any money donated will go to fines, court costs, associated legal fees, and transportation for our out-of-town compatriots.
  • By donating, you'll get the satisfaction of standing with us against the pipeline, against TransCanada, against tar sand extraction, against environmental racism, and against climate change.  Show us your love and support for the Earth and all of us living here!

The Impact

The Keystone XL Pipeline is currently under review by the State Department.  Last Spring, the State Department released an Environmental Impact Statement that was drafted by a contracting company called ERM that had also worked with TransCanada.  Conflict of interest?  

Because the State Department does not appear to be working in the interest of the American people, we need to take a stand.  The protest in Houston was a way to get the attention of the decision makers to let them know that we Americans do not want this pipeline.  And to let President Obama know that if he approves the pipeline, more demonstrations will come.

Our work certainly got media attention.  Local media outlets such as ABC and KUHF picked us up and we were covered nationally by AP and UPI wire stories.  Not to mention Bloomberg Financial News.  We got their attention alright.  

Now we need your help to keep us going!  We want to keep up this work, and the quicker we get through the legal system, the quicker we'll be able to return to our activism.  This is a community effort so now we ask for your assistance.

Other Ways You Can Help

Remember, a little bit goes a long way.  If you have $5, $50 or even $500 to spare, everything is appreciated with love and gratitude.  But if your budget is too tight, you can still help:

  • Get the word out!  Tweet, Facebook, dial a friend etc.  Use your favorite social media to ask others to support us.  Make some noise for us!
  • Remember that Indiegogo has share tools that you can use!
  • We really like cookies.  And Kombucha.    

Thank you all for your generosity!  

XOXO,

The Houston 13
