story:
My goal is to bring to Moore County, North Carolina  TECHNOLOGY IN THE HOUSING INDUSTRY already being applied across the world. This is the use of SHIPPING CONTAINERS as housing units. It has been proven that this is an economical way to provide housing units from small (160 sq.ft.) to apartment complexes of mammoth size. 

Here is some pictures to show what I'm speaking of before going further:http://www.bing.com/images/search?q=shipping+container+houses&id=0893D99FE7B06F017EEEFBC64E80B2A6EBE4C7A6&FORM=IQFRBAHi, Be sure to utilize all of the web-site by clicking on the connections on the right

.My name is Larry. My wife is. Jo <short for Jolene> We are retired and living with friends. We retired from a retail businesses as managers and owners. I am an inventor as well as a crafter with my wife. See my LINKEDIN  bio for further info <larry e. cockman>  WWW.LINKEDIN.COM We are seeking our "last home" on earth and have decided it is to be an  earth friendly project. As seen in the pictures CONTAINER homes are plentiful around the globe.

As contributors to this project you are endorsing my ability to make an impact in Moore County toward more ecological building leading to a savings on our natural resources.

My goal is to raise $22,000 over the next 60 days to build and display a "CONTAINER HOME" to raise interest in this "low impact" housing. If this total amount is not raised I will purchase the container units I need ( $5,000) and continue at a slower pace.

I have the general contractor in hand as well as the sub-contractor to build the initial unit.I hope to make the first unit as much "off grid" as possible. (meaning using solar power as well as other natural sources) MORE ON SOLAR POWER LEADING TO "OFF GRID".http://tinyhousetalk.com/living-grid-solar-power-simple-life/    

You  can find all you need to know by googling "CONTAINER HOMES, CONTAINER HOUSING, SHIPPING CONTAINER USES.

Many of you saw my solicitations of funds for Jo's throat cancer over the past few weeks. Many have come thru and provided us with a little breathing room. Her desire in this is to have a "tiny home log cabin". This consists of one (1) 8feet X 40feet shipping container unit and 0ne (1) 8feet X 20feet shipping container.

Thanks for reading this far. Help me make Moore more sufficient

Larry Cockman.

PS: If you can not contribute at the present time please pass this site along. You may do so by using this "short link" in your -mails.......tks

http://igg.me/at/my-container-home

 

FRIDAY. OCT.27, 2013

WOW!. I WAS WATCHING HGTV WITH MY WIFE THIS MORNING AND GOT A SHOCK. THERE WAS A SEGMENT ON................CONTAINER HOMES.!!

A FAMILY BUILT AN ELABORATE HOME USING EIGHT (8) CONTAINERS. BEAUTIFUL!. THEIR HOME WAS CONTEMPORARY WHEREAS MY WIFE WANTS A "COUNTRY" STYLE HOME.

 

 

Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

The Impact
Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
Make it real for people and build trust.



Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!


And that’s all there is to it.

story:
• Voor een Nederlandse versie klik hier.
  • Aquí encuentras la versión en español.


Los Tuxtlas Biosphere Reserve, the most northern part of the rainforest on the American continent, has a great diversity of fauna and flora. Its crystal clear rivers supply water to millions of people in the region. Each year this important natural resource faces serious threats, as more and more hectares of rainforest are being cut or burned down for agriculture or stockbreeding purposes. The advanced fragmentation of different ecosystems that arise as a consequence has a severe impact on the preservation of native wildlife and flora. 

18 months ago we were able to buy 1.2 hectare of rainforest in the town of Piedra Labrada, a town surrounded by irregular and mountainous landscape of the Sierra of Santa Marta. Our aim was to save this plot of land from further deforestation and preserve it for its inhabitants; including two species of monkeys, a great variety of reptiles and some very old trees. We called it Reserva El Timbre, named after one imposing tree on the land.


We have been eager to take our project to the next level and have been exploring ways to realizing this. A while ago we met two other married couples with whom we share the same ecology-related worries. They have been working in a similar way on the other side of Los Tuxtlas Biosphere Reserve, under the name Selva del Toztlan. Together they have obtained a total of 30 hectares, covering rainforest, woodland and pastures in El Porvenir, on the southeast shore of the lake of Catemaco and in Sontecomapan, extending the lagoon through mangroves to rainforest. Much like us, they bought those lands, individually and together as a team, to conserve and restore them.

As we all aim to make our present and future projects more sustainable, we have decided to unite our forces and set up a more formal framework to solidify our collaboration by means of establishing a non-profit organization.

With the establishment of the non-profit organization "Selva del Toztlan" we don’t just aim to preserve and restore our own nature reserves, we want to play an important role in the conservation of ecosystems and wildlife in the whole Biosphere Reserve of Los Tuxtlas by encouraging other people to preserve and restore natural habitats, by developing material for environmental education and by promoting alternative and sustainable productive processes in the region which won’t affect the rich biodiversity in a negative way. 


The campaign 

Given that we spent our entire savings on the acquisition of the land and the construction of a small eco-shelter, we are currently looking for additional funds to cover expenditures related to starting a non-profit organization and to undertake some much needed maintenance work in the nature reserve.  And that’s why we are launching this campaign…

With your support we aim to:

  • Pay the consultancy, proceedings and notary costs to establish the non-profit organization "Selva del Toztlan";
  • Realize maintenance works in the Reserva El Timbre: tracing a safe walking trail, constructing a composting toilet and installing a rainwater collection system.
You can find more information about the Reserva El Timbre on Facebook.



What we need & what you get

The establishment of the non-profit organization

With the establishment of a non-profit organization we will be able to receive subsidies and tax-deductible donations, national and internationally. That way we can work fulltime on the preservation and restoration of the different ecosystems that we are managing.

To progress the establishment of the non-profit organization and to ensure we meet all legal requirements, we invoked the assistance of an international consultant on non-profit organizations, Alejandro Coria Bretón. His fees, together with the notary payments, will amount to approximately 1.475 US dollars (26.500 Mexican pesos).


Equipping the Reserva El Timbre

There’s still some work to do in the nature reserve. We have calculated a cost of 1.815 US dollars (32.670 Mexican pesos), breaking this budget down in:

A safe walking trail: 1.083 USD (19.490 MXN)

  • Working tools for trail tracing including a small chain saw, spades, machetes and files: 492 USD (8.850 MXN)
  • Signs: information, indication and warning signs to put aside the trail: 111 USD (2.000 MXN)
  • Wage for labour 4 persons during 2 weeks: 10 USD (180 MXN) per day per person: 480 USD (8.640 MXN)

A composting toilet: 470 USD (8.460 MXN)

  • Construction material for a double toilet cabin including bags, sand, bars of 3/8’’, nails, tube of galvanized sheet, mosquito mesh, nuts, washers, hosepipe de 1’’, pipe for the urine, wooden planks and pillars, hinges, wire, lime, recipe tank, demijohn, toilet bowl and lid: 350 USD (6.300 MXN)
  • Wage for labour 2 persons during 1 week: 10 USD (180 MXN) per day per person: 120 USD (2.160 MXN)

A rainwater collection system: 262 USD (4.720 MXN)

  • Construction material including water tank of 1.100 liters, channels sheet of 2.44 meters, channel supports, downspout sheet: 222 USD (4.000 MXN)
  • Wage for labour 2 persons during 2 days: 10 USD (180 MXN) per day per person: 40 USD (720 MXN)

Our primary objective is to establish a non-profit organization. The residue of obtained funds will be invested in the purchase of tools and material to equip the Reserva El Timbre.


The rewards

Besides the promise to keep fighting for the preservation of (those parts of) the rainforest, contributing in our way to life on earth, we offer our donors amongst other things and depending on the amount of the donation:

  • Our sincere gratitude by email
  • A personal home-send postcard
  • A collection of 10 original postcards
  • A personalized visit with guided tour on one of our nature reserves
  • One free stay over in our cozy accommodation in El Porvenir (Catemaco)


Other ways to help

You want to give us a hand, but you lack the necessary funds to donate? Besides monetary contributions, there are other ways you can help us realize our goal.

You could help us by spreading the word on this campaign! Let your friends now. Send it around to your contacts. Make it visible!

We also welcome:

  • (Secondhand) tools or material to equip the reserve (see above)
  • Helping hands to trace the walking trail, build the composting toilet or arrange the rainwater collection system


Our background

Reserva El Timbre

Alberto started his work in the community of Piedra Labrada in the Sierra of Santa Marta in 2003, where he took part in a series of anthropological projects during his university degree. Nele joined him in 2004 as a social pedagogue. The community work resulted in the formation of Chiku Tun, an interdisciplinary group working on investigation, administration and diffusion of living heritage.

Until recently, Alberto was the founder and director of La Casa Verde Ecomuseo, an environmental educational centre in the city of Veracruz, where he had a great collection of animals (mainly reptiles), beautiful wall paintings and an edible and medicinal garden. He organized plenty of activities to create ecological awareness for children, adolescents and adults. Check it out on the Casa Verde facebook-page. 

At the same time, Alberto developed his theatrical persona with Tío Tlacuache (Uncle Opossum), telling the myth of Jomshuk, the god of corn of the Popolucas, in schools and public places. Although the story mainly refers to the origins of corn, Alberto uses this opportunity to include many messages to encourage the public to care for our planet, its animals and plants. On his blog you can get to know more about Tío Tlacuache and his adventures.

Besides his anthropological and educational initiatives, Alberto is also an experienced and enthusiastic musician under the name Zopilote Radiante. He in particular uses his music as a medium to raise environmental awareness. The video of the song ‘Selva’ was shot in Piedra Labrada.

After finishing her studies in Mexico in 2008, Nele worked for 5 years as a consultant in a non-profit organization. During this time she dealt in particular with issues surrounding ethnic-cultural diversity in schools and townships in Belgium.

But her love for plants and nature was strong. She started studying herbalism for two years. An experience that proved fruitful in 2014 when she ventured out to Costa Rica to work on an organic farm. Shortly after, Nele settled in Veracruz where she enjoys getting her hands dirty with sowing and planting. She started her own product line called Pak with ecological products like mosquito repellent, tooth powder and marmalades. Whilst at the same time she continues supporting Alberto with his projects.

For almost 20 years she was an active member in the Scouts in Belgium where she gained her respect for nature, knowledge about camping and working with groups of children and youngsters. 


Selva del Toztlan

For more than 25 years, Victor and Isabel have been looking for a way to share their love for nature and its creatures. Together with their son and daughter, they have dived in nearly all of the Mexican seawaters. They combine this with full-time employment as businessman and English teacher. After work hours, they organize nature camps for children, where they search for protected blue crabs and sea turtle eggs during breeding season. Their passion for conservation has clearly inspired their son Victor jr. who is following in their footsteps and graduated with a master in wild conservation.

In 2008 they met Paco and Edith, both biologists with a vast experience of working in nature reserves and wildlife conservation research in the region of Los Tuxtlas. They have been wanting to establish a non-profit organization to formalize their efforts but failed, until recently, to find the right partners.

In the meantime and with a view of continuing their efforts they bought several hectares of rainforest, mangrove and pasture in El Porvenir (Catemaco) and Sontecomapan; and have worked hard to reforest, to maintain and protect wildlife as well as to create a sense of ecological conscience within the community. 

More information on their project is available on the Facebook-page Selva del Toztlan.

story:
Who We Are 

Save the Water™ (STW™) is a U.S. based non-profit organization composed of volunteers who passionate about protecting our most valuable natural resource, water.  We engage in research, crisis response, global humanitarian projects and education in the pursuit of ensuring the continued health of the world's water supply.  

STW™ was founded in 1999 by Frank Ramos. After working for over 40 years around chemicals and water treatment, Frank grew aware of the thousands of chemicals that are hiding in our water without identification. He shared his concern with his friend, Alan Fusco, an entrepreneur, who quickly recognized the magnitude of the problem. Save the Water™ was created with a mission that is directly related to finding and eliminating toxins from water – and therefore, a vision of clean, healthy water for all people. 

DILOS™ invites schoolchildren to participate in a field trip to the Everglades, a local lake, or other body of water. DILOS™ is designed to spark curiosity in a setting outside the classroom, in order to better inspire children to take interest in science and the water around them.  

What We Need & What You Get

If successfully funded, STW™ will ask a local Florida class of 30 children to participate in DILOS.  Your contribution will help to provide: 

● Equipment: Microscope, Thermometers, pH Meters, Conductivity Meters, Laboratory Glassware.
● Devices: Video Camera, Digital Camera, Projector, Pollution Demonstration Unit
● Field materials: Gloves, safety glasses, sample collection and transport, etc.
● Stationery: Observation Notebooks; Pen/Pencil(s).
● One or more Instructor(s) from STW™.

With these supplies, STW™ will:

● Let children  make observations about their surroundings, note the condition of the plants and trees, look for birds and animals and notice lack or abundance. Children will then form a hypothesis about the conditions of the water and the environment.
● Give a presentation on the water cycle, the scientific method, and facts about water contamination will be given. This will open children's minds to why we should protect this valuable resource.
● Provide a hands on experimental laboratory equipment to test for parameters such as: pH, temperature, turbidity, and conductivity. The readings are then compared with published standards along with previous observations to test the hypothesis.
● Allow students to accept or reject the hypothesis they had previously made and come to a scientific conclusion about the experiment.

Each participant will have the opportunity to become a member of the STW™'s AquaSquad™, and receive a certificate of completion for the DILOS™ Program.

Every donor who provides $25 and over will have their name printed in the front of the workbook provided to the schoolchildren! 

The Impact

DILOS™ serves two important purposes.  First, DILOS™ helps improve educational opportunities to children in the STEM fields. Second, DILOS™ helps educate future leaders and policy makers about the water crisis in America.  

The DILOS™ program intends to:

● Increase children's' natural curiosity and desire to ask questions that will have an impact on our present and future water problems.
● Provide a direct experience analyzing the contaminants that exist in our drinking water sources.
● Give children an opportunity to address the real problems regarding our water supply and offer insight on what they think should be done, thus opening their minds for future alternatives that we may not even be thinking of today!
● Develop solutions and put them into daily practice.
● Allow children to have fun learning something new 

Risks & Challenges

Having held several DILOS™ programs before, STW™ does not anticipate any significant risks or challenges.  With that said, we would be happy to answer any questions or concerns you may have prior to donating.  Should we raise under our fundraising goal, your contribution will go to our future education efforts.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate? Please follow us on Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, Google+ and YouTube and help spread the word!

story:
Short Summary

We are the Friends of Theodore Roethke, a 501(c)(3) non-profit based in Saginaw, Michigan, and we need your help to save a historic home part of the Theodore Roethke Home Museum!


The Roethke House (more officially, the Theodore Roethke Home Museum) is the childhood home of the Pulitzer Prize winning poet, Theodore Roethke, (1908-1963). Located at 1805 Gratiot Avenue in Saginaw, Michigan, the Roethke House has been preserved by the Friends of Theodore Roethke Foundation, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit foundation whose mission is to promote, preserve and protect the literary legacy of Theodore Roethke by restoring his family residences in Saginaw, Michigan, for cultural and educational opportunities.

The Roethke House was designated  a National Literary Landmark in 2004 in recognition of the profound impact Roethke had on American poetry and the influence his home had on his writing. A Michigan Historic Marker marks its location and the house is included in the National Register of Historic Sites. Tours of The Roethke House are available. In addition, poetry readings, talks, workshops, and school programs are regularly offered. A year-long series of events, supported by major grants from the National Endowment for the Arts and the Michigan Humanities Council celebrated Roethke‘s Centennial in 2008-2009.

Friends of Theodore Roethke Foundation has been in existence for over ten years. Currently, the organization is working on capital funding to renovate the Roethke Home Museum, restore the adjacent Carl Roethke residence at 1759 Gratiot into a cultural/educational center with classrooms, and add a greenhouse pavilion for arts events.


1759 Gratiot, built in the early 1900's, is in extreme disrepair. We've barely had money to pay the mortagage on the properties in recent years, and now we need to do some major repairs before the house is a total loss. Specifically, we need to prop up and fix the back porch of the house before it completely falls down.

Please donate to help us save this historic property so we may continue promulating the life and legacy of Theodore Roethke in his hometown!

What We Need & What You Get

We really need about $4,000 RIGHT NOW so this porch does not fall down--and take the house with it!
 
Since we're a non-profit, all donations are tax-deductible. If you wish, you can contact us directly about memberships for the organization. (www.roethkehouse.org)
 
Even if we do not raise all the money needed, we still need to fix the porch (and so many other things!). We'll move ahead with the project regardless, but it would be especially nice to know how we're going to pay for it!

The Impact

By helping us save this house, we can continue with our plan to transform 1759 Gratiot into a center for community outreach in the community. Saginaw, Michigan is one of the poorest and most dangerous areas in Michigan. This community needs educational and cultural opportunities, especially related to history and writing, to help transform it into the great cultural center it once was.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate money, perhaps you could donate help with the renovation, supplies, or help us share our campaign to get recognized by a wider audience!
 
Please use the Indiegogo share tools, and also check us out on facebook (http://www.facebook.com/FriendsOfTheodoreRoethke) and on our website (www.roethkehouse.org)!

A year-long series of events, supported by major grants from the National Endowment for the Arts and the Michigan Humanities Council celebrated Roethke‘s Centennial in 2008-2009.
Friends of Theodore Roethke Foundation has been in existence for over ten years. Currently, the organization is working on capital funding to renovate the Roethke Home Museum, restore the adjacent Carl Roethke residence at 1759 Gratiot into a cultural/educational center with classrooms, and add a greenhouse pavilion for arts events.
1759 Gratiot, built in the early 1900's, is in extreme disrepair. We've barely had money to pay the mortagage on the properties in recent years, and now we need to do some major repairs before the house is a total loss. Specifically, we need to prop up and fix the back porch of the house before it completely falls down.
Please donate to help us save this historic property so we may continue promulating the life and legacy of Theodore Roethke in his hometown!


What We Need & What You Get
We really need about $4,000 RIGHT NOW so this porch does not fall down--and take the house with it!
 
Since we're a non-profit, all donations are tax-deductible. If you wish, you can contact us directly about memberships for the organization. (www.roethkehouse.org)
 
Even if we do not raise all the money needed, we still need to fix the porch (and so many other things!). We'll move ahead with the project regardless, but it would be especially nice to know how we're going to pay for it!

The Impact
By helping us save this house, we can continue with our plan to transform 1759 Gratiot into a center for community outreach in the community. Saginaw, Michigan is one of the poorest and most dangerous areas in Michigan. This community needs educational and cultural opportunities, especially related to history and writing, to help transform it into the great cultural center it once was.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot donate money, perhaps you could donate help with the renovation, supplies, or help us share our campaign to get recognized by a wider audience!
 
Please use the Indiegogo share tools, and also check us out on facebook (http://www.facebook.com/FriendsOfTheodoreRoethke) and on our website (www.roethkehouse.org)!

story:
Help us buy an anti-clearcutting billboard for another month to keep the pressure on the Nova Scotia NDP to keep their promise to reduce clearcutting and ban whole-tree harvesting!

If we exceed our goal, we will use the money to purchase more advertizing to keep up the pressure on the NDP!

Nova Scotia's naturally diverse and beautiful Acadian Forest is one of the most endangered forest types in North America.  Nova Scotians have spoken loudly and clearly that they want better for our forests than the destructive practices of indiscriminate clearcutting and whole-tree harvesting.

Visit www.clearcutNS.com to learn more about how the NS NDP are failing our forests.


Responding to the public's wishes, the NDP government promised to reduce clearcutting and to ban whole-tree harvesting.  Unfortunately, the government is abandoning these promises in favour of promoting the pulp and paper mills in the province.  Whole-tree harvesting and clearcutting continue to destroy our forests.

 

  • We are raising funds to pressure the NDP government to live up to its promises to Nova Scotians to promote better forest practices.

     

  • We've raised enough money already to purchases one month of billboard advertising to let the public know that the NDP have failed our forests.

     

  • We want to raise enough money to purchase another month of billboard advertising to keep up the pressure on the NDP to live up to their promises.

 

For more photographs of what the NDP is continuing to allow in Nova Scotia's endangered Acadian Forest, visit: http://www.flickr.com/photos/jamiesimpson/

Thanks so much for your support!

story:
OUR STORY

In 1989, a group of young, idealistic newcomers to Hawai'i, frustrated over the lack of recycling services in the islands, set out to change things by literally taking matters into their own hands. They used a number of tactics, one of which was to divert plastic, paper and tin cans going into county trash roll-offs to the back of their parked cars instead.  Nearly a quarter of a century later, the 501(c)3 educational non-profit they formed in 1992 has become RECYCLE HAWAI'I  the state's premier recycling organization, with 19 fulltime employees providing a range of recycling and related educational services, including the operation of six re-use centers across Hawai'i Island. 



While the development of the organization has been largely funded by contracts with the Hawai'i County Department of Environmental Management, the recent loss of one of those contracts, worth $100,000, has brought our zero waste outreach and education programs to a screeching halt, compelling us to launch this fundraising campaign. 

We seek to raise $60,000, with all contributions going directly towards continuing our outreach education programs.  The funds will be allocated as follows:


$10,000 for Zero Waste School Presentations to students and teachers K─12,

$10,000 to hold our 10th Annual Art of Recycling School Competition, an islandwide exhibit of art made from recycled materials by K─12 students,

$25,000 to continue our Composting is Recycling, Too! education workshops offered monthly throughout Hawai’i Island,

$15,000 for these additional outreach efforts:

● The Recycling InfoLines, a 24/7 answering service for the east and west sides of Hawai'i Island where callers can get answers to their recycling questions,

● The Hawai’i Island Recycling Guide, a complete listing of local recycling services, updated regularly, widely distributed & available on our website,

● The Recycle Hawai’i website upgrade, to better provide recycling & educational resources, news, articles and notice of events,

● Zero Waste community event support & training.


The above list is ordered by priority, funding below our goal will be allocated accordingly. Extra funds will be used to continue programs into the next fiscal year.  All funds raised can also serve as matching funds to garner grants.


OUR IMPACT

Over the nine years we have been holding the annual Art of Recycling Contest, Recycle Hawai’i has attracted 4,500 participants with 1,650 of them student artists. This program encourages everyone involved to appreciate the inherent value of commonly discarded items as a means to promote ingenuity and respect for resources.  Art entries go on display in the community where they were created and this additional exposure spreads the important message to the students’ peers and mentors.  For many of the students involved, the competition is a formative experience that allows them to re-imagine the wasteful practices they are exposed to on a regular basis.

Since its inception in 2004, our “Composting is Recycling, Too!” program has brought experts in the recovery of discarded organic materials into communities islandwide where they have presented 262 home composting and vermiculture workshops, teaching participants how to turn food scraps, food contaminated paper and yard trimmings into valuable soil amendments.  While most view Hawai’i as a lush Paradise, the truth is our soils are poor in the organic matter needed to produce food crops. Capturing this resource, diverting it from the landfill and turning it into soil provides a valuable service to humankind and Mother Earth. During the course of our program, a total of 4,050 Earth Machines were distributed to schools and households where they were used to contain organic materials during the composting process, with each system providing the potential to divert up to 10 tons of organic matter over its 10-year life. This amounts to 405,000 tons of materials diverted from the landfill by the units already in service. Based on the cost to purchase and distribute these systems, the cost of processing these materials is $5.50 per ton, a $79.50 savings per ton on what it costs our local government to landfill. 

By comparison, our Zero Waste Initiative is a relatively new program, active for only three years, but quickly becoming one of our most important public offerings. Through this hands-on outreach effort, volunteers install and manage sort stations that protect the value of discarded items at a variety of community happenings and organizers collaborate with attendees to create a waste-free event. Over the years we’ve been using this diversion method, we’ve achieved an average 90% diversion rate. . . much to the amazement and delight of all involved.

OUR REQUEST

Please note that we consider no donation too small and all amounts are greatly appreciated.  If you are not in a position to make a monetary contribution, we appreciate any effort you make to spread the word about our campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools and other social media applications at your command.  We are also open to help from professionals familiar with website development and fundraising activities other than online crowdsourcing.

To have more of your donation go towards our programs, contribute by:

MAIL – Check payable to: Recycle Hawaii, PO Box 4847, Hilo, HI  96720 or WEBSITE http://www.recyclehawaii.org/memberdonate.html


Mahalo nui loa – Thank you very much!  Your support makes a huge difference.

story:
WE DID IT!
 
Thanks to our generous base of over 400 backers, Taawon’s crowd funding campaign #Olives4Palestine has ended today with an astounding 206% raised of the original amount requested.

With this target fulfilled, we are well on our way to plant 40,000 olive trees across #Palestine supporting farmers and a greener countryside. 
 
Update 8--We are there!

You still have two days to join #Olives4Palestine crowd-funding campaign.

With the generosity of our valuable backers and supporters, we are now able to plant 40,000 olive trees to empower the Palestinian countryside and farmers.

With the short time remaining, you can contribute and plant olive trees in Palestine. 

 

 

Don't forget that every dollar will be matched with the support of our partners.

Update 7-- Few days left. Help make it happen!

With just a few days left for #Olives4Palestine campaign, we have accomplished so much and still need your help to amplify the result. We have started planting the trees, and still need your support to back and support planting Olive trees in Palestine.

 Help us reach $60,000 so that we are able to plant 40,000 Olive trees across Palestine. Don't forget that every dollar will be matched with the support of our partners.

Update 6-- Short video: Messages from the field 

Update 5-- We did it, but there is more!

#Olives4Palestine is the fastest growing effort to plant olive trees in Palestine. Our campaign has reached its initial target with the exceptional support you've shown and the number of supporters the campaign has gained.


We decided to expand and add another 20,000 trees to allow everyone to take part in this important effort. 


Update 4-- We are almost there!
As we are about to reach our initial target, we need your help to go for the next level and allow us to plan another 20,000 olive trees in Palestine.

WE NEED YOUR HELP TO UNLOCK OUR NEXT TARGET!

 

Update 3-- #Olives4Palestine campaign got support from many marathonists during the Palestine Marathon 2017

Update 2 -- We have exceeded half way through to our target and need your support!
Thanks to engaging community support of over 180 supporters and hundreds of online shares and posts, we have realized just over $18,000 from our $30,000 target for planting olive trees in Palestine. We are planning to plant 20,000 olive trees for a greener Palestine and still need your help to get there.

 

Update 1-- We are nearly half way there

A little over one week into our campaign we are nearly half way through thanks to our engaged supporters. We have also created some media hype online and on social media.

Every dollar counts, so help us spread the word via sharing the hastag #olives4palestine and the link http://olives4palestine.org

Taawon is a leading Palestinian non-profit organization, working in Palestine and in Palestinian refugee camps in Lebanon. Taawon, in Arabic, means ‘working together to do good’, a philosophy which lies at the core of the organization’s mission and governs our everyday developmental operations.

Taawon has previously implemented several tree planting projects, and established over 30 green playground areas for children across Palestine. Through all our programs, we are committed to protecting the environment and have developed an effective environment management system to ensure we comply with the latest international standards.

Palestinians depend on olive trees for a number of essential products, such as olives, olive oil, and traditional soap. Olive oil is at the heart of the Palestinian kitchen, and is an essential ingredient in most Palestinian dishes. Olive oil and ground thyme, “Zayt u Za’tar”, is an iconic dip enjoyed by both the wealthiest and the poorest in Palestine.

The cost for planting one olive tree is $3*. Your funding will be matched with the support of our partners. We pledge to match each $1 you donate with another $1, ensuring that your donation has double the impact. All funding collected through this campaign, and the matching funds, will go towards planting olive trees in Palestine.

The 20,000 tree goal is our target for this campaign, however, we are aiming to plant 50,000 olive trees during the next year. Any donations received beyond our initial target will go towards fulfilling our annual target. 

A number of unique rewards have been selected for our supporters, including your own personalized olive tree in Palestine, free music downloads, and Palestinian extra virgin olive oil delivered directly to you.

Your contribution will make Palestine greener, and will be our small contribution to a greener world. 

Olive trees thrive best when planted during Spring, and Taawon will cooperate with local grassroots organizations and farmers’ groups to ensure the planting is completed on time. Your trees will be cared for by responsible farmers, who will nurture them and guard them against theft and damage.

*The basic cost for one olive tree is $3.  Taawon and its partners will also contribute to ensure delivery and sound implementation of your donation

Perks

 

Campaign Supporters

We Need Your Help!

Your donation is very important, and there are many other ways you can help:

  • Use the share tools provided by Indiegogo to circulate to your friends and encourage them to help us achieve our goal.
  • Use different social media channels to direct traffic to this campaign.
  • Join our mailing list (http://eepurl.com/bZAdR1) to learn when we have similar initiatives that may be of interest to you.
  • Visit our website (www.taawon.org) to learn more about our work.

Use different social media channels to direct traffic to this campaign.
Join our mailing list (http://eepurl.com/bZAdR1) to learn when we have similar initiatives that may be of interest to you.

story:
The "coordinator dream"

It was really unexpected. I got the email and the answer was "Yes, we want you as coordinator of our park!"
When I did the interview with ARCAS, I knew I was aiming high: I am only 22 and I will have to coordinate a National Park.
But yes, they want me! I will be the coordinator of El Hawaii National Park for 8 months and I feel I am getting closer to the objective of my life.
If you are getting interested in my adventure and you want to save sea turtles, keep on reading!

How you can help 

Being El Hawaii Coordinator for 8 months is going to be challenging and enriching, but it is an unpaid position. You can do a lot with your donation! 


What I will be doing

As a coordinator I will work with ARCAS to fight against sea turtles extinction.

Take part in our fight! With your donation we can realize our projects of conservation and education.  

Conservation

- Beach patrols: I will organize the patrols on the beach in search of nesting turtles and I will collect eggs and data from them. We will bury the eggs in a protected zone, the hatchery, and we will wait for the babies to hatch to release them. We need patrol equipment to protect the nests from predators and humans!! 

- Gather a great number of data that ARCAS and other conservation organizations can use to improve sea turtles protection, for example promoting new laws. 

- Research: the park director and I, have already started working on a new research project and we have plenty of ideas!


Education

- Work with volunteers: I will not patrol on my own, I will share this experience with groups of volunteers coming from all over the world. Volunteers are essential to help ARCAS in its conservation actions.

- Local community: I will help ARCAS organize plenty of activities with the local communities, to raise awareness among adults, to improve a local sustainable economy and to educate children.

Not only turtles 

- ARCAS protects the wildlife of the entire Hawaii Park.

- rehabilitation and restoration projects of endangered populations, such as the spider monkey and the yellow-naped amazon, will be organized



The costs

Round-trip ticket Milan-Guatemala City: $ 850 

VISA run trips: $ 600 (in total, for the 8 months). I will have to renew my VISA every 3 months, so I will have to travel towards a neighbouring country and spend 1 night there before going back to Guatemala.

Free week: $ 1200 (total for the 8 months). I will have 8 consecutive days to rest every month, where I'll have to buy my own food . 

Malaria prevention treatment: $ 60 

Equipment : $ 120. I will need good jogging shoes for the beach patrols, mosquito net, insect repellent and anti-histamine cream (both very expensive) etc.

TOTAL: $ 2 830 

ARCAS will offer me housing and food. I will try to cover all the expenses there with my savings, but I really need your donation to fly to Guatemala.


Volunteer with ARCAS

Another way to participate in sea turtle conservation is to become a volunteer. This is a life-changing experience that you will never forget. It's easy! Check ARCAS website: http://www.arcasguatemala.com

Share!

Share this page on Facebook, Twitter or your website, this is the best way to pass the word!


My way to thank you


I will never thank you enough for your support. The only way I have to express my gratitude is to share my experience with you. So I decided to keep the best pictures and videos of the sea turtles visiting our beach and send them to you. I will also keep you updated about the activities and project that ARCAS organizes. Have a look to the Perks section for more details.


Alessandra and the Turtles

The question is always the same: why turtles?
It is always very hard for me to answer. Of course, sea turtles are ancient, elegant, mysterious animals and this is the reason why I first got interested in these creatures. But the more I study them, the more I understand that turtles are more than this: they are part of the ocean and they remind us of its importance. 
By participating in sea turtle conservation we will not only save turtles, but also preserve the environment through public education and awareness. 


My story

I left my family in Italy to go to France when I was 19, to follow my dream of becoming a Marine Biologist. In Marseilles, I got a degree in Biological Oceanography. At the same time, I  learned how to scuba dive and I did an internship about Green Turtles in New Zealand. 
In September, I left for Costa Rica, where I spent 3 months on Caletas Beach working as a Research Assistant with an NGO to save sea turtles.
Caletas Project was my life-changing experience: for 3 months I patrolled Caletas Beach in search of nesting turtles, I collected thousands of eggs which gave birth to thousands of baby turtles that we released in the Pacific Ocean. During this period I experienced the joy of feeling that I was doing something to change things. Working with turtles is amazing and every day is a new adventure. I recommend you volunteering if you are looking for an experience to remember!
Now, I want to get more experience, increasing my responsibilities and duties. I applied for a Coordinator position with ARCAS, an NGO in Guatemala, at El Hawaii National Park and I got the job! I am very excited!

The costs


Round-trip ticket Milan-Guatemala City: $ 850 


VISA run trips: $ 600 (in total, for the 8 months). I will have to renew my VISA every 3 months, so I will have to travel towards a neighbouring country and spend 1 night there before going back to Guatemala.
Free week: $ 1200 (total for the 8 months). I will have 8 consecutive days to rest every month, where I'll have to buy my own food . 
Malaria prevention treatment: $ 60 
Equipment : $ 120. I will need good jogging shoes for the beach patrols, mosquito net, insect repellent and anti-histamine cream (both very expensive) etc.

TOTAL: $ 2 830 
ARCAS will offer me housing and food. I will try to cover all the expenses there with my savings, but I really need your donation to fly to Guatemala.

Volunteer with ARCAS

Another way to participate in sea turtle conservation is to become a volunteer. This is a life-changing experience that you will never forget. It's easy! Check ARCAS website: http://www.arcasguatemala.com
Share!
Share this page on Facebook, Twitter or your website, this is the best way to pass the word!


My way to thank you




I will never thank you enough for your support. The only way I have to express my gratitude is to share my experience with you. So I decided to keep the best pictures and videos of the sea turtles visiting our beach and send them to you. I will also keep you updated about the activities and project that ARCAS organizes. Have a look to the Perks section for more details.


Alessandra and the Turtles
The question is always the same: why turtles?
It is always very hard for me to answer. Of course, sea turtles are ancient, elegant, mysterious animals and this is the reason why I first got interested in these creatures. But the more I study them, the more I understand that turtles are more than this: they are part of the ocean and they remind us of its importance. 

By participating in sea turtle conservation we will not only save turtles, but also preserve the environment through public education and awareness. 



My story
I left my family in Italy to go to France when I was 19, to follow my dream of becoming a Marine Biologist. In Marseilles, I got a degree in Biological Oceanography. At the same time, I  learned how to scuba dive and I did an internship about Green Turtles in New Zealand. 
In September, I left for Costa Rica, where I spent 3 months on Caletas Beach working as a Research Assistant with an NGO to save sea turtles.
Caletas Project was my life-changing experience: for 3 months I patrolled Caletas Beach in search of nesting turtles, I collected thousands of eggs which gave birth to thousands of baby turtles that we released in the Pacific Ocean. During this period I experienced the joy of feeling that I was doing something to change things. Working with turtles is amazing and every day is a new adventure. I recommend you volunteering if you are looking for an experience to remember!
Now, I want to get more experience, increasing my responsibilities and duties. I applied for a Coordinator position with ARCAS, an NGO in Guatemala, at El Hawaii National Park and I got the job! I am very excited!

story:
The Portland Wilderness Gear Library 

Creating a collection of outdoor resources that can be borrowed for hiking, camping, backpacking, snowshoeing, paddling, and biking. 

Last fall I launched Portland Wilderness LLC as a way to bring down the cost of participating in outdoor sports.  I want to open outdoor recreation to those that cannot afford gear, are unable to store it, or are afraid to try new sports because they are unfamiliar.  The Gear Library was designed as a way to share equipment among multiple users - members pay a modest annual membership fee, and then can borrow equipment whenever needed without the extra costs of storage, rental, or maintenance.    

The Gear Library consists of tents, backpacks, kitchens, stoves, bear canisters, shelter tarps, coolers, chairs, grills, maps, guide books, dog packs, mountain bikes, sit on top kayaks, stand up paddleboards, and many other hard goods necessary for outdoor pursuits.  

I am asking for your support as our first full season gets underway  Tell your friends about Portland Wilderness, buy a membership, rent a kayak or bike from us, and contribute to this campaign.  Help us build a more sustainable outdoor gear model and show the rest of the country what is possible when you make outdoor recreation open to everyone.  If you have doubts or questions, please feel free to contact me directly.

-Joe Gawron and Herman

info@portlandwilderness.com / 503.753.1275


Why we need your contribution (and the perks of supporting PW!)

 If you are already an outdoorsy person, please consider contributing to help others get outside and follow the trail you have already blazed.  While the best way you can help is to spread the word about Portland Wilderness and encourage your friends to sign up, please also consider a financial contribution which will be used for the following:  

  • $1200 to cover some costs of marketing this spring and summer.  This includes rental space for events, marketing materials, and web marketing costs.
  • $1000 to pay for our liability insurance bill due early this summer
  • $800 to purchase a tandem sit on top kayak that is more family friendly and a bike trailer for kids
  • $500 for fees and marketing associated with this campaign
  • Funds raised beyond our goal will be used to improve the Gear Library equipment, pay down current debt, and set aside for future marketing and operations costs.  

Visit www.portlandwilderness.com for more information on how we operate and what we offer.


What we can offer for your generosity - The Perks!
  • PW Supporter - $20 - A personal thank you and listing as a supporter (if desired) on our website.
  • PW Hiker - $40 - A Portland Wilderness Gear Library t-shirt, personal thank you, and listing as a supporter on our website.  
  • PW Camper - $75 - Includes an invitation to 3 free paddle and park days on the Portland waterfront, a Green Trails Forest Park map, plus all of the perks from the PW Hiker
  • PW Explorer - $150 - Includes two days of kayak, paddleboard, or mountain bike rental for you or someone you designate plus all of the perks from the PW Camper.
  • PW Adventurer - $350 - Includes a one year membership to the Gear Library Camping, Backpacking, Snowshoeing options (can substitute for an Alpinizmo Mt. Rainier 0 sleeping bag), plus all of the perks of the PW Camper.
  • PW Trail Angel - $800 - Includes an all inclusive membership to the Gear Library for as long as it exists. Access to camping, backpacking, snowshoeing, mountain biking, kayaking, and paddleboarding equipment without additional rental fees.  plus all of the perks from the PW Camper


The Impact

I believe by coupling affordable equipment with quality adventure planning, we can convince more people to get outside into nature.  Most outdoor recreational activities tend to be gear intensive, and our membership based system spreads the cost of 1 set of gear over multiple users.  Members can reserve equipment and either pick it up at our home office or schedule a delivery/pickup.  All they have to provide is a sleeping bag, first aid kit, and food for a weekend getaway.

By contributing to this campaign, you can help build a community resource for the City of Portland and provide a proof of concept for other communities that want to try the same.  I will also gladly discuss our business model with anyone wanting to bring a similar idea to their community, and I promise we will not abuse your contribution or take advantage of your generosity.  The infrastructure and guts of Portland Wilderness have been built, and I need your help to grow memberships to a sustainable number. Thank you for contributing.

-Joe Gawron

503.753.1275 or info@portlandwilderness.com


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to contribute money, you can help build a great resource for Portland.  Here are some other ways:

  • Pass on this campaign info, and more importantly our business information to your friends, family, and anyone you meet along the road.
  • Contribute lightly used gear like tents, backpacks, sleeping pads, and stoves to Portland Wilderness LLC.  While these donations are not tax deductible, they will significantly reduce our operating costs and allow us to pass that savings on to the community.  Contact Joe Gawron at 503.753.1275 to contribute
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Relaunching a project from the 1970's,  The Pease Flag that sailed into the
French Nuclear Bomb Test Zone helping to stop their atmospheric Bomb Tests.

  In the early 1970's I was very active in protesting against

  the War in Vietnam and frequently when I attended rallies in

  San Francisco our American flag was being burned.  I understood

  the anger that motivated people to do this but I thought

  destroying the flag did not solve the problem,  another

  message was needed.  I graduated from George Washington University

  and I asked myself,  "What would George do?"   I decided to make a

  flag for Peace.  Prior to this I never saw a Peace symbol

  on a flag.   First, I made some out of cotton, but they quickly tore

  apart in the wind,  and after awhile I decided to make a

  "lasting peace" out of nylon, a much stronger material,  but there was a   problem,  and that was that they were very

  expensive and not many people could afford them.

  My favorite one was a yellow field with a black symbol patterned after a

  flag I saw in Stockholm some years before.

  Here's what makes mine so special . . .

  I was working in San Francisco

  and would drive north over the Golden Gate bridge through Sausalito

  a coastal town to Corte Madera where I lived at the time.  One day

  I noticed a sailboat anchored in the Bay

  and I thought it would be nice to see my flag flying from

  the top of their mast.

  Sometime later the boat was no longer in the Bay but in dry dock

  at the end of town giving me an opportunity to visit them and sell

  them a flag.  I took my briefcase with flags and walked up the plank to their

  deck but nobody was topside, however a hatch was open so I called

  out "Hello".  Slowly a man appeared from below deck. I introduced myself and told him I made Peace flags and asked if he would like to buy one?

  He said, "We can't afford it."  I thought for a moment  and decided

  to give him my favorite yellow one 4'x 6'.  He thanked me and I said,

  "Good Luck".    The next day my flag was flying from the top

 of their mast and soon they were out of dry dock and back in the Bay with my flag still flying from the top of their mast,  I was happy,  and a few days later they were gone.  

  About 18 months later I was watching TV one night and there were

  some Hula dancers which looked interesting so I continued to watch,

  and then a new Citroen DS21  pulled up and having owned an old ID19

  I was intrigued.  Next,  a Military officer in full dress uniform stepped out of the back of  it and was greeted with smiles by Clergymen with a voiceover

  describing that they were in Tahiti to witness a French Nuclear

  Bomb Test.  Next, the picture was at sea with a sailboat bobbing

   up and down in heavy waves in the Bomb Test Zone and it  looked

  familiar. . . . I wondered, "Could it be the same ship from Sausalito? . . . No,  there are thousands of sailboats."  Then the camera scanned up the mast

  and there was my flag flying from the top of their mast.  I couldn't believe it!  I was stunned,  I look back today in amazement that this happened.

  Just prior to this, news of their planned voyage and Protest had spread to France where retired General Bollardiere heard about it and was inspire to

  fly to Australia,  and charter a boat to take him to the Bomb Test Zone

  to join them.  He traveled thousands of miles and when he got to the

   Bomb Test Zone he was gratefully welcomed aboard the ship, FRI.

  When the French commandos boarded the ship to arrest everyone, General Bollardiere did a rare deed:  he returned in Protest to the French President,  the Medal of Legion of Honor that he had been awarded.  He was pictured on the front cover  of L'EXPRESS  in France with the story of his journey and protest.

The French Navy Commandos seized their ship,  stole their (my) flag and arrested the whole crew.

 My story gets more intriguing. . .

Several months after I saw the film on TV I was visiting a friend in  in Bolinas, 
a small town on the coastline and on my way back home I stopped to give a ride to someone who was hitchhiking.  As we were driving on Rt. 1 I told him I was a painter and I asked him what he did and he said,  "I'm a filmmaker and I recently made a documentary about a ship that sailed near Tahiti
 in Protest of the French Nuclear Bomb Tests."  I turned and looked at him
in disbelief and exclaimed, "I MADE THE FLAG THEY FLEW,  I SAW YOUR FILM ON TV!"  It was incredible, our eyes were glued together as he told me the story of how the crew sailed on to New Zealand and wrote a book about it.  He told me , "It's at The Tides bookstore in Sausalito." 

I got their book and on the CONTENTS page is a photo (the only one) of my flag being hoisted up the mast.
On the FORWARD  page is a photo of Sir Edmund Hillary with a big smile and statement,  "I cannot help but admire their spirit." 

Wikipedia reports,  ". . . Fri was an important part of a series of anti-nuclear protest campaigns out of New Zealand which lasted thirty years, from which New Zealand declared itself a nuclear-free zone which was enshrined in legislation in what became the New Zealand Nuclear Free Zone, Disarmament, and Arms Control Act 1987.[2][3] In 1974, coordinated by Greenpeace New Zealand, the Fri embarked on a 3 year epic 25,000 mile “Pacific Peace Odyssey” voyage, carrying the Peace message to all nuclear states around the world.[4]"
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fri_%28yacht%29

On my website there is a time lapse video of nuclear bomb tests that have been made between 1945 and  1998.   In addition,  a not widely known story
 of what seems to have been the use of Nuclear Bombs in Mohenjo Daro, in ancient India.

Since the nuclear reactors at Fukushima melted down  in 2011 there has been
more awareness of the dangers of using nuclear fuels to make electricity
and the colors in my flag coincide with the colors being used in Japan at public gatherings.

Based on the extraordinary results in the past,  and the ability to communicate instantly now worldwide on the INTERNET,  combined with your help here on INDIEGOGO,  this project could achieve even more extraordinary results today.

Every flag I make will be delivered with a Certificate of Authenticity verifying that it was made by the originator of the flag flown in protest of the French Nuclear Bomb Test at Mururoa in 1973.

The funds raised in this campaign will be used to make flags in various sizes and materials.  The other primary allocation will be approximately 30% for Advertising in print and on the Internet,  as well as routine office expenses.

Please see the perks I am offering. 

As sales develop a portion of the profits will be given to the crew of the ship Fri for what they did at Mururoa and around the world.

If you are unable to help financially,  please share my story in whatever way you can with as many people as possible, thank you.

The nuclear arsenals of the world could destroy the world many times over and the need for Peace and safe power is ever more essential today.

While the testing of Nuclear Bombs in the atmosphere may have stopped, the threat of the use of Hydrogen and Neutron Bombs is real,  and yet another problem continues to plague the world,  namely the use of Nuclear Energy.

Since the unprecedented catastrophe at Fukushima the threat of Radiation has increased exponentially and will continue to do so forever.  New clean ways of making electricity are being developed and Dr. Hans Neiper in Germany wrote a pioneering  book on it  titled,  Conversion Of Gravity Field Energy,  REVOLUTION In Technology Medicine And Society that gave respectability to the pursuit of novel ways of making power that require no fuel which is commonly thought to be impossible.  Meanwhile,  plans for building more nuclear power plants continues despite the unsolvable problems of waste disposal and old plants leaking radiation into the environment.

See:   The Atomic States of America  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Snq5InfEdlg
that was selected by the Sundance Film Festival in 2012.

 Also:  High Power,  made in India 2013:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=msxq0UifZlE

Foster Gamble, the co-producer of THRIVE,  spoke recently at the, United We Stand Festival in Los Angeles  and gave us a glimpse of a future with abundant safe energy:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vsA6iDGgpQg 

As you could hear there is real excitement about the prospect of these technologies becoming available soon,  and meanwhile our pursuit of Peace continues.  My goal is to help unite many diverse groups around the world that are striving to achieve a safer world free of leaking nuclear reactors and Bombs that assure mutual destruction.   Your help is needed to resurrect The Pease Flag.  I'm looking for distributors at various levels, radio and advertising experts, and everyone with a desire to create a safer world.   Please also see my website:  http://www.thepeaseflag.com   and use the Share Tools here on INDIEGOGO,  tell all your friends on FB and Twitter and everywhere you can think of.  Thank You in advance for your confidence and support.  
P.S. If you prefer to send a check in the mail rather than use PayPal,  please address it to : Michael Marino 369 B Third Street Suite 113, San Rafael, CA U.S.A. 94901

story:
Merhaba.

“Herkes için daha yaşanabilir bir Ankara” fikri ile bugünden 6 ay önce başladığımız bir Sosyal Toplumsal Proje olan Ankara’nın Bug’ları projesi için 6 ay boyunca elimizden gelen her şeyi yapmaya çalıştık.

Öngörümüz neticesinde projemizin ilk 2 aşaması olan Odağı Arttır ve Dikkati Çek bölümleri başarı ile tamamlandı; ancak Harekete Geç aşamasını, süreç içerisinde öngördüğümüzden daha detaylı olarak geliştirdik. Bu konuda ancak sizlerin proje bütçesine katkıları ile projemize devam edebileceğimizi söylemek istiyoruz.

Önümüzdeki süreçte planladığımız ve sizlerin yardımları ile gerçekleştirmeyi hedeflediğimiz proje detaylarımızı aşağıda özet şeklinde okuyabilirsiniz.

  • Hukuki mücadele – Ankara’nın bir türlü çözülemeyen sorunları ile ilgili olarak hukuksal mücadeleye başlıyoruz. Bu mücadelede projemize fikren desteğini esirgemeyen avukatlarımız ile sorunlarımızı yargıya taşıyacak ve çözüm için maddi sonuçlar elde edeceğiz.

  • Ankara’nın Bug’ları WEB Sitesi– Projenin tek bir internet platformuna bağlılığını ortadan kaldıracak ve daha özerk bir yapılanma olmasını sağlayacak olan web sitesi, şuan için var olan ve şikayet etme prensibi ile devam eden platformların bir benzeri olacak; ancak belediye şikayetleri konusunda uzmanlaşmış;  bu yönde duyarlı, deneyimli ve eğitimli ekibimiz ile Türkiye’de bir ilki başarmak istiyoruz.
    • Ankara'nın sorunları ile başlayıp, genişleyen ekibimizle uğraştığımız ve kendimiz için ulvî gördüğümüz amacımızı tüm Türkiye'ye yayarak, bütün yaşam alanlarındaki/şehirlerimizdeki sorunlara yer verip, gelecekte çok daha büyük ve çözüm üreten bir platform olma amacındayız.

  • Ankara'nın Bug'ları BLOG- Ankara’daki belediye hizmetleri ve yaşanabilirlik analizlerinin yapılacağı, öğretim görevlilerinin, şehir plancılarının ve Ankara’da yaşayan herkesin kendi yazılarını yayınlayabileceği ve böylece ulaşılabilir fikir konusunda bilgilendirici bir resmi blog oluşturmak.
    • Gönüllü muhabirlerin haber çalışmaları ve edindikleri bilgileri kendi köşelerinde haber yapabileceği, Ankara'nın nabzını tutacak bir blog oluşturmak istiyoruz.

  • Ankara’nın Bug’ları Mobil Uygulaması – Akıllı telefonu olan herkesin karşılaştığı ‘bug’ları kolayca ve yerinde paylaşabilmesi; böylece konumları belirlenmiş konu ve olaylardan anlık ve yerinde haberdar olmamız sağlanacak. Mobil uygulama aynı zamanda Ankara’nın Bug’ları Web Sitesi ile de entegre çalışacak. Mobil uygulama üzerinden gönderilen her bug aynı zamanda web sitesinde de otomatik olarak yayınlanacak.

 

  • Gönüllüler için ekipmanların sağlanması.

 

  • Projeye olan sempati ve ilgiliyi arttırmak; ayrıca sürekliliği sağlamak amacı  ile hazırlanacak çeşitli promosyon ürünleri. (T-shirt, bileklik vb.)

 

Çözüm için HAREKETE GEÇmek istiyoruz. Sizinle birlikte…

____

Nasıl destek olursunuz?

  • CONTRIBUTE NOW butonuna tıklayın.
  • Ankara'nın Bug'ları projesine bağış yapmak istediğiniz miktarı girin. (Dolar olarak.)
    İsminizin görülmesini istemiyorsanız tutarın altındaki kutuyu işaretleyin.
  • CONTINUE butonuna tıklayın.
  • Açılan sayfaya kredi kartı blgileriniz girin. Sırasıyla; İsim, soyisim, güvenlik kodu, son kullanma tarihi, ülke, apartman adı ve/veya numarası, cadde adı, şehir adı, posta kodu.
  • CONTRIBUTE butonuna tıklayın.

    Bu kadar. Projemize desteğiniz yapılmıştır. Teşekkürler.

_____

 

Mehmet Keleş

Ankara'nın Bugları Projesi
Ekip Sözcüsü - Sosyal Medya Danışmanı

 

Evren Demiryürek
Ankara'nın Bugları Projesi
Kurumsal İletişim Sorumlusu - Ekomomi Öğrencisi

 

İlke Dündar
Ankara'nın Bugları Projesi
Danışman - Ankara Üniversitesi Yüksek Lisans Öğrencisi

 

Kemal Gümüş
Ankara'nın Bugları Projesi
Danışman - Hacettepe Üniversitesi Araştırma Görevlisi

____

İletişim: ankaraninbuglari@yandex.com
story_txt:
Merhaba.
“Herkes için daha yaşanabilir bir Ankara” fikri ile bugünden 6 ay önce başladığımız bir Sosyal Toplumsal Proje olan Ankara’nın Bug’ları projesi için 6 ay boyunca elimizden gelen her şeyi yapmaya çalıştık.
Öngörümüz neticesinde projemizin ilk 2 aşaması olan Odağı Arttır ve Dikkati Çek bölümleri başarı ile tamamlandı; ancak Harekete Geç aşamasını, süreç içerisinde öngördüğümüzden daha detaylı olarak geliştirdik. Bu konuda ancak sizlerin proje bütçesine katkıları ile projemize devam edebileceğimizi söylemek istiyoruz.
Önümüzdeki süreçte planladığımız ve sizlerin yardımları ile gerçekleştirmeyi hedeflediğimiz proje detaylarımızı aşağıda özet şeklinde okuyabilirsiniz.



Hukuki mücadele – Ankara’nın bir türlü çözülemeyen sorunları ile ilgili olarak hukuksal mücadeleye başlıyoruz. Bu mücadelede projemize fikren desteğini esirgemeyen avukatlarımız ile sorunlarımızı yargıya taşıyacak ve çözüm için maddi sonuçlar elde edeceğiz.


Ankara’nın Bug’ları WEB Sitesi– Projenin tek bir internet platformuna bağlılığını ortadan kaldıracak ve daha özerk bir yapılanma olmasını sağlayacak olan web sitesi, şuan için var olan ve şikayet etme prensibi ile devam eden platformların bir benzeri olacak; ancak belediye şikayetleri konusunda uzmanlaşmış;  bu yönde duyarlı, deneyimli ve eğitimli ekibimiz ile Türkiye’de bir ilki başarmak istiyoruz.

Ankara'nın sorunları ile başlayıp, genişleyen ekibimizle uğraştığımız ve kendimiz için ulvî gördüğümüz amacımızı tüm Türkiye'ye yayarak, bütün yaşam alanlarındaki/şehirlerimizdeki sorunlara yer verip, gelecekte çok daha büyük ve çözüm üreten bir platform olma amacındayız.




Ankara'nın Bug'ları BLOG- Ankara’daki belediye hizmetleri ve yaşanabilirlik analizlerinin yapılacağı, öğretim görevlilerinin, şehir plancılarının ve Ankara’da yaşayan herkesin kendi yazılarını yayınlayabileceği ve böylece ulaşılabilir fikir konusunda bilgilendirici bir resmi blog oluşturmak.

Gönüllü muhabirlerin haber çalışmaları ve edindikleri bilgileri kendi köşelerinde haber yapabileceği, Ankara'nın nabzını tutacak bir blog oluşturmak istiyoruz.




Ankara’nın Bug’ları Mobil Uygulaması – Akıllı telefonu olan herkesin karşılaştığı ‘bug’ları kolayca ve yerinde paylaşabilmesi; böylece konumları belirlenmiş konu ve olaylardan anlık ve yerinde haberdar olmamız sağlanacak. Mobil uygulama aynı zamanda Ankara’nın Bug’ları Web Sitesi ile de entegre çalışacak. Mobil uygulama üzerinden gönderilen her bug aynı zamanda web sitesinde de otomatik olarak yayınlanacak.
 

Gönüllüler için ekipmanların sağlanması.
 

Projeye olan sempati ve ilgiliyi arttırmak; ayrıca sürekliliği sağlamak amacı  ile hazırlanacak çeşitli promosyon ürünleri. (T-shirt, bileklik vb.)
 
Çözüm için HAREKETE GEÇmek istiyoruz. Sizinle birlikte…
____

CONTRIBUTE NOW butonuna tıklayın.

Ankara'nın Bug'ları projesine bağış yapmak istediğiniz miktarı girin. (Dolar olarak.)İsminizin görülmesini istemiyorsanız tutarın altındaki kutuyu işaretleyin.

story:
Our Story

My name is Gary Spedding, I am a 21 year old Zoology Student at University and I have been coming and going back and forward to the Occupied Palestinian Territories for just over 2 years now. Last year was a life changing time for me when I learned about the power of nonviolence. The principles and Ideas that I discovered and formed from experiencing nonviolence gave me empowerment to do something that embodies this form of active resistance to the occupation. It is a very dignified way for Palestinians to resist as it does not hurt anybody and it is also human rights based rather than politically motivated. Last year myself and three others decided to put together a group and campaign to help combat this aspect of the occupation


The Impact

The campaign impacts upon the local people here in various ways there is of course the immediate impact of empowerment in acting out resistance to occupation by planting olive trees (The areas of planting these trees are often in places where they have been previously cut down or removed for 'security reasons' or on land which has been illegally confiscated by the state of Israel and access sometimes denied to the land owners). This campaign allows farmers to nonviolently resist while also giving them hope and empowerment. It brings to life their struggle while using the principles of nonviolence. There is of course an economic impact as many farmers cannot afford to replace olive trees that have been growing in their land for hundreds of years just like that so it helps ease the burden of replaciing trees while also providing a sustainable method of making money in the future through agriculture. Finally there is an environmental impact as while israel is uprooting trees which obviously impacts human beings quite simply the sheer amount of trees being uprooted is causing environmental concerns damaging wildlife and the natural balance here in Palestine.


What We Need & What You Get

The funding in its entirety goes directly towards paying local tree growers in Palestine for their trees and then those trees go directly to the land where they are to be planted. Every single penny will go towards trees and transport costs. We decided to pay locals for the trees in order to make the campaign an all around success for the local people benefiting the man who sells the sapplings and the man who will see those saplings through to adulthood in his land. We will be happy to name plots of trees after specific donors if they request and we can also send if availability lasts two olive leaves dipped in a thin layer of sealing metal. However our primary goal and concern is the olive trees and getting them planted. We will be documenting our planting as it goes along and sending each donor a professional picture of what their money has bought. If the target is not met the funding will still go towards planting olive trees so any amount raised will help.


Other Ways You Can Help

This campaign is mainly about the replacement of trees and the reclaimation of land. However there is an important awareness raising factor to it as well which combines all kinds of information ranging from human rights and the impunity in which Palestinians are denied access to their lands while settlers take over it. All the way to nonviolence and how planting trees is a brilliant way of resisting pressure and occupation/persecution. Please use the share options and spread this project around!
