story:
Take the zero waste challenge

and

Be the solution!

From $1 a day.

Pirate Pack is a membership program delivering zero waste products to your doorstep.

  • Alternatives to single use items to minimize your daily plastic footprint
  • Plant based and compostable packaged products to learn what is available today
  • Re-purposed plastics supporting companies that create second life products
  • And more!

 

Welcome to our Community

 

Our Members Get

Zero waste supplies: A monthly care package purposely designed to minimize your daily plastic footprint and learn who the manufacturers are that are making responsible products

Voyages Working with Partners: Every year we are working in developing island nations with local organizations. Win a spot, earn your place or simply sign up to be part of the solution!    

Global Movement: Every day there is actually GOOD news happening. Stay up to date on all the innovation of change and who is making waves for a cleaner future.

Did you know?

And that embracing products like these will change that?

Check out a sample month here:

Reusable Food Wraps, are natural and biodegradable to help keep food as fresh as plastic-$18

Collapsible Travel Cup, a reusable cup that fits in your bag and holds any liquid hot or cold-$15

Stainless Steel Straws with cleaner, cut back one of the top 10 items of earths litter-$13

Plant-based Plastic Bowls, compostable in commercial composting facilities-$30

Machine Washable Pouches, perfect for sandwiches, fruits and other snacks-$10

Total cost of contents of Pirate Pack-$86 

This is a new department of Ocean Ambassadors and

We have been actively working in the waste plastic solution game for over 6 years!

  • 2012 - Originating with the purchase of our flagship S.V. Moana to be a floating classroom
  • 2013 - Joining the board of directors for Upgyres for proof of concept and feasibility studies
  • 2013 - Launching a closed loop apparel line designed to redirect plastic pollution from developing islands where no waste management exists.
  • 2014 - Talking Trash Tour with the best in engagement and education Take 3 Presenting our closed loop solutions and waste plastic to alternative fuels.
  • 2014 - Engaging with the Australian High Commission of Fiji to develop the systems we presented on and developing educational programs and hospitality guidelines for the country to work towards plastic free!
  • 2015 - Speaker at TEDx Youth @ Maastricht
  • 2015 - Joined the Aquapower Expedition to work in the Atlantic ocean with top athletes caring for their playground.
  • 2016 - Launched our beach to the boardroom adventures for volunteers looking to be part of the solution.
  • 2017 - Developed specific school and volunteer programs for students to engage with solutions and assisting developing communities become plastic free.
  • 2018 - PIRATE PACK!
  • 2018 - Micro-plastic extraction voyage. Testing a new technology to extract micro-plastics from the marine environment. https://projectsforgood.com/projects/555/story
  • 2018 - Working alongside VEPA to create a value chain for waste plastics in Vavau

Because we like to live like this:

 

Through this time we've been lucky enough to encounter countless amazing people and products that can see us towards a waste free ocean.

The problem?

Is getting the word out and people engaged with this life choice.

Are you feeling overwhelmed going plastic free?

It can all get a bit confusing these days, and almost feel daunting, but it doesn't have to be. There are people all over the world creating products to minimize plastic dependency. Your monthly Pirate Pack provides the solutions to arrive at your doorstep. Making it easy to make sure there is NOT more plastic than fish by 2050

 

 

We are looking for 150 people to engage with us on monthly packages specifically designed to transition your life to plastic free.

This will enable us to develop our:

- website

- Artwork

- User logistics for signing up friends

- Fine tuning our member services

@ $36.00 Every pack will include monthly:

$75 + retail value and a minimum of
Re-usable solution to everyday single use items to minimize your daily footprint
Plant based and compostable packaged item to embrace responsible brands
10-25% discount voucher off larger items that will make your life plastic free
Monthly up-date on global innovation, tips for minimizing waste and plastic solutions
Pricing includes shipping to USA, Canada, Australia

Every member is given the chance to win or earn the chance to join us on-board our flagship for our annual voyages.

Fun Fact! By joining our membership you support on the ground utilities and work in developing countries!

You can see a sample of that with our collaborative project with Vavau Environmental Protection Association (VEPA) The output of the machines we build there will be in some of our Pirate Packs!
We will be working there on sight for over two months and welcoming our members and guests to come along and be part of the solution.

Every year we organize 2-3 major voyages and expeditions where we:
- Visit Island nations who are implementing solutions
- Develop and build local systems for minimizing and valuing waste
- Perform data collection
- Community outreach

Come along with our community and have real life experiences in paradise that work towards a clean ocean.

If we reach our goal, 1 lucky winner will be joining us in Tonga for 7 days!

100% Transparent

Even though our initial aim here is to secure only 150 members. Bellow is where we need to get:

  • 2500 Monthly Members will cover team costs We have a small yet effective team, at this stage we can secure annual salary for our team of 5 to focus directly on this project.
  • 5000 Monthly Members will cover team + S.V Moana costs to be actively on tour working with local orgs AND  one member every month  wining  a trip for 2 for one week on-board The extra memberships enable us to pay a full-time Capt and Crew with operating expenses. S.V. Moana is than working 12 months a year visiting developing island communities helping them establish achievable practice with waste plastic remediation.

  • At 7,500 Monthly Members we can now add a small grants program for local orgs to implement waste collection and processing. Now we are cooking with fire. The communities we visit will not only get assistance in guidance and frameworks, we can now offer a small grants program monthly to partners for a waste free ocean.

  • At 10,000 Monthly Members we can size up our flagship to a larger vessel and announce a world tour. All with room for our members to join and BE A PART OF THE SOLUTION! A 55 ft double hull voyaging canoe with capacity of up to 8 guests, scientists, sustainable development officers and more is now on a non-stop mission.

and how we plan to get there:

  • Sign up 100 people to a 12 month subscription, win a trip including flight

  • Sign up 75 people to a 12 month subscription, win a trip no flight included

  • Sign up 20 to a 12 month subscription win your year membership free

  • Sign up 5 to a 12 month subscription earn a free month

AND

Every 150 members we sign up to a 12 month subscription, we pick a winner to join us!

Our flagship sailing in Fiji

Meet the team:

Julie Melrose - Environmental Lawyer, General Management

Sammy Brain - Outdoor education teacher, guide. Voyages and expeditions

Glen Bowden - Filmaker and website designer. Visual Content

Nat Brandmeier - Australian born, Canadian transplant mom/shredder. North American Distribution

Adrian Midwood - Ocean Captain, founder of Ocean Ambassadors.

We look forward to working with all of you, for a clean future!

FAQ

Q. How do I cancel my account?

A. CANCELLATION POLICY: If you are feeling like you no longer need to be on the team or not completely satisfied with your Pirate Pack, we are more than happy to cancel your membership and stop monthly payments at any time.

To cancel before the next shipment, you need to notify us at Pirate Pack prior to the renewal date on the 12th of each month.
Email: support@piratepack.net and we’ll get back to you ASAP!

If your monthly payment has already renewed and you’d like to stop an upcoming shipment, you are required to request cancellation by the 28th of the month to be eligible for a refund.

IF YOU DO NOT CANCEL BEFORE THE 28th DAY OF A CALENDAR MONTH, YOU CANNOT BE REFUNDED FOR THAT MONTH’S SHIPMENT. WE DO NOT OFFER REFUNDS ON BOXES THAT HAVE ALREADY BEEN SHIPPED.

To submit a cancellation request, contact us support@Piratepack.net

We’ll process immediately.

Q. How do I update my account information?

A. Login using your email address and password, There are sections to update your billing, shipping and login information. If you have any questions please contact support@Piratepack.net

Q. How will I be charged?

A. Signing up for Pirate Pack means opting into a membership that bills you every month. All subscriptions renew each month on the 14th, in advance of your next shipment. Boxes will start shipping around the 4th and 6th.

Q. Can I be refunded?

A. We can refund if notified prior to the 28th day of the month. Refunds are unavailable for boxes that have already shipped. If you have missing items or the box is damaged, we’ll be happy to help you out!

Q. I just joined, when do I get billed and when does my Pirate Pack arrive?

Welcome to our community! Billing is on the 12th of the month, for your next Pirate Pack which are sent between the 4th and 6th each month.

 

Shipping

Q. When do I get my first box?

A. We ship between the 4th and 6th. Join by the 10th to get the current month’s Pack. All orders processed after the 13th will ship the following month.

Q. Where do you ship to?
A. Our prices include shipping in USA, Canada, Australia. All other countries $10 extra
Q. Do you ship to PO, APO or FPO Boxes?
A. We sure do!
Q. Do you ship anywhere?
A. We’ll definitely ship the box. However if the local postal and shipping service in your country is un-reliable, there’s not much we can do about it. So for all orders you can request a tracking number notification.

Voyages and Expeditions

 

Q. How do I join one?

A. Easy, you can contact us to reserve a spot.

 

Q. Can I win a spot?

A. Yes. Every 150 people that sign up for 12 moths, we’ll have a draw from those names to pick a winner.

AND

When your Pirate Pack arrives, open it up, pop off the best selfie you can. Than post it on instagram or Facebook with #or@Piratepack and brag to all your friends on how cool you are. We’ll pick a new winner every month!

We are looking for 150 people to engage with us on monthly packages specifically designed to transition your life to plastic free.
This will enable us to develop our: 
- website
- Artwork
- User logistics for signing up friends
- Fine tuning our member services
@ $36.00 Every pack will include monthly:
$75 + retail value and a minimum ofRe-usable solution to everyday single use items to minimize your daily footprintPlant based and compostable packaged item to embrace responsible brands10-25% discount voucher off larger items that will make your life plastic freeMonthly up-date on global innovation, tips for minimizing waste and plastic solutionsPricing includes shipping to USA, Canada, Australia

Every member is given the chance to win or earn the chance to join us on-board our flagship for our annual voyages.
Fun Fact! By joining our membership you support on the ground utilities and work in developing countries!
You can see a sample of that with our collaborative project with Vavau Environmental Protection Association (VEPA) The output of the machines we build there will be in some of our Pirate Packs!We will be working there on sight for over two months and welcoming our members and guests to come along and be part of the solution.Every year we organize 2-3 major voyages and expeditions where we:- Visit Island nations who are implementing solutions- Develop and build local systems for minimizing and valuing waste- Perform data collection- Community outreach
Come along with our community and have real life experiences in paradise that work towards a clean ocean.
If we reach our goal, 1 lucky winner will be joining us in Tonga for 7 days!


100% Transparent
Even though our initial aim here is to secure only 150 members. Bellow is where we need to get:

2500 Monthly Members will cover team costs We have a small yet effective team, at this stage we can secure annual salary for our team of 5 to focus directly on this project.

5000 Monthly Members will cover team + S.V Moana costs to be actively on tour working with local orgs AND  one member every month  wining  a trip for 2 for one week on-board The extra memberships enable us to pay a full-time Capt and Crew with operating expenses. S.V. Moana is than working 12 months a year visiting developing island communities helping them establish achievable practice with waste plastic remediation.

At 7,500 Monthly Members we can now add a small grants program for local orgs to implement waste collection and processing. Now we are cooking with fire. The communities we visit will not only get assistance in guidance and frameworks, we can now offer a small grants program monthly to partners for a waste free ocean.
At 10,000 Monthly Members we can size up our flagship to a larger vessel and announce a world tour. All with room for our members to join and BE A PART OF THE SOLUTION! A 55 ft double hull voyaging canoe with capacity of up to 8 guests, scientists, sustainable development officers and more is now on a non-stop mission.

and how we plan to get there:

Sign up 100 people to a 12 month subscription, win a trip including flight
Sign up 75 people to a 12 month subscription, win a trip no flight included
Sign up 20 to a 12 month subscription win your year membership free
Sign up 5 to a 12 month subscription earn a free month

AND
Every 150 members we sign up to a 12 month subscription, we pick a winner to join us!

Our flagship sailing in Fiji
Meet the team:
Julie Melrose - Environmental Lawyer, General Management
Sammy Brain - Outdoor education teacher, guide. Voyages and expeditions
Glen Bowden - Filmaker and website designer. Visual Content
Nat Brandmeier - Australian born, Canadian transplant mom/shredder. North American Distribution
Adrian Midwood - Ocean Captain, founder of Ocean Ambassadors.
We look forward to working with all of you, for a clean future!
FAQ
Q. How do I cancel my account?
A. CANCELLATION POLICY: If you are feeling like you no longer need to be on the team or not completely satisfied with your Pirate Pack, we are more than happy to cancel your membership and stop monthly payments at any time.
To cancel before the next shipment, you need to notify us at Pirate Pack prior to the renewal date on the 12th of each month.Email: support@piratepack.net and we’ll get back to you ASAP!
If your monthly payment has already renewed and you’d like to stop an upcoming shipment, you are required to request cancellation by the 28th of the month to be eligible for a refund.
IF YOU DO NOT CANCEL BEFORE THE 28th DAY OF A CALENDAR MONTH, YOU CANNOT BE REFUNDED FOR THAT MONTH’S SHIPMENT. WE DO NOT OFFER REFUNDS ON BOXES THAT HAVE ALREADY BEEN SHIPPED.
To submit a cancellation request, contact us support@Piratepack.net
We’ll process immediately.
Q. How do I update my account information?
A. Login using your email address and password, There are sections to update your billing, shipping and login information. If you have any questions please contact support@Piratepack.net
Q. How will I be charged?
A. Signing up for Pirate Pack means opting into a membership that bills you every month. All subscriptions renew each month on the 14th, in advance of your next shipment. Boxes will start shipping around the 4th and 6th.
Q. Can I be refunded?
A. We can refund if notified prior to the 28th day of the month. Refunds are unavailable for boxes that have already shipped. If you have missing items or the box is damaged, we’ll be happy to help you out!
Q. I just joined, when do I get billed and when does my Pirate Pack arrive?
Welcome to our community! Billing is on the 12th of the month, for your next Pirate Pack which are sent between the 4th and 6th each month.
 
Shipping
Q. When do I get my first box?
A. We ship between the 4th and 6th. Join by the 10th to get the current month’s Pack. All orders processed after the 13th will ship the following month.
Q. Where do you ship to?
A. Our prices include shipping in USA, Canada, Australia. All other countries $10 extra
Q. Do you ship to PO, APO or FPO Boxes?
A. We sure do!
Q. Do you ship anywhere?
A. We’ll definitely ship the box. However if the local postal and shipping service in your country is un-reliable, there’s not much we can do about it. So for all orders you can request a tracking number notification.
Voyages and Expeditions
 
Q. How do I join one?
A. Easy, you can contact us to reserve a spot.
 
Q. Can I win a spot?
A. Yes. Every 150 people that sign up for 12 moths, we’ll have a draw from those names to pick a winner.
AND
When your Pirate Pack arrives, open it up, pop off the best selfie you can. Than post it on instagram or Facebook with #or@Piratepack and brag to all your friends on how cool you are. We’ll pick a new winner every month!

story:
Somos un grupo de 5 corredores chiapanecos que iremos a correr 42 kilómetros en el maratón de Berlín, el próximo 28 de Septiembre, para apoyar la conservación de la Reserva de la Biosfera El Triunfo en Chiapas, México.

La Reserva de la Biosfera El Triunfo en Chiapas, es uno de los lugares más mágicos y menos conocidos del mundo. Protege el último gran remanente de bosque de niebla de México. Es hogar de miles de especies como el quetzal, el jaguar, el puma,  helechos milenarios, olmos de más de 70 metros de alto y miles de aves que migran a esta región. 

Poco a poco estos bosques han desaparecido en el mundo y nosotros queremos hacer algo para ayudar a conservarlos.

Somos 5 chiapanecos: Alfredo d´Argence, Héctor Olguin, José Luis Barraza, Mario Urbina, Paulo Martínez y Jorge Zenteno. Correremos 42 kilómetros y cada kilómetro será donado al Triunfo.


Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Cada uno de nosotros nos comprometimos a obtener $ 10 dólares por kilómetro corrido, ese dinero será donado al Fondo de Conservación El Triunfo AC, organización que lleva más de 12 años trabajando arduamente para conservar el sitio. 

Estamos buscando tu ayuda. La buena noticia es que habrá premios y recompensas para todo el que se sume:

1 kilómetro = 10 USD = Agradecimiento en nuestras redes y boletines. Una postal digital

2 kilómetros =20 USD = Una ronda de mezcal para tí y tres amigos más en La Terraza Central, ubicada en calle central y 3a Norte. Tuxtla Gutiérrez Chiapas

3 kilómetros = 30 USD = Calendarios 2015 

5 kilómetros = 50 USD = Un Libro de la expedición RAVE al Triunfo

10 Kilómetros = 100 USD = Dotación de 500 gramos de Café Metik por 6 meses, el primer café producido 100% por mujeres.

25 kilómetros = 250 USD = Una página de publicidad en la revista Más Agro la cual tiene un tiraje de 4,000 ejemplares.

50 kilómetros = 500 USD = Una Ruta del Agua en la Reserva de la Biosfera El Triunfo. Viaje de 3 días en dónde descubrirás en dónde se capta, cómo fluye y cómo se aprovecha el agua de esta reserva.

    El impacto

    Tu donativo cambiará la historia de una comunidad. Hemos lanzado un concurso en donde las comunidades nos cuentan con un documental cuáles son sus problemas y elaboran un proyecto para solucionarlo. La mejor propuesta será financiada con los kilómetros que corramos.

    Suma a más personas y síguenos en las redes sociales

    Recuerda que la mejor manera de ayudar es motivando a más personas a que se sumen. Síguenos en www.facebook/fondoeltriunfo y en @fondoeltriunfo1

story:
Click here to put in english!

SAVEZ VOUS D’OÙ VIENT LE CAFÉ ? 

Des milliards de personnes dans le monde boivent du café tous les jours et la plupart d'entre eux ne savent pas comment il est produit.

Le café est un fruit qui ressemble à une cerise amis nous utilisons uniquement le noyau pour produire le café que nous consommons, le reste du fruit, la pulpe, est jetée dans l'environnement, entraînant des pollutions importantes :

  • Les déchets de café entraînent un déséquilibre des nutriments des sols dans lesquels ils sont enfouis et polluent les nappes phréatiques (voir l'étude en portugais d’embrapa ici)

  • Les déchets de café laissés sur les sols participent au réchauffement climatique : ils  sont généralement décomposés par des des micro-organismes, libérant des quantités importantes de gaz à effet de serre (méthane (CH4), dioxyde de carbone (CO2) et du protoxyde d'azote (N2O)). Entre 23 et 55 Méga tonnes de méthane par an sont relarguées dans l’atmosphère par les déchets végétaux (voir l'étude d'Oxford ici)

  • Les déchets de café déversés dans les rivières perturbent leur écosystème par utrophisation :  ils contiennent beaucoup de nutriments, provoquant une prolifération d’algues, entraînant une diminution de l’oxygène dans l’eau qui peut être mortelle pour les animaux aquatiques (voir l'étude du journal Environmental Monitoring and Assessment ici).

SOLUTION DU PROJET DE START UP COPHENOL

Nous voulons empêcher ces déchets de nuire à l'environnement par la construction de bioraffineries durables situées près des plantations de café afin de convertir ces déchets de café en produits chimiques utilisés pour fabriquer du papier, du plastique et des engrais que nous prévoyons de donner aux producteurs de café.

OU EN SOMMES NOUS ? 

Les résultats de nos premières expériences du processus chimique avec les déchets de café ainsi qu’une étude de marché préliminaire nous ont encouragé à continuer d’avancer sur ce projet.

Nous souhaitons commencer notre développement au Brésil, plus précisément dans les états de Minas Gerias et São Paulo, en raison de l'importante production de café et de leur économie.

C’est pourquoi nous sommes actuellement au Brésil pour un mois afin de rencontrer toutes les parties prenantes nécessaire à la réalisation du projet Cophenol : les producteurs de café et des coopératives, les organisations de protection de l'environnement, les entreprises locales, les centres de recherches sur le café et nos clients potentiels.

NOTRE EQUIPE

Cophenol est né en 2014 et son équipe est constituée de membres multidisciplinaires et multiculturels très motivés, qui sont tous très sensibles à la protection de l’environnement. De gauche à droite : 

Emmanuel Thiéry (25 ans, Français) vient de terminer sa licence de physique chimie après avoir eu un master en neurosciences. Il a travaillé avec Anna Suchy sur le procédé chimique qui transforme les déchets de café en produits chimiques de valeur. Dirigeant le projet, il travaille sur la stratégie du développement de Cophenol et postule avec le reste de l’équipe dans diverses compétitions de start-up afin de trouver soutiens et financements pour le projet.

Anna Suchy (25 ans, Polonaise) est actuellement en thèse sur la valorisation de la biomasse dans l'Université d'Aberystwyth, au Pays de Galles (Royaume-Uni). Elle travaille sur l’optimisation du processus chimique utilisé par Cophenol.

Pierre Eloi Gay (24 ans, Français) est fraîchement diplômé de l’ESSEC. Il a étudié pendant sept mois à São Paulo et son expertise sur les études de marché nous aide à trouver des clients brésiliens potentiels.

Mariana Bittencourt (30 ans, Brésilienne) est actuellement en thèse  sur les éco-innovations en France. Elle communique avec les parties prenantes locales du projet, notamment les coopératives et les producteurs de café qui sont cruciaux pour notre projet. De plus, elle est en contact avec les ministres, le gouvernement et les institutions importantes afin de préparer au mieux notre implantation au Brésil.

COMPÉTITIONS GAGNÉES

Au cours de son développement, Cophenol a reçu du soutien grâce à plusieurs compétitions de start-up gagnées :

               

Cophenol a été sélectionné dans la Greenhouse à Paris, qui est un programme de pré-incubation de la Climate-KIC, la structure européenne promeut les initiatives combattant le changement climatique. Nous avons reçu 4 000 € ainsi qu’un accompagnement par un coach de l'incubateur Agoranov.

Cophenol a été sélectionné pour faire partie de la finale francophone de la Global Social Venture Competition (GSVC). Nous avons reçu l'aide d’étudiants en master à l'ESSEC et de Florian Buguet qui travaille dans le cabinet de conseil Deloitte afin d’améliorer notre business model.
http://www.gsvc-essec.org/cophenol/

Cophenol est lauréat de la compétition nationale "I-LAB" qui récompense les projets d'entrepreneuriats étudiants. Nous recevrons 5 000 € quand nous lancerons notre start-up en France. 
Cophenol Lauréat d'I-Lab

POURQUOI NOUS AIDER ?

En nous aidant, vous soutenez un projet dont le but est de préserver l’environnement pour nous et les générations futures.

Grâce à l'aide financière de la Greenhouse, nous avons pu payer les principales dépenses de ce voyage. Mais nous avons toujours besoin de financer nos déplacements au Brésil afin de pouvoir rencontrer plus de producteurs de café et de coopératives qui sont dispersés dans Minas Gerais et São Paulo.

Ensemble, nous pouvons faire un grand changement!

Suivez nous sur twitter, facebook et sur notre site internet cophenol.com

RÉCOMPENSES SPÉCIALES


                               

Mug Cophenol Collector  (20 dollars, remise en main propre gratuite sur Paris)  : Lorsque que vous boirez votre café dans cette tasse, vous vous souviendriez que vous soutenez un projet qui va rendre votre boisson préférée plus respectueuse de l'environnement.

                                               

Cadeau Cophenol aléatoire  (30 dollars, livraison gratuite en France). Pendant notre voyage, nous collectons de magnifiques et intéressants objets brésiliens (Cristaux de Minas Gerais, accessoires, gâteaux locaux, vêtements…) Si vous avez des suggestions, n'hésitez pas à nous demander !

 MISES A JOUR : 9 août 2015

Merci pour vos dons ! La semaine dernière, nous avons pu aller à Minas Gerais et parcourir environ 2 000 km pour rencontrer 2 coopératives, 2 producteurs de café et un torréfacteur. Nous avons récupérer environ 30 kilos de déchets de café que nous devront envoyer par colis en Europe pour continuer nos expériences.
Nous y retournerons dans une semaine afin de rencontrer d'autres producteurs de café ainsi que la fédération des coopératives de la région qui souhaite nous rencontrer. 
English Version

DO YOU KNOW WHERE THE COFFEE CAME FROM?

Billions of people in the world drink coffee everyday and most of them do not know how the coffee is produced. Coffee is a fruit that looks like a cherry and to produce the coffee that everyone drinks every day we only use  the bean, the remain (the pulp) is throw away in the environment, inducing important environmental impacts, for instance:

  • Coffee waste soil deposit can impoverish the soil, reducing his fertility (see the Embrapa study here)

  • Coffee waste disposal on the soil participates in global warming: coffee waste is usually decomposed by bacterial processes, releasing large amounts of greenhouse gases (methane, CO2 and N2O). Between 23 and 55 Megatons of methane per year are released in the atmosphere by the coffee waste (see the Oxford study here)

  • Coffee waste disposal in the rivers disturbing the ecosystem: as an organic material, coffee waste contains lot of nutrients, causing an increase of algae. Negative environmental effects include hypoxia, the depletion of oxygen in the water, which may cause death to aquatic animals and results in unpleasant smells (see the Environmental Monitoring and Assessment journal study here)

COPHENOL SOLUTION

Cophenol wants to prevent the damage caused by the coffee waste by creating a biorefinery near to the coffee plantations. The Cophenol solution will convert the coffee pulp into valuable chemicals products that can be used to make paper, plastic and biochar. The biochar is a type of natural fertilizer that we will to give to the coffee producer with no charge to enhance soil fertility and agricultural productivity. Inside a circular economy model, we see in the coffee waste an opportunity to implement the 5R model (reduce, recycle, replace, return, reuse) involving the local community on it.

WHERE ARE WE NOW ?

The results of our first experiments of the chemical process with the coffee waste as well as a preliminary study market encouraged us to continue forward the project.

The idea is to start in Brazil, in the states of Minas Gerais and Sao Paulo, due to the important coffee production and also due to the Brazilian scenario of competitiveness and market strategy.

Currently, the Cophenol team is in Brazil to meet with important stakeholders to succeed with Cophenol’s project: coffee producers, coffee cooperatives, local environmental and business organisation, coffee research centers and universities.

NOW OUR TEAM

Cophenol was born in 2014 inside a multicultural, multidisciplinary and very motivated team. From left to right

Emmanuel Thiéry (25 years old): is french and he has a neuroscience master's degree and a bachelor of physic and chemistry bachelor degree. He was been working inside our chemical process with Anna Suchy and is working our business, marketing and financial strategy. He has been leading the Cophenol project in some important competitions that help us financially and encourage us to continue the project.

Anna Suchy (25 years old): is a polish PhD student in theAberystwyth University, in Wales (UK). She is working with an important chemical process to convert organic waste into valuable products that we used in the case of coffee waste.

Pierre Eloi Gay (24 years old) : is a french ESSEC master degree student. He was in São Paulo for 7 months inside a mobility program. He has expertise on market studies and he is working in collaboration with us to help us to find brazilian potentials customers.

Mariana Bittencourt (30 years old): is a brazilian developing her PhD in France on Eco-innovations. She communicates with local stakeholders, including coffee producers and cooperatives that are crucial for our project. Moreover, she is in contact with Ministers, government and major institutions to prepare our implantation in Brazil.

OUR SUPPORT

Cophenol background has so far plenty of support and it is possible to mention some important start-up competition that we won  :


                        Cophenol was selected in the greenhouse of Paris, the pre-incubation

program of the Climate-KIC, the European Innovation structure that fight against climate change. We received 4000 euros and accompaniment by a coach from the Agoranov incubator.                                 

Cophenol was selected for the french final Global Social Venture Competition (GSVC). We received help from ESSEC master’s students and Florian buguet working in the consulting agency Deloitte to perform our business model.
http://www.gsvc-essec.org/cophenol/                                   

Cophenol was selected to by the French government start up competition named “I-LAB”. We will receive 5 000 € when we open the start up in France.
Lauréat I-Lab

WHY HELPING US IT IS IMPORTANT

Helping us you will be also supporting an important mitigation action to fight against the climate change. Furthermore you will allow us to create a social business in Brazil that could assist the country in the fight against social inequality.

Thanks to the financial help from the Climate Kic, we could deal with the main expenses of this travel. Unfortunately, we still need to deal with internal travel costs (car location, oil, bus), require to see the most as coffee cooperatives and producers as possible.

Together we can make a big change!

Follow us on twitter @cophenol and on our website cophenol.com

SPECIAL REWARDING

                              

Cophenol Mug (20 euros, given in person in paris)  : While you will be drinking your coffee in this mug, you will remember that you support a project that make your favorite beverage more environmental friendly.

                                                

Cophenol random present (30 euros, free delivery in France). During our trip, we will collect interesting and beautiful brazilian objects (stones, accessories, clothes…). If you have any requests, feel free to ask !


UPDATE 9th August 2015

Thank you for your donations! Last week, we were able to go to Minas Gerais and travel approximately 2,000 km to meet 2 cooperatives, 2 coffee producers and a roaster. We recover about 30 kilograms of coffee waste that we should send a package to Europe to continue our experiences.

We'll be back in a week to meet other coffee producers and the federation of cooperatives in the region who wants to meet us.

Elle travaille sur l’optimisation du processus chimique utilisé par Cophenol.Pierre Eloi Gay (24 ans, Français) est fraîchement diplômé de l’ESSEC. Il a étudié pendant sept mois à São Paulo et son expertise sur les études de marché nous aide à trouver des clients brésiliens potentiels.Mariana Bittencourt (30 ans, Brésilienne) est actuellement en thèse  sur les éco-innovations en France. Elle communique avec les parties prenantes locales du projet, notamment les coopératives et les producteurs de café qui sont cruciaux pour notre projet. De plus, elle est en contact avec les ministres, le gouvernement et les institutions importantes afin de préparer au mieux notre implantation au Brésil.COMPÉTITIONS GAGNÉESAu cours de son développement, Cophenol a reçu du soutien grâce à plusieurs compétitions de start-up gagnées :               Cophenol a été sélectionné dans la Greenhouse à Paris, qui est un programme de pré-incubation de la Climate-KIC, la structure européenne promeut les initiatives combattant le changement climatique. Nous avons reçu 4 000 € ainsi qu’un accompagnement par un coach de l'incubateur Agoranov.Cophenol a été sélectionné pour faire partie de la finale francophone de la Global Social Venture Competition (GSVC). Nous avons reçu l'aide d’étudiants en master à l'ESSEC et de Florian Buguet qui travaille dans le cabinet de conseil Deloitte afin d’améliorer notre business model.http://www.gsvc-essec.org/cophenol/Cophenol est lauréat de la compétition nationale "I-LAB" qui récompense les projets d'entrepreneuriats étudiants. Nous recevrons 5 000 € quand nous lancerons notre start-up en France. Cophenol Lauréat d'I-LabPOURQUOI NOUS AIDER ?En nous aidant, vous soutenez un projet dont le but est de préserver l’environnement pour nous et les générations futures.Grâce à l'aide financière de la Greenhouse, nous avons pu payer les principales dépenses de ce voyage. Mais nous avons toujours besoin de financer nos déplacements au Brésil afin de pouvoir rencontrer plus de producteurs de café et de coopératives qui sont dispersés dans Minas Gerais et São Paulo.Ensemble, nous pouvons faire un grand changement!Suivez nous sur twitter, facebook et sur notre site internet cophenol.comRÉCOMPENSES SPÉCIALES                               Mug Cophenol Collector  (20 dollars, remise en main propre gratuite sur Paris)  : Lorsque que vous boirez votre café dans cette tasse, vous vous souviendriez que vous soutenez un projet qui va rendre votre boisson préférée plus respectueuse de l'environnement.                                               Cadeau Cophenol aléatoire  (30 dollars, livraison gratuite en France). Pendant notre voyage, nous collectons de magnifiques et intéressants objets brésiliens (Cristaux de Minas Gerais, accessoires, gâteaux locaux, vêtements…) Si vous avez des suggestions, n'hésitez pas à nous demander ! MISES A JOUR : 9 août 2015
Merci pour vos dons ! La semaine dernière, nous avons pu aller à Minas Gerais et parcourir environ 2 000 km pour rencontrer 2 coopératives, 2 producteurs de café et un torréfacteur. Nous avons récupérer environ 30 kilos de déchets de café que nous devront envoyer par colis en Europe pour continuer nos expériences.Nous y retournerons dans une semaine afin de rencontrer d'autres producteurs de café ainsi que la fédération des coopératives de la région qui souhaite nous rencontrer. 
 English Version
DO YOU KNOW WHERE THE COFFEE CAME FROM?Billions of people in the world drink coffee everyday and most of them do not know how the coffee is produced. Coffee is a fruit that looks like a cherry and to produce the coffee that everyone drinks every day we only use  the bean, the remain (the pulp) is throw away in the environment, inducing important environmental impacts, for instance:Coffee waste soil deposit can impoverish the soil, reducing his fertility (see the Embrapa study here)
Coffee waste disposal on the soil participates in global warming: coffee waste is usually decomposed by bacterial processes, releasing large amounts of greenhouse gases (methane, CO2 and N2O). Between 23 and 55 Megatons of methane per year are released in the atmosphere by the coffee waste (see the Oxford study here)
Coffee waste disposal in the rivers disturbing the ecosystem: as an organic material, coffee waste contains lot of nutrients, causing an increase of algae. Negative environmental effects include hypoxia, the depletion of oxygen in the water, which may cause death to aquatic animals and results in unpleasant smells (see the Environmental Monitoring and Assessment journal study here)
COPHENOL SOLUTIONCophenol wants to prevent the damage caused by the coffee waste by creating a biorefinery near to the coffee plantations. The Cophenol solution will convert the coffee pulp into valuable chemicals products that can be used to make paper, plastic and biochar. The biochar is a type of natural fertilizer that we will to give to the coffee producer with no charge to enhance soil fertility and agricultural productivity. Inside a circular economy model, we see in the coffee waste an opportunity to implement the 5R model (reduce, recycle, replace, return, reuse) involving the local community on it.WHERE ARE WE NOW ?The results of our first experiments of the chemical process with the coffee waste as well as a preliminary study market encouraged us to continue forward the project.The idea is to start in Brazil, in the states of Minas Gerais and Sao Paulo, due to the important coffee production and also due to the Brazilian scenario of competitiveness and market strategy.Currently, the Cophenol team is in Brazil to meet with important stakeholders to succeed with Cophenol’s project: coffee producers, coffee cooperatives, local environmental and business organisation, coffee research centers and universities.NOW OUR TEAMCophenol was born in 2014 inside a multicultural, multidisciplinary and very motivated team. From left to rightEmmanuel Thiéry (25 years old): is french and he has a neuroscience master's degree and a bachelor of physic and chemistry bachelor degree. He was been working inside our chemical process with Anna Suchy and is working our business, marketing and financial strategy. He has been leading the Cophenol project in some important competitions that help us financially and encourage us to continue the project.Anna Suchy (25 years old): is a polish PhD student in theAberystwyth University, in Wales (UK). She is working with an important chemical process to convert organic waste into valuable products that we used in the case of coffee waste.Pierre Eloi Gay (24 years old) : is a french ESSEC master degree student. He was in São Paulo for 7 months inside a mobility program. He has expertise on market studies and he is working in collaboration with us to help us to find brazilian potentials customers.Mariana Bittencourt (30 years old): is a brazilian developing her PhD in France on Eco-innovations. She communicates with local stakeholders, including coffee producers and cooperatives that are crucial for our project. Moreover, she is in contact with Ministers, government and major institutions to prepare our implantation in Brazil.OUR SUPPORTCophenol background has so far plenty of support and it is possible to mention some important start-up competition that we won  :                        Cophenol was selected in the greenhouse of Paris, the pre-incubationprogram of the Climate-KIC, the European Innovation structure that fight against climate change. We received 4000 euros and accompaniment by a coach from the Agoranov incubator.                                 Cophenol was selected for the french final Global Social Venture Competition (GSVC). We received help from ESSEC master’s students and Florian buguet working in the consulting agency Deloitte to perform our business model.http://www.gsvc-essec.org/cophenol/                                   Cophenol was selected to by the French government start up competition named “I-LAB”. We will receive 5 000 € when we open the start up in France.Lauréat I-LabWHY HELPING US IT IS IMPORTANTHelping us you will be also supporting an important mitigation action to fight against the climate change. Furthermore you will allow us to create a social business in Brazil that could assist the country in the fight against social inequality.Thanks to the financial help from the Climate Kic, we could deal with the main expenses of this travel. Unfortunately, we still need to deal with internal travel costs (car location, oil, bus), require to see the most as coffee cooperatives and producers as possible.Together we can make a big change!Follow us on twitter @cophenol and on our website cophenol.comSPECIAL REWARDING                              Cophenol Mug (20 euros, given in person in paris)  : While you will be drinking your coffee in this mug, you will remember that you support a project that make your favorite beverage more environmental friendly.                                                Cophenol random present (30 euros, free delivery in France). During our trip, we will collect interesting and beautiful brazilian objects (stones, accessories, clothes…). If you have any requests, feel free to ask !UPDATE 9th August 2015Thank you for your donations! Last week, we were able to go to Minas Gerais and travel approximately 2,000 km to meet 2 cooperatives, 2 coffee producers and a roaster. We recover about 30 kilograms of coffee waste that we should send a package to Europe to continue our experiences.We'll be back in a week to meet other coffee producers and the federation of cooperatives in the region who wants to meet us.

story:
Natural Gas Leaks

Natural gas (aka methane) is pumped to our homes through pipes under the ground.

In NSTAR's territory, 17% of these pipes are over 60 years old and made of cast iron.  (And what happens to 60-year-old iron that's stuck in the damp earth?)

These pipes rust and corrode, leaking natural gas first into the soil, and from there into the atmosphere. 

These leaks are bad because: 

  • They are potentially explosive.  12 people were hurt in Dorchester when a house exploded on April 17th.  7 people died in Harlem on March 12th. 
  • They kill trees by suffocating their roots. The City of Brookline estimates the damage to its city trees at over $1 million.  Both Cambridge and Somerville are likely to have as much tree damage as Brookline. When a tree dies from a nearby gas leak, the tax-payers –rather than the utility–pay to remove the tree and plant a new one (which of course dies too). The municipality and nearby residents rarely suspect what is going wrong. 
  • Natural gas (or methane) is a powerful greenhouse gas 34 times more destructive than C02. The amount of natural gas being wasted through leaks in Cambridge and Somerville alone is equivalent to the annual emissions of over 10,000 passenger cars.
  • The utilities pass the cost of this waste onto everyone who pays for gas by factoring the lost gas into the price of the gas delivered. Conservation Law Foundation estimates the cost at $38 million per year in Massachusetts alone.  

Fixing the average leak, according to State Rep. Ehrlich, would recoup its cost through saved gas in under three years.  Leaks that are not considered potentially explosive never have to be repaired and so could be leaking wasted gas for decades.

The Plan

This summer, we will drive down every street in Cambridge and Somerville with a high-precision methane analyzer.

We will:

  1. Post the maps of the leaks so residents and the cities can work to address the issue. (Oct.)

  2. Pinpoint the very worst leaks and organize local residents to call these  leaks into the local utility once a day (so long as they still smell gas in the area).  By law, the utility has to arrive at the site of a reported leak within one hour and is fined heavily if the average response time rises over 30 minutes. Even if the utility finds a large leak, it doesn't have to fix it unless the utility believes it's potentially explosive. By calling in the worst leaks once a day, we will make it cheaper for the utility to fix these leaks rather than just keep responding. (Oct. - Nov.)

  3. Create a national website where any community can post a map of their leaks and organize citizens to call those leaks in until they are fixed. There are technical assistance grants offered by the government that can help a community pay for the cost of mapping their leaks. (March, 2015)

The Impact

  • Fix 10 of the worst leaks to save an expected $44,500 per year and the carbon emission equivalent of taking 500 passenger cars off the road for a year. 
  • Map, label and publicize at least 10 trees being killed by the leaks.  The clear visual proof of the damage, along with the estimated cost of the total damage to trees in both cities will help persuade both the residents and the municipalities this problem needs to be fixed.
  • Share the map of the leaks with Somerville and Cambridge so the cities can work effectively with the utilities.
  • Create a national website that allows local groups to find and fix the worst leaks in their communities.


The Team

HEET is an award-winning grassroots nonprofit based in Cambridge, Mass.  Since 2008, we've worked to help people reduce their energy bills and use of fossil fuels.  We're partnered with Green Cambridge on this campaign and have received assistance on it from Sierra Club and Clean Water Action. 

Audrey Schulman, HEET Co-founder, President

Audrey is an energy-efficiency expert, registered thermographer, and an experienced grassroots activist. 


Ashka Naik, LEED AP BD+C, HEET Executive Director

Before joining HEET, Ashka was the Director of ACUPCC Initiatives at Second Nature and worked at the Harvard University’s Office for Sustainability. She is a LEED Accredited Professional with a specialty in Building Design and Construction.


Lilah Morrissey, HEET Director of Outreach and Special Programs

Lilah is an expert in developing community-based programs and activities. Before joining HEET, Lilah served as the Marketing Director for both the Greater Cincinnati Energy Alliance and Cambridge Energy Alliance. 


Jason Taylor, HEET Energy Efficiency Expert

Jason has taught air-sealing at the ABCD WAGE program, Weatherization Bootcamps, Train the Trainer events, SMOC Green Jobs Academy, Mass Green Initiative, and Roxbury Community College. He has personally trained over 150 green jobs students who currently have jobs now. 

The program is sponsored by Green Cambridge.

The Budget

Together Boston University Professor Nathan Phillips (a renown expert in natural gas leaks) and Bob Ackley (a natural gas expert with 30 years of experience) have kindly donated $30,000 worth of expertise and equipment toward this project. 

These are the same experts who did the Boston andWashington natural gas leak mapping projects.  They have donated this time and expertise because they believe in our program and in HEET.

Thus, we've stripped our costs down to only:


Perks



Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate (even $10), then help us get word out to others by forwarding this link on to others. Getting the word out can help stop this dangerous waste of money, trees and fossil fuels.

story:
What is the project about?

Near the most Southerly point of Spain lies the basin of what once used to be the biggest wetland area in the Iberian Peninsula. The rivers that fed this laguna have been dammed, diverted and canalized to create agricultural land. This is considered to be one of the biggest ecological disasters of Spain as it has destroyed vast areas of habitat for the thousands of migrating birds that pass through the area every year.

         

In the past six months we have been exploring the underlying energy structure of this area. Geomancy is the art of tapping into the subtle layers of the land, connecting to the Essence and Spirit of the place.

We now wish to invite artists who are interested in

this type of work for a five day Earth healing event

in October, to explore and express the story of the

place, and inspire it with a new movement and

flow. We intend to do that through site specific

performance art, photography, installation in the

landscape and storytelling that arises from the

energy work we will do together in the dried up

basin.

This event will take place during the height of the Autumn migration period of birds back to Africa, allowing us to interact and witness the awesome association of the place with the Spirit of Birds.

 

 

Who we are?

Karmit, Stephen and Sophie have been preparing the the groundwork for this Earth healing event in October. For the past six months we have been working geomantically in the basin of the wetlands with a group of dedicated people. Please read about us and below you can read some of the profiles of the people who are joining our team in October. 

My name is Karmit EvenZur. I am a geomancer and shamanic practitioner. My work is about collaboration with the archetypal and creative forces of Nature as a form of environmental activism, personal growth and human development. www.inlove.org.uk

Stephen Knapp - Stephen is a passionate birder, ecologist and advocate of nature spirituality. For the past seven years Stephen has been immersed in the bird life of the area, particularly in and around the La Janda wetlands. Stephen worked for 25 years as a Nature Reserve Warden in the UK and as co-founder and Project Director for a nature reserve in the Atlantic Rainforest of south east Brazil. www.andaluciabirdtours.com

 Sophie Twiss - Artist, printmaker, Earth inspired dreamer. Sophie explores with vision and imagination the subtle layers of our world. ‘Working in La Janda has brought me a movement in my personal and creative processes, it is an area that resonates with my soul. Connecting to a landscape allows a learning from the earth, her passage through time, the vastness and richness of human experience.’ www.stwiss.net

 

 

How you can help?

From our geomantic explorations so far we see that the place calls for concious interaction, and responds to the openness we bring to it.  We wish to bring people, energy and movement to the place where the flow of water has been dammed, canalised and diverted to restore the balance.

Between the 8th - 12th of October 2012 we will be holding an Earth healing event in the basin of the laguna. During these 5 days we will work geomantically, birdwatch and engage in creative expression that arises individually and collectively in our group.

We are asking for your help to:

Provide financial support to offset the 450$ costs per participant. These funds cover tuition, housing, meals, and local transportation for the duration of the program.

Any additional funds we raise will go towards the exhibition of artwork produced, which will take place at the beginning of 2013.

The event is open to participants from all over the world.

 

 



Why is this project important to us and to the area?

Our two main objectives are:

1. To bring about balance and healing on an energetic level to an ecosystem that has been deeply scarred. We do this by developing our capacity to listen to the story of the place and working with the archetypal creative forces of Nature.

2. To prepare a body of artwork that reflects this healing process and can serve to raise public awareness for the important and sacred aspect of the wetlands.

        

           This creative and spiritual approach to

environmental activism can serve as an interesting

                      model for other projects.

            

 

 

To read more about the background and importance of the restoration of the wetlands:

http://andaluciabirdtours.com/277/

http://kevenzur.wordpress.com/2012/08/11/la-janda-wetlands/

 

 
 
 
                       

                          Inspired by the breathing system of La Janda,

                                                by Sophie Twiss.

 
 
 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can you get word out about our campaign to your friends?

Please use the Indiegogo share tools, and all your resources and help us spread the word.

If you want to stay in touch sign up to our newsletter by writing to us.

Many thanks!

                          Inspired by the breathing system of La Janda,

If you want to stay in touch sign up to our newsletter by writing to us.
Many thanks!

story:
GMOs - Kids Right to Know Walk

The Walk is an initiative by 13 year old Rachel to create awareness about our Right to Know what’s in our food.  Scientists and Doctors have warned that genetically modified organisms (GMOs) in our food pose irreversible long term risks to our health and the environment.  The Walk will take place at 10 am on Saturday, Nov. 3rd from Dundas Square (33 Dundas St. E.) to St. Lawrence Market (95 Front St.)

Please join Rachel, Kids and Parents welcome!

 

Goal 

To raise funds to cover the costs of coordinating the Kids Right to Know Walk in support of California’s Proposition 37 to label GMO foods and to increase awareness (particularly children) about the dangers of unlabeled genetically modified foods (GMOs) that unsuspecting parents are feeding their families every day.  Foods from companies such as Kellogg’s, Kraft, Sara Lee, McCains, Nestle, and Frito-Lay, just to name a few.

 

Story 

Rachel has devoted years now to writing and speaking about GMO’S (see YouTube).  She believes that the planet is facing a real crisis!  Monsanto, by creating GMOs is trying to re-invent nature, with the potential to completely devastate our entire eco system.  She’s worried that her future won’t include any natural foods.  She’s also worried about the health risks GMOs pose, including allergies, Irritable Bowel Syndrome, autism, cancer, and reproductive disorders to name a few.  This has motivated her to speak and educate kids and families in Canada.  Her hope is that a well informed public will pressure the government, the media, and the multinational food manufacturers to do the right thing by labeling GMO foods, giving consumers the right to choose.  Hopefully, this will lead to consumer rejection of these products, and ultimately the complete elimination of GMOs, before it’s too late!

 

Rachel’s a grade 8 student, an animal lover, environmentalist and a healthy planet watchdog.
story_txt:
GMOs - Kids Right to Know Walk
The Walk is an initiative by 13 year old Rachel to create awareness about our Right to Know what’s in our food.  Scientists and Doctors have warned that genetically modified organisms (GMOs) in our food pose irreversible long term risks to our health and the environment.  The Walk will take place at 10 am on Saturday, Nov. 3rd from Dundas Square (33 Dundas St. E.) to St. Lawrence Market (95 Front St.)
Please join Rachel, Kids and Parents welcome!
 
Goal 
To raise funds to cover the costs of coordinating the Kids Right to Know Walk in support of California’s Proposition 37 to label GMO foods and to increase awareness (particularly children) about the dangers of unlabeled genetically modified foods (GMOs) that unsuspecting parents are feeding their families every day.  Foods from companies such as Kellogg’s, Kraft, Sara Lee, McCains, Nestle, and Frito-Lay, just to name a few.
 
Story 
Rachel has devoted years now to writing and speaking about GMO’S (see YouTube).  She believes that the planet is facing a real crisis!  Monsanto, by creating GMOs is trying to re-invent nature, with the potential to completely devastate our entire eco system.  She’s worried that her future won’t include any natural foods.  She’s also worried about the health risks GMOs pose, including allergies, Irritable Bowel Syndrome, autism, cancer, and reproductive disorders to name a few.  This has motivated her to speak and educate kids and families in Canada.  Her hope is that a well informed public will pressure the government, the media, and the multinational food manufacturers to do the right thing by labeling GMO foods, giving consumers the right to choose.  Hopefully, this will lead to consumer rejection of these products, and ultimately the complete elimination of GMOs, before it’s too late!
 
Rachel’s a grade 8 student, an animal lover, environmentalist and a healthy planet watchdog.

story:
THE BOUNDLESS BALI EXPERIENCE

Hello!

My name is Fatsuma. I am a student in my last year of college and ready to conquer the world! I have always had a passion for music and have recently discovered I want to continue this passion by becoming a record producer. But there is another passion I have as well.

I have recently applied, and have been accepted to, a unique opportunity to go on a journey called the Boundless Bali Experience. This journey is designed to help people fully open themselves, discover who they are, and become the leaders the truly strive to be. This experience is not a vacation, or a retreat, rather it is a journey to help me become the leader and become the wholehearted person I am striving to become, with Bali as my classroom.

I have been exploring a more spiritual path for many months now and I have opened and changed my perspective on many things in life itself.  Through this journey I have been realizing many things.  This world we live in needs help, a lot of HELP.  We are all going after something to make us feel better, whole, accepted, loved, etc. and we don't even realize it.  We fight, hurt, steal, kill, backstab just to get ahead of the game or make it in the world, or just get our boss to notice us so we can get a promotion because we don't have enough. We are hurting each other in so many ways that we have lost sight of who we are, which is ONE.

We are all the same, we are all connected. When someone hurts, we can feel the pain, when someone laughs, we light up a little. I believe order to help the world in any way we can, we also have to help ourselves.  As we begin to realize this, and make changes that can positively affect ourselves, we are ultimately positively affecting the world.

It may seem illogical that helping the world through yourself is possible, it may even seem selfish, but stay with me here.  How do you expect to help a friend who is depressed, or upset about something when you yourself are depressed? How can you help the environment become greater and help the healing of mankind when you don't take action or are consumed with bitter or resentful feelings towards someone?

I believe that since we are all connected in some way, as we each improve for the better,  not materialistically or financially, but wholeheartedly, becoming our true selves, with the basis being GIVING, we in effect, help the world become better as well.

THIS IS WHAT MY OTHER PASSION IS AND THIS IS WHY I AM DOING THIS FUNDRAISER

This journey helps people become the leaders that can help change the world.

 I am truly honored and blessed to have been accepted and have felt the calling want to go on this journey. This journey is created to better those who embark it and become the best they can be I want to help this world. This is what this journey is about. It is an 11 1/2 day transformational, experiential, immersion journey to Bali were 21 people from around the  WORLD, yes, THE WORLD, who believe that
there is more than this chaos, that there is a way to contribute to this world in some way, can learn and find out how they themselves can become fully whole hearted and giving so they can become leaders and help the world in some way.

 

I want to help this world. I don't know how; maybe it will be through my music, or another means, but I know this journey will help me transform into the being that can make a positive impact and contribution to this world.

I ask anyone who reads this to please help me with reaching this goal in this fundraiser. I am looking for support for this journey and anyone who is able to support me! You can donate whatever amount you have. Your single act of giving will also not only bring positive effects to me, but yourself and the world. The slightest act helps, its baby steps that can make  a movement.

If you cannot contribute anything, and if you have any other ideas for help I am more than welcome to accept those as well.  I will truly appreciate any help. If you can pass this on I would be even more grateful as well.  I would really love the support from anyone! Thank you!

 

With Much Love,

 

Fatsuma A.

 

Now that I have told you about this Journey,  I have posted links below to give you more information not only to show you what this journey is about but also what others who have been on this journey say as well!

 http://www.boundlessblissbali.com/#

http://www.boundlessblissbali.com/thejourney.php

http://www.boundlessblissbali.com/location.php

And what others have said!- http://www.boundlessblissbali.com/testimonials.php

What We Need & What You Get

This fundraiser is made to  assist me with the costs of Tuition, Accommodations, Food, and Transport/Travel. the total cost of the trip is $15,000 and I have already started saving and raising money in other ways, but I have broken down the costs below.

Tuition- $10,00

Accommodation- $900

Food/ Transport-$800

Airfare- $3000

If I do not reach My goal, I still plan to go on this journey, I am still finding any way possible to make it there, and this money will go towards it!

For specific amounts raised, I will have perks alongside them! they could be thank you emails, letters, videos, actual souveniers from Bali. Please See My Perks!

What We Need & What You Get
This fundraiser is made to  assist me with the costs of Tuition, Accommodations, Food, and Transport/Travel. the total cost of the trip is $15,000 and I have already started saving and raising money in other ways, but I have broken down the costs below.

story:
You can still donate by choosing one of the matching options listed on the right!

Check out our fundraising thermometer below to see how your donation helps us reach our BIG goal!

Match a grassroots movement to fight climate change.

Every spring, Canadian tree planters prove that there is hope in the face of climate change.

Not just by planting trees, as important as that is, but by acting in solidarity with people halfway around the world who struggle with climate change every day. 

In partnership with Community Forests International (Forests Intl.), hardworking young Canadians are raising funds for Pemba - a threatened island off the coast of East Africa.

Pemban communities are fighting climate change by restoring their forests and so much more. Canadian tree planters are giving their hard-earned wages to support this hopeful mission and we are asking you to match their generosity.

Supporting people directly affected by climate change to take bold action is one of the most important things that we can do to help. 

Please consider joining this effort by giving a portion of your day's earnings to Pemba and help us grow our impact!

 

Every dollar raised goes to Pemba, times four!

Every dollar raised goes directly to Pemba. Campaign partners Brinkman and Associates Reforestation have generously covered the overhead costs for this fundraiser so 100% of your donation supports on the ground work in Pemba.

AND every dollar raised is multiplied by four. Forests Intl. worked hard to secure a partnership with the Global Climate Change Alliance that effectively quadruples all funds raised for Pemba. Now we need your support to maximize this great opportunity.
 

Our shared challenge.

Climate change affects us all, just not all equally. Finding common ground, matching one good act with another, and sharing in the hard work of positive change is how we build a more hopeful future. Please join us!

Changes in rainfall, sea level rise, and warming are negatively impacting Pemba Island.

 

Your donation supports innovation.

Forests Intl. fights climate change by empowering rural communities to thrive with nature. Funds from this campaign will help Pemban communities pursue forest innovations including mangrove restoration, spice forests, community land rights, and more.

 

Mangrove Forests

Working with nature to build resilience to climate change.

Mangove forests hug Pemba’s coastline, surrounding the island with a “bioshield” of trees that live half on the land and half in the sea. Their strong interlocking roots hold soils in place against waves and flooding and provide important habitat for fish and other wildlife.

Mangrove forests are a nature's defense against rising seas but are threatened globally. This year, Forests Intl. will launch a mangrove restoration program in Pemba and work alongside five coastal communities to replant and conserve mangroves in areas affected by illegal cutting.

 

Spice Forests

Can we have our conservation and eat it too?

Our team helps farmers innovate by combining spice growing with forest restoration. A "spice forest" is a jungle of trees and vines all producing edible spices – things like cinnamon, black pepper, cloves, and cardamom – in a way that is both profitable and resilient to climate change.

The spice forest program is quickly growing and now involves over 100 farmers! This year we will help farmers expand and market their produce by establishing a fairtrade cooperative and building an R & D nursery to grow special trees and new spice varieties.

 

Community Forests

Empowered communities are the restorative force that world needs.

Forests Intl. has transferred over 100 hectares of land to community ownership to date. This land security is crucial for rural communities – empowering them to make long-term decisions about how their land and forests are managed and protected.

This year, Forests Intl. will help six new Pemban communities gain legal title to their community land and support investments in climate change resilience efforts like forest protection and restoration.

 

Forests Intl.'s tree planting roots.

Community Forests International was founded in 2008 by four young Canadian tree-planters.

We believe that people around the world can innovate their own solutions to some of the toughest challenges. And when we find a solution that really works, we are committed to giving communities the tools and training they need to get it off the ground.  Together we change the world.

Forests Intl. is a registered charity and all donations of $25 or more will receive a charitable receipt.

For more on Forests Intl. and the communities we work with visit  www.forestsinternational.org and follow us on Facebook.

 

Thank you!

A big thanks to all the tree planters that make our work possible, and to Brinkman & Associates Reforestation for covering the costs associated with this fundraiser. Tuko pamoja - we are together.

story:
Project Cats

PawsLikeMe invites cats to the pet matching family

Crowdfunding Indiegogo


Summary

In 2015, PawsLikeMe helped over two million people connect with adoptable dogs using the first ever human-to-pet matching algorithm. In 2016, we need your support to finalize the algorithm that will allow us to match deserving felines nationwide to the families that need them most.

 

What is PawsLikeMe pet matching?

PawsLikeMe uses a short and easy personality quiz to match people with adoptable dogs from shelters and rescue groups across the country. The quiz is powered by a scientifically proven matching algorithm that we developed which assesses and scores a person’s lifestyle, environment and preferences as they pertain to dog ownership. We identified four core personality quadrants which closely influence the human and canine bond: Energy, Focus, Independence and Confidence. We completed Beta testing of this algorithm in 2014. More than 3,000 people participated in our study and the average accuracy reported was over 90%.

 

The original algorithm was developed by Coleen Johnston, DVM and animal behavior expert, and Marianna Benko, a licensed clinical social worker and super cat fan. So what appears simple on the surface, is actually a carefully designed system that incorporates 30 years of combined experience.


For the last few months, our team has designed the inner workings of a cat algorithm, and now we need your support to build and implement it into PawsLikeMe.com; bringing to market, the first people/feline compatibility assessment to match you with the perfect cat.

 


Why is this project important?

 

Relationships Matter

Like any successful relationship, compatibility plays a crucial role in forming long-lasting bonds between pets and people. PawsLikeMe embraces the importance of recognizing the individuality of all species with which we cohabitate – because personality is truly more than fur deep. The traditional characteristics of breeds barely skim the surface when we consider that over 75% of cats and dogs acquired in the U.S. are mixed-breed. Even within a litter of purebred puppies or kittens, not one will be quite like the other.

PawsLikeMe’s adoption website serves a pet loving community and supports animal welfare efforts by expanding our understanding of the complex factors that contribute to our common bond with pets. We are dedicated to creating a map from you to dogs or cats in need that are most likely to result in a fulfilling and long-term relationship.

 Pawsonality eBook

Pawsonality Bound Book


Re-homing Program

In addition to matching, cats will also become eligible for our re-homing program that offers pet owners who can no longer keep their pets, a free pet posting and marketing service as an alternative to shelter surrender. The program empowers owners to responsibly find their pet a new home that will be long lasting.

 

Support for Animal Welfare

PawsLikeMe supports animal welfare, as well as the no-kill movement, which works towards a future where pets no longer have to be homeless. Our Founders have backgrounds in animal rescue and we believe in creating positive social change that makes a difference in our communities.

With the addition of cats, all our Partner Organizations will receive free Adoption Kits for all their adopted pets. The kits include 30 to 60-days of pet insurance coverage that offers adopters more security in case of unexpected medical expenses. The kit also includes awesome gifts from our pet product sponsors, to help every pet adoption start off on the right paw. In fact, a portion of all of PawsLikeMe’s profits directly benefit our animal shelter and rescue group partners nationwide.

 


Shelter Kiosks will bring our services into all participating shelters

If we surpass our $15,000 goal, we’ll use all the extra money to install PawsLikeMe kiosks into shelters! The kiosks match adopters to pets inside the shelter, and implement the re-homing program directly into the shelter’s intake procedure for surrendered pets – offering an immediate alternative to owners who want to take advantage of this assistance.


 We want this community to be about learning, giving and positive social change.

We hope you choose to support and join our mission to help people and pets lead happier lives together; in a community where behavioral science, technology and innovation bring new insights to our pet relationships.

Don’t cats make the prrrrrfect addition?!

 

 Want to find a cat with the right purr-sonality for you? Back our/@pawslikeme’s @indiegogo campaign meow


Campaign Perks

T-Shirts (available in red, light blue, dark blue, purple, pink, grey, black, orange, wine)


Frisbee - Personality is more thn fur deep


Hardcover, high-gloss Bound Book
