story:
Short Summary

My name Is Romane Simon i am from Haiti, as haitian i know how it feels to be hungry, to need clean water or place to live, i was born in a politic family, my grandfather is a former president of haiti, his name was (Antoine Simon) i always love helping kids, when i was 13 years old i would go out to the street and find kids on the street bring them home to my parents, years later i moved to florida  then move to Hollywood Ca to become a filmmaker, after the Tragic earthquake, i cried like baby to see all these people died, not forget parents left their kids on the street in need of food, clean water and place to live, i feel like i have to do something about it, but i will not be able to do it without you, please help me bring a smile to these kids face,

What We Need & What You Get

When you donate, you dont just donate. You create a future for a child that is less fortunate then you and you show those children that there is someone out there that cares very much for them. You have help build a children’s life!

we set up different perks, only God can repay you for helping these kids, below are few things we have to offer

T-shirt, Jacket, Hats, Letters, and access to communicate with the kids via skype

The goal is to raise 10k, even if we don't reach the Goal, whatever i raise will still be able to help the kids every dollar count, they need our help and support, i know we can''t help all of them i wish i could, but we can do what we can, well let do our part, thank you may God bless you

The Impact

about my campaign and how your contribution will make a difference:

i never done this before raising money on indiegogo to help the kids, i always do it alone, a friend of mine told me to try indiegogo, well here i am,

i am trying to raise 20,000 dollars, with that money i will be able to help a group of kids by providing them with food, clean water, and Tent to stay, i really really need you help to help this kids,

Other Ways You Can Help

if you can't contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

please help to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.

you can share this Indiegogo link, thank you for you help

may God bless you

story:
Short Summary

Ithaca Forest Preschool is a new program through Primitive Pursuits, an environmental education organization affiliated with Cornell Cooperative Extension of Tompkins County.  This program serves children ages 3-5, helping youth to connect with the natural world at an early age.  

  • Primitive Pursuits works daily to achieve a cultural intervention that will bring back into our modern lives a necessary and healthy relationship with the natural world and within our human communities. We envision a world where each child may once again grow up with the freedom to explore undeveloped nature and access to the knowledge which allows them to care for themselves, their communities and the environment.
  • The goal of this campaign is to renovate a pavilion that is currently the home site of Ithaca Forest Preschool.  These renovations would allow the Forest Preschool to run all year round, providing kids with a rustic, warm shelter in the woods during the cold winter months. 

  • Keeping youth comfortable outside during all four seasons is essential to facilitating a meaningful connection to the natural world.  Although we try to keep our programs 100% outdoors, renovating the pavilion will allow us to keep kids in an outdoor setting, yet provide a solid shelter so they can have some respite from the elements.  

What We Need & What You Get

  • Tucked in a small valley in the woods of 4-H Acres sits a well-loved and well-worn pavilion, which has been graced by many Primitive Pursuits campers and 4H youth participants over the years.  Long have the laughter and peels of excitement rung out from its rustic open walls.  Its floor has seen many a curl of wood shavings from craft projects, fiber from cordage, and rocks for face painting.
  • When we reach our goal we will be able to put windows, exterior siding, insulation, a new wood floor and interior walls to bring to life our humble little pavilion.  When finished, it will look something like this. 
  • The renovations for the pavilion have been quoted at $10,000.  All of the funds from this campaign will go directly towards the construction of this project. 
  • We have three amazing perks for folks who decide to donate!  Please check them out and contact us if you have any questions.

The Impact

  • These days, there’s plenty of talk about the importance of getting youth into the outdoors and the need to renew our connections to nature. At Ithaca Forest Preschool, we believe the best time to start is in early childhood, when the mind is absorbent and brain and behavior patterns are first being established. If it’s true that the “naturalist intelligence” identified by “multiple intelligences” guru Howard Gardner is really our most basic form of intelligence, underlying all the others, don’t we want our children to develop this early and often?
  • The renovations for this pavilion will go beyond Ithaca Forest Preschool and can serve any 4H program in Tompkins County.  This is an effort on the part of Primitive Pursuits to give back to 4H Acres, the land that has served our programs so well over the years.  
  • Primitive Pursuits has been running youth mentoring and environmental education programs for over a decade.  Every year, over 800 youth in the Ithaca area benefit from our programs.  Please visit our website at PrimitivePursuits.com to get a better idea of what we are all about! 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share this campaign with your friends and families! We can't do it without you.  
  • Contact our office with any questions: primitivepursuits@cornell.edu, 607-272-2292
  • "Like" us on Facebook.

"Like" us on Facebook.

story:
Women and transgender people have been central to the fight against the Keystone XL pipeline in Texas and Oklahoma, yet often we find ourselves on the margins of the organizations we've been working with.

Those of us who have been involved in the KXL fight out here will be gathering this week for a TWAQ (Trans, Women, and Queers) summit where we will come together to celebrate our resiliency, deepen our relationships with one another, honor our collective pain, participate in trainings, and strategize for the fight ahead. 

Demonstrate your support for women and transgender people with a generous donation toward our fundraising goal of $1,000 for the TWAQ summit.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Introduction

  • We are Art and Maggie Dutton and our fledgling co-operative group also includes our partner John Hardman.  
  • Before retirement Art was an environmental consultant working for large oil companies in northern Alberta.  Prior to 2004 he was an inspector for Alberta Environment and the states of North Carolina and Maine. 
  • Art was also a development consultant for various rural real estate projects in Maine, insuring compliance with environmental permits. 
  • Maggie's career included commercial and retail property management, small business management and the creation of affordable housing programs in Calgary.
  • Maggie has participated on the boards of a number of non-profits. 
  • As an early champion of the Sociocracy movement Maggie provides educational materials on this dynamic governance model.
  • John Hardman spent many years as a procurement specialist in Calgary, retiring early.  He and Maggie took on the Food Truck business at Piapot Landing, selling ice cream, hot dogs and Panini Sandwiches to travelers.

Brief Description of Campaign to SAVE TREES

  • When we first acquired the property in 2009 we thought to operate the food concessions in the summer and if funds permitted or in the future, we hoped to resurrect the campground and the infrastructure needed to be licensed to operate.  The plan would have the profits from the rental of RV sites available to take care of the trees.
  • Unfortunately Art had to retire 2 years early and we have had to go "all in" just to get through this period.  This has left us without sufficient funds to construct a bath house facility and upgrade water, sewer and power. 
  • We feel responsible for the stewardship of this much needed wildlife habitat.  We also enjoy being there ourselves so much that rather than sell it to some pipe yard outfit, we propose the creation of a Co-operative Membership RV community that will have title as soon as we have attracted 6 members.  
  • There is lots more information on our website at www.PiapotLanding.com
  • Without the support of the surrounding communities, the trucking industry, friends and members, this rare historical paradise will fall further into neglect. This year we have been unable to haul our water trailer and so the trees are not getting sufficient water.  

What We Need & What You Get

  • Both money and energy beyond our means are needed to save Piapot Landing for future generations.
  • Funding of early development costs such as installation of a water source and septic field are needed.  There is currently a 1000 gal holding tank and a porta potty.
  • We need funding to place appropriate ads in magazines appealing to those with RV's who go camping and may be looking for seasonal, long terms spots.
  • A deposit of $10,000 on a conditional offer to purchase the land.  
  • The buy-in funds of 25 Members at $15,000 each will be held until the start of site development, likely spring of 2015.  These funds will be dedicated to delivery of services to each site.  A community bank account will be opened with 3 signatures.
  • Pre-Development costs for management and consultants over the next few months are estimated to be
  • 430,000 with some of that amount being raised from lot member commitments.

How can you Help?

  • You can help according to your means and interest.   Perhaps you already stop to enjoy a rest at Piapot Landing or you just want to do your part for the environment.  
  • Those who adopt existing trees and bushes will get public recognition for playing a part in supporting our efforts.   Imagine having your Corporate Name on a plaque on a large tree?
  • RV Equity Members will create a unique community experience where everyone has a say in how the Park is operated.
  • You may never get to experience this magical place but you can become an associate member and follow our progress.
  • Even if we don't reach our entire goal in the allotted time we will be spending the rest of 2014 and the winter of 2015 recruiting RV Equity members. Initial funds received will benefit the trees directly, first by providing them a stable source of WATER.

Your contribution will make the difference in the viability of this little ecosystem that so many wild life creatures depend on.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk is to the environment.  Without water the trees are dying.  Here it is mid-August and leaves are falling because they are so dry.  We have hauled 5 gal containers this year and watered the smaller transplanted trees by hand, but it is not enough.  Without people to care about them by pruning, weeding, transplanting and enjoying them they will not flourish. 

As community builders with property development experience we can build it and they will come.  All that is needed is some start-up funds.

  • In concert with this Campaign we will be sharing our plans with a large network of colleagues.  
  • We have recorded details and contact information for a large number of Trucking Companies this year whose drivers have made use of the parking lot.  We will be asking the President or CEO of each one for their support by adopting a tree.  Our parking lot has seemed like a public rest stop for many years and has had a lot of abuse with drivers enjoying it without cost. It is time to ask for their help with funds raised going towards parking lot improvements.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help financially please share our campaign with your network.

Thanks for your interest.

Maggie Dutton.

story:
I am in love with the sea.

Diving a coral reef is to gain entry to a world of wonders. In 10 years of diving, I've had the privilege to watch moray eels and groupers hunting together; giant manta rays playing in scuba bubbles; curious sharks making close passes; sea turtles who find you endlessly fascinating; and so much more.

It'a no exaggeration to say coral reefs have changed my life.

But here's the sad part:

Coral reefs are the world's most endangered ecosystems.

Coral reefs are declining worldwide. 

Little Cayman is a rare and spectacular exception.

The Central Caribbean Marine Institute (CCMI) combines hard-core science, education and conservation -- not only for Little Cayman's future well-being, but for reefs everywhere.

And with an eye to the future, CCMI introduces Caymanian schoolchildren to the endless wonders of the sea around them.

In addition to making me deliriously happy, your generous gift will go directly to CCMI's program to:

  • Bring three classes of public schoolchildren (60 kids in all) from Grand Cayman to Little Cayman, to spend 3 days at the Research Center.
  • Offer a mix of hands-on and classroom sessions on ecology and conservation.
  • Infuse in these children a newfound love for the ocean and a lifelong commitment to protect it.

And to top it all off, all donations you make on this site will be matched dollar-for-dollar.

Home Stretch

With the match, the 12K we need to raise here completes a $50,000 fund to make these experiences possible. With your help, the first group will arrive at the Research Station in September 2015.

The future's up to these kids

This country (the Cayman Islands) belongs to the Caymanian people. At the end of the day, it will be up to them to save these marine treasures that are such a unique and precious part of their - and our - world. If you want to get some idea of the effect these experiences have on schoolchildren, WATCH THE VIDEO!

From the Bottom of my Saltwater Heart, THANK YOU!
